text: Had an outing with the girl's, and it was great first time here and I'll definitely be going back. Great food!!!! The Duce  itself is quite different,  but food. I recommend it
Unique environment. Good food (meatball and brisket sliders) and lemonade cocktails on a sunny fall afternoon.
I love this place! I think it's totally yummy and fun!!! The staff is 100% rad. I felt like I was at this amazing place with all types of neat secrets~ kinda like home sweet home;)

My first trip to the Duce was to see the Scandalesque show there.  I had no idea what to expect, which was good, because I would have been wrong.

Inside The Duce, you'll find the following:  a very casual restaurant, a boxing ring, a vintage (REAL vintage, not the fake-vintage hipster fodder) clothing store, an ice cream bar, a tiny boutique-ish grocery area, a caf√©, and (coming soon) a pie shop.

I can only review the restaurant part. The dining area has walls, but no ceiling, making the atmosphere interesting. It also made the atmosphere REALLY COLD ... half of the propane heaters weren't turned on.  The menu is small, with mostly brunch items and sliders, but they do have a few salads and larger plates.  The salads our group ordered were delicious, and the sliders were original and surprisingly fresh. I also had a side of their homemade beans and cole slaw.  The beans seemed to be sweetened with maple syrup to the point where I almost couldn't finish them.  The slaw was just flat-out odd; I still have no idea what was in it.  But it was also incredibly tasty! 

On the down side, I think the management is still trying to figure out how to run the place; they seemed overwhelmed by the crowd even before it got very crowded.   But I have faith that this will work itself out. Parking is pretty sparse, but this is downtown; you should expect that. And some of the pricing on the menu doesn't make any sense:  a gourmet salad was only $5, but a tiny dollop of baked beans was $3.50? I hope they make some adjustments soon.

Great concept, poor delivery.  This place is very confusing.  We went on a Wednesday around 7:00 p.m.  When we entered, we weren't sure if I needed to wait to be seated or find our own table.  There are very few tables, most seat 8 to 10 people and are very large picnic style.  There is no wait staff. We eventually found our way to the bar,  The bartender told us he could take our order, but it would be better to go to the "girl" standing by the trailer.  We ordered at the bar.  It took about 30 minutes to get our food, as advertised.  They call your name over a loud speaker to  pick up your food at the trailer.  There are no signs where to pick up.  The cook finally yelled to us to go to the back of the trailer.

We had the Mac and Cheese muffins, chicken pot pie in the jar and maple ribs.  The mac and cheese muffins were very bland.  The chicken pot pie was just okay.  The ribs were covered in sauce which seemed to hide the real favor of the rib.

This place is trying to be a trendy, hipster place, but got lost along the way. The boxing ring and clothing store are great concepts to help entertain.  Staff up, put in seating for smaller parties and revisit the menu.
The food here is amazing. They also make great drinks! I wish they had live music though

I wish I had read the reviews of the Duce before agreeing to meet loved ones there for brunch.  The reviews would have told me everything I needed to know.  Rude, inattentive staff, confusing lay out, ridiculously priced drinks, and good food if they aren't out of it.  $12 for a bloody mary?  I don't think they even charge that at the Jade Bar at Sanctuary.  We should have gone to Windsor which has $5 bloody marys for brunch.  No wonder we were the ONLY people eating brunch. I was infuriated with the lackadaisical attitude of the order takers and the "cooler than thou" vibe of the bartender...wow...muddling an olive into "organic" vodka is really cool! and the fact that there was no effort at all to assist navigating the confusing layout.  Drinks and food from separate areas..just a clusterf*** of a concept.  I don't think the owner is reading these reviews because the only thing that is constant is how bad the service is.  I will never waste another dime there.
Great times and drinks. Their pancake event that happened earlier this year was not very good. The pancakes were not fully cooked and they only had two people cooking.

Ended up at the duce on NYE right before the ball dropped. They were serving hot cereal, Skillet scrambles, baked pancakes and hot coffee drinks along with all the other goodies they create in their 65' Airstream trailer turned kitchen and cocktails from behind the bar of what the owner told us used to service Chicagoans before, during and after prohibition. 

This place is to cool for school.  Everybody that worked there was donned in pajamas, robes and slippers as were many of what appeared to be "duce regulars".

 Food, cocktails, old school gym, amazing clothing store, ping pong, shuffle board and corn hole...or as they call it..."duce bag". 

best NYE ever!!!

A Trip Down Alice's Rabbit Hole,....

My first beer was literally spent just trying to take in what was before my eyes.  This is a place not to be judged by it's cover.  Upon entering this shanty with a vague sense of hesitation, I was immediately overwhelmed by the insanity of colors, objects, and decorum that resided behind the door.  

After my senses calmed and I started to focus on specifics, the classic tunes were the final cap to an overall very unique and enjoyable atmosphere.  One in which you have absolutely no choice but to smile.

The fact that the place makes you smile probably has something to do with the fact that everyone, and i mean everyone looked to be having a good time.  I'm a people watcher by nature, so noticed which people were initially interacting.  As the evening progressed, the canned music and karaoke actually spawned a ton of intermingling of the group, random couples dancing, a couple of trains, and a whole ton of fun for all.

This is truly an atmosphere that welcomes all, old and young.....I saw everyone of all ages, up to, I swear, a 90 something with a walker.....who was sporting that smile I mentioned previously.

The staff, amazing....friendly and professional, and will remember your name if you give it.  They clearly show this is an establishment built on love.....The only thing I noticed that was a negative, mentioned as a warning for your mind before hand, there can be a bit of a wait for the drinks......Why?.....they are hand made, and i don't mean poured from a bottle, hand made,.....i mean, if you order a greyhound, the bartender hand squeezes the grapefruit fresh from a basket.  I saw a couple that had to wait a bit in line for their drinks, you could see a bit of frustration for the wait.  However, upon tasting their drinks, each one was well satisfied.  One man said, 'OMG, this is perfect.'  another lady said, 'this is true heaven, whats in here?'  So tolerate a wait if you must, because you won't be disappointed.  The reason, told to me by the Carol, the mother of the owner, they use all fresh, local grown produce in everything....They make it all, nothing comes from a bottle, from salad dressing on up.  The booze is organic if they can get it.

Hopes this helps, and please, stop driving by it and wondering if it is some kind of weird flee market.  Before you walk in the door, leave everything that is bothering you there, step through looking for a good time, and I promise you will find it.

I'm not looking to go back, despite a few positives.  This place just wasn't for me - some of that is on me, some of it's on the place.

The place is trying really hard to be different and doing in a way that all looks the same.

Beer list was overpriced and awful.  I'm OK with that though, because they had a good list of mixed drinks.  Cheap beer in cans at a large markup or crafted cocktails.  That is what this place does and I don't mind paying for a cocktail.  Except most of the cocktails tasted were just too sweet or not really well balanced.  Also, while I get trying to keep up with that whole mason jar retro thing that used to be interesting - if you are hand crafting cocktails then you should put some care into how you serve them.  Glassware makes a difference.

Another thing that makes a difference is having bartenders that actually seem like they care to take your drink order - I just couldn't find one and it's a huge part of the reason why we left.  Our group went 3 rounds and each one took forever.  Not only to get the bartenders attention when you are pretty much the only one there waiting, but to have them actually made.

Another reason for leaving was that the seating was flat out uncomfortable.  Again, I get the vintage project feel they were going for.  It just isn't enjoyable.  There is a reason why those designs were left rust.  

The parking, as mentioned by many others, is awful.

It was nice sitting outside.  It was a very open space.  If you enjoy dancing there was a large area for it with people actually dancing.  Although poorly executed there is potential to have a decent cocktail scene.  There is a pretty diverse scene there.

However, so much of that space brings no function to actually enhancing what I want when going out for drinks with friends.

A gift shop with other novelties - yeah, no.

A boxing ring? - I love boxing, but pointless other than to say that you have a boxing ring.

Ping Pong, cornhole, etc?  Sure - I've been known to play at bars that have these things - just not that many options to play for such a large space and watching strangers play games isn't exactly as fun as playing yourself.

That weird retro kitchen art type installation - again, why?

The place can get away with a lot of these space wasters, because they have so much space and it's easy to just walk past to find what you do want.  

However, for what I would want - a comfortable place with tasty drinks and good service that is easy to interface with - this place fails.

It was an inconvenient mess from the moment I entered the valet chute.........

Great drinks and cool food!! Mac n chz muffins are off the hook!! Ping pong, karaoke, random boxing ring, clothing store and DJ make this place super unique. The only downfall is there is no a/c and the drinks are a little pricey but other than that it's a cool spot.

This place is amazing! Inside has so much going on, we went exploring while we were waiting for our food. The entire staff was very friendly. We had strawberry lemonades, chicken pot pies, and the noodle kugel. All delicious!

Weird, mid-2000s Portland attempt. Loud music. Slow service. Cool vintage army clothes. However, I give them credit for giving me my $ back when I complained that the food was taking too long (40 minutes with zero other orders before me).
Been here couple of times , love it here, music, drinks, food, desserts are awesome!!

I love coming to this place! It's something different. Love their food, music and the vibe. I recommend the meatball slide sampler. The only reason I'm not giving it a five is because I think their menu is a little over priced. But overall good place to hang out with your date and friends.

I live in Albuquerque and want a 'Duce location here!!  I was in Phoenix visiting some friends for my birthday and went here for breakfast/lunch on a Sunday.  I love the old converted Airstream kitchen and the antique and vintage touches all over the place.  The food was excellent, atmosphere so fun and the service was super friendly!!  They even heard us talking about it being my birthday and brought over some amazing s'more sweet potato cheesecake with a candle on top and sang to me!  It was too-die-for!!!  What a great place, although I did feel a lil' guilty watchin' the people in the room next to us breaking a good sweat doin' a circuit-training class.  But they all were smiling and happy to enjoy the delicious menu after.  On my way out I wandered over to the clothing shop side of the restaurant and bought a cool funky t-shirt.  I am sold on the whole building and vibe of The 'Duce and can't wait to come back!!

We went to The Duce for a group, family dinner this evening. This place has it all! Original scenery, drinks, and food. Great for all ages, with a verity of fun games
to do. The owner gave our kids (and some parents) a little boxing lesson. He is a class act. The Duce is a gem in this desert. We will be back!
Just went dancing at The Duce. DJ Tiger is THE BEST! I'd love to hire him for my wedding. Also the drinks are delicious. Love the vibe here. Definitely coming back.

The Duce is magical. My first time I was introduced to the place was on the London Bus Pub Crawl, got great drinks, danced and poof had to leave. Came back for a Friday night Karaoke, met up with some friends and just relaxed and enjoyed the evening, so much to do, games, ping pong, bags, you name it. My hubby and I loved The Duce so much that we got married there (we also shared our first kiss on that Karaoke night). Ellen is awesome, the owners are amazing people, our most important day was perfect, every person had a great time, young and more wise alike. Best food, super shakes and old school beer with premium bar, I cannot say I love this place more! We are patrons for life.

I like the venue itself-cute vibe and all that. However the older blond bartender I encountered ruined my evening there when I went last Friday. First off I went to order the special, strawberry lemonade, and they were out of strawberries. So after waiting FOREVER to be helped she made me a raspberry something or other - which was awful I might add. So I tipped her a buck and walked away. Then my bank app alerted me that instead of charging me the $11.91 for the shitty drink she charged $111.91. So I go up calmly to ask about it and she was totally rude telling me she already had voided it. No apologies or anything. Basically... shit bartender+over priced bad drinks+mediocre dj+heat = lame experience

If you enjoy a different change of pace this will hit the spot. The food is great and the portions are huge. We went on a Sunday morning and there was like cross fit type of thing going on which was a weird site for such a cool place.

I had a below average experience during my first time at The Duce. First off, 2 of the menu items I asked for they were either out of or they no longer serve.  The salad I ordered for 7 dollars was as basic as a 3 dollar add on at a comparable restaurant.  The challa bread brisket is a great idea and tastes pretty good.  The alcoholic beverages are unique and taste great. I will also mention that the items in the vintage store are over priced.  The clerks there are not very friendly, in fact, they kept starring at my group of 4 as though we were going to steal something (which was very far from the truth). I may not go back, but I recommend that others check it out purely for the unique venue and good drinks.

Really cool place if you're ready to hang out and party. Went there on a Saturday night, they had a fun dance floor going with a DJ playing some 80s & 90s throwbacks. In addition, they have 3-4 ping pong tables, boxing ring, corn hole and a retro clothing shop for entertainment. You definitely need to check this place out if you're in Phoenix for the weekend. Super fun and did I mention they have Old Style?!?! Heeeeeck yea

Nobody puts Baby by the dumpster! 
They have no bike racks, or any place that is easy to lock up too. Their solution is the chainlink fence by the dumpster and a shrug of their shoulders, ugh. No thank you.

After having high expectations from hearing many friends rave about The Duce, I was EXTREMELY disappointed after visiting. To begin: no parking. Whatsoever. For a sunday afternoon at 3, I had to park a block away. Upon arrival, it was very cute. However, walking in was just as confusing as parking. The place was hectic, which is understandable, but no employees were anywhere to be found. Finally, we had to walk up to the bar to ask where to order. After being told where, we looked over the menu. Alright menu, small selection, a little expensive but we figured we would try something after all the effort to come here. Upon ordering, I asked the cashier if I could have a certain drink. She replied "I can't make that right now" okay... Asked for a pie jar "sorry we are out" okay.... Asked for the egg sliders "okay that'll be a 45 min wait.." Okay time to go. We are now eating at a nearby Jimmy Johns - and we are MUCH more satisfied. Cool concept, but needs a lot of work.

I have been to the Duce a number of times for get together. Huge eclectic space, awesome comfort food and awesome service, lovely organic prohibition era cocktails, really wonderful eclectic open-air atmosphere. Next Time,  I would try at night to see the vibe and have drinks at their antique bar. This place is great, try it if you haven't!

This place is a blast!  I came here for the first time for my birthday and everyone had so much fun- we had a big table and enjoyed sliders, alcoholic shakes, organic and freshly squeezed drinks, karaoke and dancing.  There is so much to see and do here! No A/C in the summer and parking is limited, but this is hands down one of the best and unique places in Phoenix!  I want to go back for the swing dancing!

Great place and experience. Food and beer cocktails were great. The scene is laid back and fun. There is something for everyone here. Enjoy it for what it is a great retro bar serving old school beer you wont find anywhere else so don't be whining for the latest micro brew or looking for the Scottsdale scene here. Parking is easy in the back alley and side streets. On weekend nights I'd like to see a separate entrance if you want to go just for the food and not have to pay the cover for the band. A fun place for kids too.

Love this place! All the food I've tried is tasty- get the Chicken Pot Pie or any of the sliders. The mac and cheese muffins are tasty, and darling. Everything I've had has been delicious. For drinks- I am on a makers mark kick so I loved the Old Fashioned and the Brown Derby. Fresh juice, so tasty. The decor is a little insane, like some chick's pinterest account exploded on everything, but there's so much to do, so much to look at! There's a freaking boxing ring in the middle! You can play corn hole (beanbags) and ping pong. I have been bringing people here a lot lately. It's just such a fun place!

This place is very intriguing!  I love the old-reclaimed atmosphere in downtown Phoenix.
There is ALOT going on at The Duce and it is hard to take it all in at one visit.  The staff there were very helpful and introduced us to different venues.
We had dinner and enjoyed the variety of sliders, salads and corn coins.  I think their lemonade is some of the BEST.  They are very reasonably priced also.
4 stars?  No diet drinks!  You would think that they would at least carry a TAB!
I'll be back!

My new favorite place in downtown Phoenix! There's a little something for every one there and we sure needed a place like this. The clothing store has an Anthropologie vibe to it along with the high prices, but it's fun to look! There are fun home accessory items too.

After you finish browsing you can have a soda at the soda fountain, coffee at the coffee bar, a drink in the lounge, cartoons on the vintage bleachers or some grub outside at the vintage travel trailer. Oh, and I forgot to mention the vintage gym area! 

I opted for some food and had the pear and pecan salad. It was actually a decent size for five bucks, but was nothing memorable and the greens were wilted and brown. I enjoyed the corn coins very much though as well as the lemonade, which is sweetened with honey. The ordering process though is a bit confusing. We were greeted by a very helpful guy who told us all about the food but he never took our order. He finally told us we needed to come up to the trailer and order. There should probably be a sign - especially since the menus are at the table. Also, you can't order a drink unless you go over to the lounge area in another room even though there are also drink menus at the table.  If you want lemonade though you can get it yourself at a counter next to the trailer, but you have to walk over to the lounge to get ice. You also have to give a nickname when you order your food. It's a cute idea, but by the time my name was called to pick up my food I had forgotten what my nickname was. And it's also hard to come up with a clever nickname on the spot. 

Even thought there are some kinks to be worked out, I'm already thinking of some nickname options for another visit soon. I want to try the apple pancake next!

We were referred by a friend and had a great night out at The Duce. If you are looking for a unique experience out with clients and friends The Duce will not disappoint. Check it out next time you go to downtown Phoenix for a concert or sporting event.
Good time fo sho.
Very good experience, the vallet boys that park your car are very cute. Also burger sliders 10/10.

The May special, buttermilk breaded chicken sliders, is excellent. Be prepared to wait a little longer for the order, they don't rush it. The side order of crisps was very small and expensive. I would not recommend it, especially for sharing. Over this place is great for family and friends. I will visit again.

I have read about the creation of this place almost two years ago and made a note to visit it.  Opened as a surplus store with vintage clothing, but now offers malts/shakes, brunch, happy hour type menu, kuegel, retro drinks, boxing ring, etc.  Stopped by on a Sunday after a disappointing visit to a downtown festival.  Loved it.  The building is gorgeous.  The staff was helpful but not overly intrusive.  The owner, Steve, took genuine interest into our insight and satisfaction regarding his place.   I don't like the reviews bashing their old-school beer offerings.  That is what they tout, and that is what you will get.  We love Hamm's, Schlitz, Old Style, and PBR (even though so many places offer it now) and love the matching, retro beer glasses they are served in.  I also had the best Greyhound I have ever had.  If you don't like the pricing, you obviously are oblivious to the cost of freshly squeezing juice, organic liquor, muddling fresh fruit, etc.  The patio next to the gulfstream trailer is adorable and can't wait to come back at night!

Really fun place. Corn hole, ping pong and a whole lot more. Atmosphere was great but the food not so much. May have been an off night as there were several parties going on. Took over an hour to get our food. First order of mac n cheese muffins arrive cold.  Chicken pot pie was pretty good minus the crust. Sliders, nothing to write home about.  Over priced for the quality.

I seriously love this place!!!! When I first moved to Arizona I didn't know where to go party, but then I was introduced to this awesome place.. I love it everyone is super friendly and their food is delicious.... they have a lot of fun stuff and when I come here to party I just feel alive :) I'm glad to have the Duce in my life :)
Eccentric place, pretty cool... But the drinks are over priced and you can't taste the alcohol AT ALL.
This place was really fun. The bar is limited but the drinks they do have are very tasty. It is like a Playland for adults. Food was fantastic.

Been a fan since we walked through the door and explored 14,000 sq ft of fun.  Tips for others would be 1-come with a nickname 2- order drinks at the bar, food at the airstream and 3- don't be afraid to ask someone what the story is if you aren't sure how to navigate the grounds...  

Love the Duce in that it is community friendly and very inclusive.  For those who like to work before play, join a small group of fitness friends for Punch, Crunch and Brunch Sundays @ 10am.  Get your workout in, and then your drink on... great way to kick-off your Sunday.

Ok let me just say (like I am sure many before me have) What is this place? It is something that you just can't quite describe, it looks like a cross between one of the gyms rocky trained in that was in a warehouse somewhere, the auction block and seating at the county fair, with sprinkles of a garage sale that has a DJ rocking out to shopping for a used t shirt for .50 cents. But seriously I give these guys a huge thumbs up for originality, there is no place I have EVER seen quite like the duce or even close for that matter. We didn't eat so I can't review the food, but my margarita was really good and made with all fresh and organic ingredients. It is definitely an interesting way to pass a couple of hours before a Sun's game It is worth a stop and check it out.

Slowest service of any place I have ever been. Never prepared for the crowd. Wait 45 mins for sliders, then another 20 minutes to get a drink. If they had faster service to get food and drinks out, they would sell way more every night. Instead, I ate my food and finished my one drink and left. I watched people walk away when they heard 45 mins for food at 730. For sliders.... Come on! Didn't have their signature dish on a Saturday before 8?!? Great concept, but horrible service and wait times. Get staffed properly and maybe I'll be back.

The places location put me on edge but the atmosphere inside made up for it. However, when I went to order my food I found it over priced and the server threw away my ticket after I had paid. This meaning I did not receive my food for another 30 minutes.

We waited 40 minutes for an order, the rest of our party finished eating we went to check on it they said another 10-15 minutes. Tried to get a refund and that was an ordeal as well. Just horrendous service, I would not recommend ordering food here.
My wife said and I'd have to agree with her, "it's a pretty cool concept, better to enjoy during the winter and if you can stand the smell of moth balls!"

The Good: 
The restaurant has a nice theme, the food is okay, and they play good music. Overall it is a pretty neat place. There is a nice outdoor theme with a retail area.

The Bad:
I had arrived at 7:00pm and sat at an open table. Note the table behind our group was label "Reserved 6:00pm". Even though is was 7:00 we sat at the adjacent table that was not labeled. After many of our friends arrived, we had ordered drinks and food and were seated and eating. At 8:13pm, a group of people began sitting at the reserved table across from ours. The wait staff came by and told us we had to leave because the table we were at was reserved. Not only did the party arrive two hours late, but the wait staff was willing to honor their reservation. I spoke with one of the manager's to hopefully find a way to accommodate our party. After asking one of the managers what time the reservation was for, she stated it was on the paper on our table. I had informed her there was no paper except on the other table. She apologized and said she would find us other seating, then she began to tell me the reservation was for 8:00pm. I would have been fine with the situation, but the manager had to lie directly to me. As nice a time as I had with my friends, I cannot recommend this establishment to anyone. The treatment I had received was very rude and did not provide good customer service.

Pros: cool atmosphere, lots of activities, interesting food, sustainable/organic alcohol 

Cons: HOT. They must not use a/c... Lack of parking, overpriced drinks

We had our wedding and reception at the Duce.  Ashley did a wonderful job of helping us plan and then managing the event.  Our guests loved the venue and raved about the food and drinks.  It was a second wedding for both of us and we wanted something different, fun and casual. The Duce was perfect!

Loved this place!  Saw it on DDD and have been waiting for a chance to go ever since. I had the Mac and Cheese Muffins and the Chicken Pot Pie Jar. Both did not disappoint!  I highly recommend the Mac and Cheese Muffins. There's enough to share with others as it is almost a meal by itself. Another friend had the cheeseburger sliders and they were not just your average slider. Had a pesto flavor with it and the meat was very high-quality tasting. The Maple BBQ ribs were very tasty. We also sampled the Duce Lemonade and Mojitio. Both were spot on, the Mojitio had a nice flavorful twist that made it stand out from what I normally have tasted. I recommend either one. We can't wait to go back again and try out the rest of the menu. Hopefully we can try out the pong pong tables too!

Unlike other reviewers,we had no trouble finding a parking place. But our big problem was trying to figure out why anyone would want to come here in first place. 

During recent lunch-hour weekday visit (place was essentially empty except for two guys at bar, a bewildered tourist trying to figure out what was going on and a few employees, one on floor painting signs), you may well feel you have  stumbled into some sort of boho work-in-progress in an old block-long warehouse in charm-free neighborhood south of downtown proper. 

Cheery young female employee who greeted us tried to explain what the mind-reeling business operation was all about--but it was pretty clear she wasn't very sure herself.  Is it a bar? A  gym? A restaurant? A clothing store? A concert venue? A tax write-off? Take your pick.

Walk into this industrial cavern and you must immediately navigate a weird obstacle course fronted by a boxing ring (a souvenir from a past tenant? who knows? and why put it right in front there when rest of building has plenty of other space?) , followed by a few makeshift kiosks stocked with a smattering of tee shirts, vintage clothing and several faux retro cookbooks. 

On one side of building is a non-operative supposedly soon-to-open soda fountain. . .or so we were told, even though other reviewers have raved about it. On other side  is a bar where we unsuccessfully attempted to order iced tea (probably only place in Phoenix that doesn't serve it) and got dirty look from surly young bartender in the process.

Appeared to be some sort of dining area in open storage yard/garage  to the rear but at this point, who cared? A very bizarre, over-hyped establishment attempting  to fill a merchandising niche that probably doesn't even exist.

Stopped in on Saturday morning with a friend who hadn't been there before, it was just opening and everyone was very welcoming and friendly.  I am an oatmeal maven and I can rate theirs very highly, delicious! The pecan french toast was scrumptious.   also great coffee served in real diner cups.  It's really fun to walk around and see the merchandise.  The bartender Cat and the server Brandon were especially nice.  This would be a good place for an informal party.

Amazing!  My husband and I visited today and has definitely become a place we will take visiting friends from out of town. Also a great place to hang before D-Back games. Thank you Diners, Dives and Drive-Ins :)

Loved this place! Never knew a boxing ring, dance floor, ice cream shop, clothing shop, and restaurant could all be in one bar! 

I was even more pleased to see a Moscow Mule on the drink menu. It only ran me about 7$, but I didn't mind paying it as it came in a MASON JAR - love!! 

Hula Hoops were accessible as a unique dance accessory :)

This place definitely lived up to its hype!!! Although there was LONG wait for the food, it was worth it. I had the mac and cheese muffins and a strawberry lemonade a d my stomach was as happy as a clam. The place was very crowded but there is lots of space inside that most people were not using. We had never been there a d it was hard for us to find the entrance, once we did, we came in and no one greeted us, we sat looming for staff for about 10 min and as we were about to leave we decided to walk around and we stumbled on the court yard and the ordering hub. It was a weird set up and it seemed like although it's a tourist attraction their system of ordering was very confusing. ...but all was forgiven once we tested the food.

I came here with my family on a Saturday night at 6:30. I was reluctant to come here because I thought it would be too hot inside-it was over 100 outside and the restaurant isn't air conditioned. 

There was no need to worry. We sat outside in the courtyard and it was very comfortable, 20 degrees cooler than the street. Inside was also comfortable-we never felt hot at all.  Even when we left around 7:45 it wasn't overly crowded or loud. All in all it's a great, fun atmosphere for families. After eating, my son and I played ping pong and bean bag toss. 

The staff was super friendly and helpful, and very welcoming. An A+ for the staff. 

We ordered a chicken pot pie, mac and cheese muffins, and a Duce Salad. All were excellent, unique without being weird. The mac and cheese muffins were the star-the perfect combination of gooey cheese, soft macaroni, and toasted, buttery crumbs.

This place is really cool! Dancing and music were pretty fun. We must have caught them on a bad night because the food (sliders and chips) was really greasy and service was super slow. Place was busy but not packed. Bar was quick and efficient but food service needs help!

Confused is the way I can describe this place; more confused and inching it's way to befuddled. 

To start off with good: there are plenty of games and it is very very open. You won't be crowded end to end like a typical. Scottsdale bar. Their custom mixed drinks are good, even if a little on the sweet side. 

The bad: it is insanely hot in the summer, as it is in an old warehouse in a seedy neighborhood with no ac. Parking can be weird as the gated parking lots are not used to for parking in this place. Food is lack luster (cold pies Served in jars and beyond greasy Mac and cheese bites), not able to order mixed drinks and food at same time, and for some reason there is a vintage store inside. 

To be honest, this place has always been a little "meh" in my mind. I have wound up here a few times over the years, but the negatives always annoy to the point I out weight positives. Even though featured on triple d, the food is lack luster and lacking a real identity. Not quiet american, not quite BBQ, not quite diner......just all over the place. There is also a gym, vintage store, and two bars.....all in all the theme seems to be somewhere between disjointed and a Pinterest girls exploded dream. 

Not a bad place to change up the scene if you are local, but not a place to make a priority if you are visiting or new to phx.

Fun vintage little hotspot. Parking is very limited and the drinks are way overpriced. About $10-$14 if you get one of there specially made drinks. 
I do love this place for dancing though! It's right between the feel of a club and a bar. They play old school through current hits! I first found this place and now my friends have fallen in love with it as well.

Came for lunch and was underwhelmed. The brisket sliders are very tasty, but everything is a la carte, so expensive. For that, two chicken brats, and macncheese muffins  (oh yeah and the sip of diet coke- they serve it in vintage 8 Oz bottles), it was $36.  I can see why the place was nearly empty.  I would suggest putting green chilies in the macncheese muffins, for addl flavor, and creating some $15 combos. And, for God's sake, get a soda fountain! That alone would garner one more star.

Went for a girl friend's bachelorette party. Interesting place to say the least. So much going on, boxing, ping pong, hula hooping, and of course, dancing and food. Verrrryyy hipster crowd, which is good or bad, depending on your style. 

Food: 50's style picnic area/diner. I had the chicken sausage sliders which were delicious! Yummy lemonade and other drinks served in mason jars. 

Music: DJ was okay, could have cut short some songs people didn't seem interested in and kept playing more popular ones. Overall, had a good time, definitely a unique place in the valley.

The Duce is a disaster. 
As an Arizona native and a downtown local I root for cool interesting places downtown. I wanted to love this place. The 1st time we tried the Duce I was extremely let down by the customer service. The parking is atrocious. It's as if you are inconveniencing the staff by asking where you order food. They were out of just about everything we wanted to order. So disappointing. 
However I decided to give them a second shot. Everyone has a rough night. We went to an event there last night the entertainment by Scandalesque was AMAZING... same TERRIBLE customer service from the staff at the Duce. Management needs to wake up. Great concept. Horrific customer service and staff.

I had mixed feelings about this place the first time I went due to the customer service. Its very different, you walk in and seat yourself. It's such a beautiful place with vintage decor and amazing american food. There sliders were killer. The drinks were so good too! Slightly on the higher price but worth it. My first experience was a thursday about a month ago and I was bummed because I felt like the "server" seemed uninterested with helping us and not thrilled to be at her job. But the second time in, last Wednesday was a completely different story. The server or trailer girl/hostess was fantastic. Has an amazing personality perfect for the job. She greeted us with smiles and laughter. Made us feel extremely comfortable and new a lot about the place. We sat on the patio because it was nice out and began chatting with her like we were old time friends. It seemed like every customer or group that came in had the same experience, our table would actually envy the other tables if she spent to much time with them. She engaged customers to chat with one another too. She gave so much info about the place we told our friends to join the gym! I say find out when she's working before heading in! she'll make the difference for ya!! Great place, have to take in relative or out of towners and maybe get back into the fitness game. You have to check it out!

Wow this place dropped a deuce on my company's Christmas party. We tried multiple times to make a reservation with no one calling us back. We go any way and they run out of all food???? On a Sunday during Holiday times?? Ouch that's a horrible look! Not to mention after they tell us what we ordered we can't have, they "gave" us sliders that were left over from another group?! This is the first time I've ever been here but no need to come back. Pretty damn pathetic.

Stopped in here once just to check it out. I asked the bar tender if he had anything on special. Immediately  he told me to "Get a job". Then he said he can understand some locals coming in and wanting cheap drinks but not someone with an ASU hat and an American Eagle shirt. I apologized to the guy because I didn't mean to come across as being cheap. Blew it off and he got me a drink.

Other than that one incident, the place looks pretty fun. Perhaps I just had a stressed out bar tender. However, it's not okay to treat friendly customers that way. I don't plan on going back or recommending this place to anyone.

The drinks are AMAZING! Everything is fresh and hand squeezed in front of you. Only downfall is it is a little pricey. Huge building with a boxing ring and different things to see in every corner. 
Staff is very friendly.

Went here after the Critical Mass bike ride last night.  We had so much fun!  It was a great night to sit on the patio.  There was 80s karaoke.  I've only eaten breakfast here, so it was good to check out the other offerings.  My friends got a salad that looked fantastic.  Another friend got the biscuit sliders, and said they were yummy.  I wasn't hungry, but I did sample the homemade chips, both regular potato and sweet potato.  Both were delicious, but I thought the sweet potato chips had a more complex, interesting flavor.  We drank too many mojitos and mingled with our fellow bicyclists into the night.  The venue was very accommodating, and had set aside an area for us to lock up our bikes.  Fun!  Oh, and news flash!  The Duce will soon carry Rock Springs famous pies!!!
This is the most wonderful place, great ambience, even better food and it oozes style. Try the sliders and a well crafted cocktail with all organic ingredients. I can't wait to go back.

Not an awesome experience. We ordered our food and then ordered drinks. We were told food would be about 25 minutes because we got the pancake. Drinks took about 15 minutes. Our food took 54. The pancake was hot, but the rest was lukewarm. Not impressed and the kitchen didn't care. The cherry on top was when we were ready to leave. Valet told us someone backed into our car. She left a nice scratch on the front. They did get the lady's insurance information for us, but now we get to deal with that, too. We won't be going back.

Cool place to stop in and check out. Grab a beer and relax. However it took over a hour for cheeseburger sliders... Seems way to long to wait! Hope they get the kitchen speed faster, otherwise it's a good place

Everyone knows rooster fighting is illegal and usually breaks up early on Sunday morning. Last week having lost my shirt at the fights, I was topless and hungry wandering around South Phoenix and found The Duce. 

The place had everything Companion and I needed. First, being shirtless, there is a clothes store.  I purchased matching vintage gray sweatshirt from my Alma Mater, "Tech". Second, alcohol. Waiting patiently until the clock struck "10" and the bar opened, I ordered two spicy Bloody Marys, which did not disappoint. 

What DID disappoint was the celery stick which was the size of a Louisville Slugger. I should know, because it felt like a baseball bat when Companion whacked me across the head with hers because I said she DID look fat in the sweatshirt. 

Finally, nourishment. The egg/bacon/cheese sliders were a good choice for reconciliation between Companion and I, especially on the sunny patio. The sun did not shine for long, though, because to make a long story short, her second Bloody Mary ended up forcibly on my new sweatshirt, leaving me alone at The Duce. Not a bad place to be!

Parking is awfull. Small lot gets overloaded. I parked on a side driveway. I asked the worker if it was OK. He said yes -- there are no signs. I end up with a $50 ticket! 

Food is very good. 
No air conditioning!! 
Fast food type dining. Order at a window or the bar. Pick up your food when ready. Play some games while you wait. Its hard to hear your name called. 
Seat yourself anywhere.

This place gets four stars because of the atmosphere and the food. The atmosphere is unlike anything else in Phoenix with picnic tables, mason jars, hula hoops, and a good DJ on the weekend. Don't be in a hurry here though, as all the employees seem to take their time to get anything done, regardless of how busy it is.

We went one Friday night, it was kinda dead... They had karaoke. The music was a bit too loud for the ratio of people that were there. It was way too hot even with the "big ass fan" on full blast. I know Phoenix had the hottest August this year. Installing misters would help to cool the place. The old fashion cocktails was yummy! I had the grasshopper, it was like eating a chocolate mint patty. Hmmmm....mint patty....The Duce is a fusion venue. There were clothing and bags for sale. Ice cream and juice bar. Boxing ring and punching bag. LOL Get drunk then go take the frustration out on the punching bag. LOL I thought the place was really cool except for the temperature. It definitely needs more promotion and marketing to bring the place to life.

I emailed the Duce to make a reservation for my roommates birthday on a Tuesday night for 7 people at 8:00 pm and they emailed me back saying no reservation was needed. We get there around 8 and the only parking is a block or two away; pretty sketchy for 7, 18+ girls to be walking around downtown phx at night. We walk in and are asked if we are there for the dancing lessons and when we said we were just there for dinner the lady was very rude and gestured us with a sigh to the dinning area.. okay? We start ordering and someone asks to see one of our ID's. Apparently after 9:00 pm it is 21+. Awesome, we have one hour to hangout eat some sliders and play some corn hole. For the record it doesn't say anywhere on their website it turns into 21+ and the kind man who emailed me back also failed to mention. Now it's 8:30 and we have all finished quickly chowing down our sliders and ($8 small milkshakes!) we head over to the games and at about 8:45 the staff is hovering over us waiting to kick us out. We were already done in the dinning area just hanging out by the games and at 9:00 sharp we were asked to leave. There was maybe 10-15 people in the whole joint so it's not like it was a poppin place where we could sneak some alcohol we literally just wanted to hangout and enjoy my friends 19th birthday. Won't be back again because they obviously don't care about their under 21 crowd! :)

I went here for the first time last week for a company holiday party. We were only on the patio, and a large group, so keep that in mind as you read. I was pleasantly surprised - The atmosphere was awesome. The DJ played a great variety of songs - from the Beatles to Bruno Mars, which suited our group and made it fun for everyone. They staff was all very friendly and helpful. They have a nice selection of seemingly original cocktails - all made fresh right in front of you, and a big selection of beers that seem rare to find.  My favorite thing was the multiple ping pong and corn hole games set up around the place. You feel like your at someone's backyard party, but no one had to do any work to cook or make drinks!

Visited The Duce before the ASU/WVU bowl game in downtown PHX. Very cool set-up and atmosphere but the service was severely lacking. I understand these are specialty cocktails & they're not twisting a cap off a bottle and handing it to you.. but the bar was under-staffed and in a pissed off mood, as were the patrons. Food was decent but did not make up for the drink service, we left after one round.
I didn't eat here since no one else wanted to, just snooped around for a minute and was crushin' on Anna.. I'm gonna go ahead and assume the food is exceptional...
Amazing place to meet up with friends or date. Good music or karaoke, and where else can you play ping pong and foosball next to a boxing ring and 50s diner.

Glad we checked this place out whike in Pheonix. Saw quite a while back on Diners Drive Ins and Dives and wanted to see it in person. Fun atmosphere. We played some oversized Connect four after ordering our Bacon MacnCheese muffins. Service was fast and the food was excellent.

23 year old asu student. Always been one of my favorite places in phoenix. I brought my out of town family here and they were treated to an unbelievable night of drinking and fun. The OWNER treated my mother some FREE boxing lessons!!!  Could not have asked for a better night!!!!!

I went on a The Duce website to request information about holding my wedding reception at their venue.  I received a quick response from Steve Rosenstein on 12/4/16 asking for me to provide a few more details which I did the same day.  Since then, I've received no response about my inquiry.   Poor customer service.  Too bad.

Terrible service. Terrible selection. We went with a group of about 16 people. We had tried several times over the course of about a month to make a reservation and we never received any follow up or feedback. We should have taken that as a big red flag. The parking was terrible. We had to walk several blocks half of which were unlit. When we arrived it became apparent that there was a big corporate event taking place. This group only took up a small portion of the floor space. They should have closed their doors to the general public. Every food item we tried to order was sold out. We ended up having to order 16 Sheppard's pies. When they arrived they were all cold. When we asked if they could be heated up we were told that they didn't have a way to do that. You can't serve us a hot dish any other way than room temperature? The ambiance was kitschy and tacky with a "gift shop" selling more kitsch. Apparently the boxing ring they have there is used by some private fitness group. I'm sure it's very hygienic to have people sweating and fighting in close proximity to where food is being served. The cocktails are really good but pretty overpriced considering we had to go get them ourselves and wait in line at a tiny bar. Usually I will give a place a second chance but I have no inclination to do that with this place.

Such a fun place to be! First time here and had a blast! Loved how the place was designed vintage and there was a variety of music. Had the cheeseburger sliders and a spiked root beer float... DELICIOUS! My friend and I do a lot of social dancing and were looking for a new place to dance... I think this will be a new hang out for us! Definitely going to recommend this place to friends :)

First time there today after seeing  a year prior Guy F. Triple D
Order the mac &cheeses bisquits they were delicious, yet took nearly 30 minutes to get. Cool setting but the eatery having a " Pit bull Adoption " not cool. Disappointed at the establishment for allowing animals and food to be combined.

The Duce has a nice atmosphere, a great menu, good drinks, and reasonable prices.  It is never dull, and usually good fun.  They have put a great deal of thought into the details to make it a cut above the usual warehouse-turned-bar.  They have exercise equipment, clothes for sale, and frequent events.  I am absolutely impressed that these things can coexist in a bar, where it only takes one guy saying "hey, look at this" to ruin a great deal of stuff.  It is well managed in that regard, and unfailingly friendly.

The people who show up are usually interesting, and I have met fun people just chatting with others.  It is a large place, but the space is divided into nicely-sized areas.  It was not too crowded nor too empty.

That said, they miss on a few points which is why I rate it with three stars.  They have separate counters for drinks, food, and milkshakes.  This means you will spend a good deal of time waiting in line. Ordering food, they ask you for (and insist upon) a silly name, which then they announce using a badly distorted loudspeaker which is approximately half the volume of their music.  I had half a mind to give them a horribly offensive name, just to have them announce it; this sort of forced cuteness is rather annoying (it is probably done because there are bound to be many people named "Emily" or "Jeff" at the bar, but there are better ways to get around this). The food is good, but unless you happen to be seated right next to the food cart, it will be cold by the time you realize your "name" was called. 

The music was somewhat mysterious--they had a band and DJ going, sometimes simultaneously and loudly.  It is not a quiet place, but competing sound systems does not help; it merely makes noise.

Nevertheless, I will probably go back again (I have been several times before).  It is a good bar and with a little work, could be a great bar. I have only been there in the evening, but they seem to have a good breakfast menu.  It would be interesting to visit at those times, I think.

Pros: 
Love the charm. Lots of stuff to do without being a hassle. To compare it to The Yard which is similar in concept, there's much more to do and it's much easier to gain access to it. Foosball, boxing ring, hula hoops, dancing, bean bags. It's like the party I would want to host myself.

Atmosphere is charming; they were playing 90s pop and hip-hop, fun classic group dancing songs, the lighting was nice.

A food menu! I love to snack while out. I'll have to try their brunch menu too.

Giant mason jar drinks were very refreshing. I can't speak to the strength as I was sweating so much-- which leads me to...

Cons:
It was SO HOT. I learned about the no A/C deal the hard way.I drank quite a bit, but felt nothing at the end of the night, probably because I was sweating it all out.

Tight parking-- I don't mind valet parking but I understand some people prefer not. It is not very well lit around the block, either, so finding nearby parking may be a bit risky.

I can't wait to come back at the end of September when it's not hot anymore!

We threw our wedding here, and it was amazing!  We worked with Keeley, the events coordinator, who went above and beyond.  She made it very easy to coordinate with our vendors, and we were impressed that she remembered all of the details that we discussed to help make everything run smoothly and stress-free on our wedding day.  The level of person attention that Keeley gave throughout the entire year of planning was more than we could have asked for.  Our guests raved about how fantastic the cocktails were, and everyone loved how warm and unique the space was, and how elegant it looked for the event.   

One of the reasons that we chose the Duce was for their delicious food and cocktail menu, and they did not disappoint with the quality.  The bartenders went out of their way to give amazing service, and really added to the atmosphere.  We chose Brandon, who is the house DJ, who did a great job as the MC, and kept the party going.  

Overall, we can't thank the Duce enough for making our wedding day so special!

I went to the Duce last night with a friend. The food was great, the drinks were great as was the atmosphere.  I had a hard time with the lack of air conditioning and not enough fans. This place would be amazing and would get 5 stars  if it were cooler inside. I will return in November ( or later)to try more food  choices for sure. The bruschetta, was my favorite but the salad and pulled chicken sliders were all really well made.

After living in Phoenix for almost a year, I finally got around to visiting The Duce. This place is great! It's like a tiny village of funtimes. Not only do they serve food and drinks, there is also a boxing ring in the middle of the place. Need to buy some new clothes? Shit they've got that too. I could probably live in this place. Food-wise: I tried the mac & cheese muffins and some hand-squeezed lemonade. Both were delicious. I'd like to go back and try some of their cocktails and brunch. Go here.

The Duce is the Urban Outfitters of the Phoenix Bar Scene. That being said, it's still a great bar! They play pretty awesome music, and have three(ish) areas to socialize. I'm a huge fan of this place when the weather is nice. Try their milkshakes and appetizers.

I visited The Duce a second time to watch the Suns game last night, and I was super happy with everything they did. Food and drink specials, the game in HD in the food area outside, a friendly chick bringing out drinks from the bar. I appreciated that even though there were a lot of kids there they had a place to watch the game inside. They even improved the food, they grill the chicken and ribs on site now instead of just roasting them, I got the maple glazed chicken and it was delicious.

This is a wonder land for your senses.  It is what I call a hipster cracker barrel.  Lots of spaces, free valet, interesting shop, delicious food, lots of space. It is a wonderful place for a drink, bite, boxing, taking your kids. It is nice to have to be so crowded, the crowd is diverse and let's you into a it of kitschy Phoenix.

Ok I m giving this three stars because the meatball slider really needs help. Tough meatball n bland. The short.rib sliders very good, brisket sliders.also good but could have had more brisket.  The ribs we were.split on 2 people said not fall off the bone and tasted weird, the other 2 were.ok. The service was great even know we were the only ones in the joint we had a great conversation about food. Bartender also great they made the meal fun since we r visiting from NY. I would go back when it is perhaps a tad cooler out.
Mac and cheese balls. Enough said. Great atmosphere with nice outdoor seating. Also burgers are great.

Where else can you grab some BBQ, have a drink freshly made and put your friend in a camel clutch in a full-sized wrestling ring?

I was in there on Sat and watched the bartender press ~2 fresh grapefruit into my greyhound (served in a mason jar).  I'm not a huge fan of grapefruit because they remind me of old people but this was damn good.  They understand the importance of quality.  

The music is also phenomenal:  Otis, Marvin, Stevie, Aretha...all the hits.   

I wish this place had a better location because it's missing a crowd.  I would have thought the hipsters on 5th would be all over this place on a Saturday night.  Bring the crowd and I'll give it 5 stars.

This place can be a lot of fun, but it also can be LOUD which is really grating! Don't sit at the big table right by the bar as you won't be able to hear your friends. The other areas of the Duce are still loud, but not as bad. Also they should stop YELLING in the PA system when someone's food is ready. Seriously it put our whole party on edge. 

Other than that, it's a fun place to go to eat, hang out, and hula hoop! Seriously the addition of the corn hole game and a hula hoop had us cracking up all night! Good call Duce! Add some alcohol and you've got a party. 

I've also been to a wedding here and it was lovely. They just put up a white curtain blocking the store area, and the guests sat in the section of bleachers. It was SO CUTE and we loved it. 

They should add a couple pool tables, I think that would be fun. 

Overall this place is like... A honky-tonk minus the country music for hipsters.

I'm not sure what The Duce is -- a bar, a restaurant, a gift shop, a bakery, an entertainment complex?

When I learned of The Duce and checked out their website, it seemed like an eclectic place with lots of character. What we experienced was a place that doesn't quite know which way to go or what to focus on (and forcing a hipster vibe), and because of that, nothing was as good as it could be with such a great warehouse space.

We went for lunch on a Saturday and sat outside. Of course, just figuring out where to go to eat once at the front door took a few minutes. We ordered at the counter and sat ourselves. Then we waited, and waited, and waited. We waited over 30 minutes for some melted cheese sliders and mac-n-cheese muffins, which I might add were meant to be a starter and came out after my husband was done with his main meal. Yes, not only did we wait over 30 minutes, but they brought out my husband's meal 10 minutes before mine and the appetizer. The only thing they offered to compensate was a free Coke. Wow...thanks.

The food was okay. Certainly not worth the wait or the cost ($10 for three little grilled cheese sliders and no side). And I'm still not sure why we waited so long, because it was not busy. 

Overall, we were very disappointed. We won't be back.

Went here for the first time on Saturday 8/6 and boy was it BUSY! What a crazy experience. This place is HUGE and there is something to do for everyone! I came with a large group of friends and we were able to split off and do our own things. Ping Pong anyone? And I don't have to sacrifice my ID for a ping pong paddle! (I'm looking at you, Culinary Dropout)

They had beef brisket sandwiches which were to die for. There was a long line, but I met some fun people so I guess it wasn't so bad. I didn't know what drink to order, so the bartender made me and my friend a GIANT margarita. It was incredible. My other friends were super jel. The bar was so busy, I don't know how 2 people managed that. Luckily I found there were two other bars in the place! Crazy, crazy place. 

I will be back here for sure! I want to get in that boxing ring!

Different food several kinds of sliders, but everything was great tasting. I had short rib and the pulled chicken in a lunch special it came with a couple of their Mac n cheese muffins which were excellent. Although there are ping pong and bag toss areas needs a couple of big TV's to show ESPN or sports on...

I liked the space, though I am sure it will be more enjoyable when it's not so hot. Mac and cheese muffins were greasy and flavorless, not worth the $9, for sure. Food orders took a long time. The strawberry bruschetta was much better, but that seems like a hard thing to screw up. Good music early in the evening, mostly Motown, that was a mixed bag as the night went on. (Outkast, yes please, country music, not such a fan.)  I would go again, my friends and I had fun.

Awesome bar with great ambiance, drinks, and food! Anytime I have my Chicago friends visiting I make sure to take them here! I finally tried the food yesterday and it was amazing! The Duce spiked lemonade, sliders, and cheese dip are my faves! A little pricey but so worth it!!

One of my favorite joints I've been to. Great menu. Great venue. Awesome time. Jake and Sarah were really great bartenders. The rest of the staff was friendly and helpful.The funny nicknames to pick up your food was a nice twist. It's a great place to hang with friends and chill. The games were fun too. We really enjoyed our time at The Duce and I can't say enough good things about it. Thanks Phoenix for allowing us to experience this gem!

Based off of the reviews, I was a bit hesitant to visit, but I am beyond happy I did.

My friends and I were looking for a karaoke place to go to, but had trouble due to the fact that we aren't 21 yet. Luckily, I came across The Duce and gave them a call to see if we could still get in and they just said we couldn't buy alcohol. I was down. 

Though the location was a tad sketchy, parking was great and we had no problem getting in. Immediately when we got there, we were greeted by some loud throwback Backstreet Boys and friendly staff. We were overwhelmed by how many awesome things they had going on (clothing store, milkshake bar, ping pong tables, bars, bars, bars, fully functioning kitchen, boxing ring, etc), but what attracted us the most was the dance floor. Though we expected karaoke, we were totally down for some dancing (karaoke is more of a Thursday night thing, apparently).

After a few songs, we settled at one of their rad tables and ate some rad mac n cheese muffins, cronuts, and melted cheese sliders. It's a little on the pricy side, but so worth it. What's also great is that they had some tanks of water right next to the dance floor with some nicely-sized cups that we could pour for ourselves.

Everyone they're was super chill and had a pretty wide range of age. Also, it's half outdoors, half indoors with massive ceiling fans, so I wasn't even that hot (unless I was hardcore busting a move). I'm going back all of the time because of how dope it was!

Entrance was confusing but when we went it was in the back (entrance sign was pointed opposite of entrance). We arrived at 4:45 on a Friday before the Dbacks game. Great outdoor seating on a nice weather and great things to do inside. We took our kids and they enjoyed the corn hole and boxing bag. 
We tried the orange bloom beer $6.50 and it was light and pretty good. Wish we had enough $ to try other drinks. We bought the beef brisket, sampler plate w brisket/chicken sausage/meatball, Mac muffins & the bacon Mac muffins. $55 total and had water available at the counter. Great atmosphere especially with a group! Food was tasty, Brisket is a must have n Mac muffins for sure. See my pics.

Fantastic Drinks - I had several Brown Derby drinks - served in an awesome Mason Jar. They made it with fresh ingredients right in front of me - and that includes squeezing two Grapefruits into the Mason Jar for fresh grapefruit juice. Great sliders as well.
Came form Cali and let me tell u this place is like home! And Courtney girl crush and eyebrows on point but definitely a place I'll visit again. Thank you Courtney for your amazing service and drinks
I love this place and I live in Seattle and always stop by when I'm in AZ. Cool place to see the game and have the best food out there.

I've enjoyed any other time there, although it's been on busy weekends... Tonight was a different experience. An event I was part of... Has been booked way of time, talked about, confirmed for tonight. Everything going smooth, drinks and food bring bought, people showing up, etc. An hour into our event we're asked to end the event. From the moment there I felt uncomfortable with the staff, other than Rachel, she was awesome & the only one who truly did get job with a smile. The whole set up we were being accommodated just fine, if there was a problem this should and could have been resolved. It hurt my feeling; because this was a heart felt occasion for alot of people. For whatever the reason, whoever would make a decision like that, is just sad.
This is a fun place to hangout with friends. I recommend the cranberry cobbler cocktail
Not my cup of tea. It feels like they are trying way too hard to be cool or hipster. That said, everyone else I meet loves it.
The most interesting places I've ever visited in Phoenix!! All I will say is you need to see it for yourself! Fun Fun Fun!!

I heard this place was pretty cool and decided to check it out on my birthday. I was so disappointed. I wasn't disappointed by the drinks or food, but the DJ was just RUDE! It was a saturday night and there was no one there and the DJ guy was a total dick to all my friends. All my friends wanted to do was sing karoke since that was the only thing they could do. I asked the DJ when it was my friends turn to sing, and he was like when its her turn! (Not even in a nice way). Granted maybe he was having a bad day, but dont take it out on us. My friend and I went up to talk to the manager and he wasn't that much of a help either. He told me he didn't own the place! Well I would figure that! We were just letting you know our concerns to make this place better, because it does have potential to be AWESOME, but a staff like that, it most def put a sour taste in my mouth. We ended up going to BARSMITH afterwards, and enjoyed by birthday there instead!
Went here a couple of months ago and the bartender was very friendly but the drinks were expensive. Its a good place to go to on a night out for dancing but expect to spend about 15$ for a drink.

If you are looking for an upbeat spot with a great atmosphere and a stellar drink menu, this is the place to choose. A few friends of mine and I stumbled upon this place. There was corn hole, a dance floor, plenty of seating, great social scene, and decent music. Drinks were decently priced and very tasty! We stayed for about two hours and left very happy. The mason jars and hula hoops were a nice added touch.

First have to start with the parking sucks. "Free" valet parking.... yeah sure. Itty bitty lot where cars are jammed together. So don't take your Lexus or corvette. 
It's interesting on the inside but you get by that pretty quick. The food? Please, don't bother. Greasy and cold. Yes, went for a party and the hors d'oeuvres were nasty. Cold and stiff. Just like my first ex-wife. The main course... what a joke. The mashed potatoes and corn came out 40 minutes before the sliders. Mashed potatoes leaking greasy butter or margarine on the top. Needless to say that by the time everything was out... it was as cold and nasty. 
Suffice to say I held off 24 hours before writing this review. After my fourth friend called and told me about the day spent in the bathroom I figured warning was in order. 
I did give this place one star simply because I could not give it zero stars. I tried. Oh, the do have entertainment and the D.J. was among the worst I have seen in years....

The coolest place to go for wonderful creative and fun fare, killer drinks, music, a piece of chicago, people, GAMES, hula hoop, boutique shopping, milk shakes, swing dancing, wobble dancing, jarred deserts, airstream trailers, group workouts, and boxing!!

Yeah, thats right - this place has all of that and all wrapped up in a trendy - hipster, urban, neighborhood joint.  Love everything about  The Duce.

I love the Duce! The drinks are super expensive, which is a bummer, but the atmosphere is great and they have something different going on every night. This is a great place to go with a large group. Wednesday nights are throwback nights--cheap cheap beers!
This place is super. But VEGETARIANS beware:  there is gelatin & animal based protein ingredients in most items, including the desserts, like the cheesecake :/

DELICIOUS drinks! everything is super fresh. great food also. i recommend the meat ball sliders. wash it down with a greyhound while you're at it...just don't leave you beverage on the windowsill in the dining area. it opens up to an alley and bums WILL steal your drink. no joke. i watched a bum steal my friends drink. aside from the area the duce is at...it's a pretty awesome place. i'll be back.

..and as for the bums?i will be watching...oh yes, i will be watching.

I think the idea of the place and the games and overall atmosphere are a great idea.
The old lady that was serving in the back bar was a miserable person and very very rude!
The drinks are not cheap which is fine as its all organic fruit, but when I request a meddled drink smash the fruit like your supposed to....
What a fun place! Food was great, i cant choose a favorite from the sampler platter.  The mac and cheese muffins are a must have.

Terribly slow service. I waited at the bar of 8 people for at least 5 minutes, then decided to create a Yelp account just to leave a poor review. Had some sign up issues but as of this moment I've written this review and still no sign of a drink. Seems the bartender is enjoying flirting with a girl at the end of the bar. Love the place but this service is the absolute worst
We absolutely LOVE this place! It's perfect for a big group of people or even just our family of five. It's really fun, the food is wonderful and the drinks are delish!

I've been wanting to go here for awhile and thought the pics looked really amazing. I didn't understand why no one had ever suggested going here. Now I know why.

It kills me that the atmosphere is listed as "hipster" and multiple reviewers described it as such. This is one of the least hipster places I've ever been. I would describe the atmosphere as "trailer park chic". Although the chic part is a little bit of a stretch. 

This place doesn't work for me, but I give them credit for trying hard. It has a universal studios /cracker barrel type vibe to it, with lots of shabby chic elements mixed in, but it's too much -  there is random stuff and signs/writing everywhere... and feels very overwhelming and is sensory overload. 

We came in the afternoon and had a few drinks and lunch. They were blaring oldies and the average customer was 65, and that includes kids skewing the average. Clearly there is nothing wrong with being in your sixties/seventies or children, but it's not exactly hipster. 

Valet at 12 in the afternoon in an empty parking lot when it would have been easier to  park ourselves just 5 ft away...that always adds to the annoyance. 

I had the chicken sausage and pickle slaw and I did not care for them. Sausage was dry and slaw tasted like it had 2 cups of sugar in it. What's good: my boyfriend had the sliders and they were awesome and they have an extensive list of creative cocktails and both the old fashioned and margarita were excellent.  Service was good - everyone was very nice. 

I would describe it as a family friendly spot with an interesting/novel atmosphere. Food is southern/home cooking/heavy.

Boxing ring in The middle and cornhole (aka bags) which is cool, but I couldn't stand to hear the music for more than 30 mins to stick around. I was disappointed because of the area and pictures gave me hope, but NOT my scene. I'm giving it 3 stars because it may be great for some people but not for me.

I see the attraction in cooler months. Loved the vintage industrial feel. It's a feast for your eyes.  I will be back & I'm hoping have a 5 star review. This time just a 3. 
My hubs ordered the mac n cheese bites but I gotta say for the caloric intake not impressed at all. Shame on you Guy from DDD. You steered me wrong again. We also had a couple of the organic cocktails & LOVED them both. Not the price but hey you get what you pay for right & they were refreshing. The bartender was knowledgable & funny. They also had some Chicago beers that were cost effective if on a budget that I know would go excellent with the Chicago Dog we had. So stay tuned for the Fall review.

Are you kidding me with this place! As a foodie who likes to try new places, I always keep an open mind going in.
We went on a Wed night after work.We were never greeted by anyone. I finally got up to ask someone who I thought worked there. You can't tell because everyone that does looks like they just crawled out of bed! I was told that all orders are taken at the bar.So we head to the bar to order a drink and food.We placed order for the fod and waited for 10 minutes for a beer. The one and only person behind the bar was busy mixing two cocktails and had one speed, verrrrrry sllloooow. The only thing he had going for him was his looks.I continue... No one tells us that are food isn't going to be delivered to us from the diner /camper /car in the back. So it sat there for a while and finally someone came and asked if we ordered food, that it was "over there". Again, Are you kidding me? Two of us had meatballs sliders, OK tasting, but cold. One of us had the ribs. OMG, 5 ribs , nothing else came with them, mediocre at best and $14.00! Again, are you kidding me? No one asked us how anything was, picked up plates, nothing! We had no idea if we were to clean up after ourselves or what. We just left everything sitting there , in the rain outside. As far as leaving a tip..to who? and for what? Are you kidding me?
I watched the video from the owners on their website. They say they are going for some kind of gritty , Chicago feel. Well I'm from the midwest and have been to Chicago many many times over the years and I can honestly say I have never been in place like this there or anywhere in the miswest! #1 in the midwest , service is key, here , not so much. 
If your are looking for grungy, no service, uncomfortable go ...if not , stay home, or go somewhere else. If I could have given this place a -10 stars I would have. You have been warned!
On a side not: I always wonder if the Owners read the reviews? I would love to hear a response if so.......

The best place I have ever been to ever.

I was walking by, then I saw a boxing area which I thought "how random and cool !!", then when I peaked inside and saw some random t-shirts, old soda's, a classic food truck, old movies playing,,, and all put together in a great way.

I tried their jack daniels pecan pie, with a cup of coffee,,, the best thing that I have ever had,,, it's a to die for.

What a damn good time!! Lots and lots of dancing with ransoms, loud music, hula hoops, games, maybe food ... can't quite remember!! We started out pregaming at a friend's house, then hit a party bus and ended the night with the Duce!! 


I wish I could give you more in this review, but I had such a good drunk time that I can't remember much besides the good drinks and good dancing with random people. I hope the pics illustrate exactly what I'm saying .., see you next time at the Duce!!

I had such a good experience here. This place is perfect for a large group that needs to pay separately. They have indoor and outdoor space for seating. It's super eclectic! My group ordered the spinach mac n cheese muffins, the breakfast sliders, the brisket Reuben sliders and the ribs with corn. The sliders were actually pretty large and came with 3. The bread for the Reuben sliders was really soft. The breakfast sliders used cheddar biscuits. The ribs fell off the bone. For drinks at the bar on Saturdays, they have a bar with fresh ingredients. We ordered a black and blue mojito, a regular mojito, a grapefruit schlimm, whiskey sours and mimosas. All had fresh juice incorporated. It was fun to watch our bartender make them!! Very nice staff and delicious food.

Saw this place on Diner, Drive-In and Dives. So a bunch of us went there for lunch. It's funky alright but not as cool as I thought. WAY over priced food, $3.50 for 8 oz bottle of diet coke. The slider sampler platter was $12 no frys or chips... The Mac  and cheese muffins were over cooked and dry. Service, well... You order your food and pick it up yourself, our parties food were ordered at the same time but there was a 15 minute lag time between orders. Being completed, unacceptable. I was embarrassed for suggesting this place, there is no air condition and being in a warehouse it was just too hot.

CONS: over-priced food, greasy food, cockroaches , too loud
PROS: Unique atmosphere
I tried this place out last night. A friend and I had been meaning to catch up...and yikez, this was not the place to do it. It was very very loud. I think it was karaoke night or something because people were volunteering to sing horrible songs in horrible voices. It was TOO NOISY (considering only 15 people were there) and very hard to make conversation. 
I ordered the chicken pot pie which was delicious. I would get it again next time I go, which will probably be never.
My friend ordered the melted cheese sandwich which she said was just okay. 
We shared the mac and cheese muffins which were horrible! They were luke warm, flavor and saltless, basically tasteless, and kinda made me nauseous after. We only ate a couple and left 1/2 of them for the roaches. 
I feel like i'm wasing my time writing this review. Basically. DO NOT GO FOR THE FOOD, check it our for the atmosphere...probably a fun place to show up drunk to.

Loved this place! Great drinks and sliders. The ambience is laid back and fun. They have 3 or 4 different bars and ping pong tables, a boxing ring and a cool nostalgic boutique. It was fun to see everyone having a good time seeing karaoke. Even I had to get in on the fun and Sing-a-Song. Come and check this place out it's fun and not too expensive.
Today, I had the pleasure of meeting Hannah, one of the Duce's team members.  Great conversation and a truly enjoyable atmosphere made me a believer.  I like this place a lot.
Chicken pot pie, mac/cheese muffins and a jar of cider. Great atmo... more "old skool" than "hipster". Wish I was from Phoenix!

It depends on when you go. During the week awesome, fun. Great place for groups period I went on a double date and it was a zoo. The staff was not very helpful. We couldn't find a table period want to relax went with the flow, it was fine. Not as much as a weekday outing.

Great atmosphere and decor, yet needs a lot of improvement on service. My party waited for over an hour for our food. 

People standing around the kitchen complaining about slow service!
The Duce was a fun, happening spot. The DJ was excellent and really had the whole place going. Delicious drinks and great service! I wish our party stayed their all night because I had a blast!

My friends and I all love going to The Duce! They have great cocktails (although a bit expensive for college students) and they have never charged a cover when we go. We always have a great time and it never gets ridiculously crowded like some bars. The one issue I have with the place is their lack of music variety.
