It fit perfectly for their 50s retro themed wedding.  The staff is awesome, the food was great, the venue is amazing and so much fun.  Thank you Steve, Ellen and Staff for a very memorable night!  All the guests raved about what a wonderful place it was.  Much success to you!

SO glad I checked this place out!  Awesome, fun atmosphere.  You DO order at a stand and then have to wait for your food.  However, the environment is so cool you won't care. Mac & Cheese muffins were definitely amazing!  Staff was fun.

Really its a 2 1/2 just not deserving enough of a 3

The good: 

The place itself is pretty rad and eccentric!
The lemonade is soo yumny and perfect on a hot summer day! 
The sliders are tasty and flavors are inviting. 
Family friendly.

The bad:

My chips were completely burnt and i mean they looked more like charcoal than sweet potato chips. 
I took them back and was promised a new set, which i never got so i pretty much gave away my money. 
That alone threw me off. 
The cups offered  for water were dirty.
the water was hot. for their prices atleast some ice and lemon wedges would be nice.

Customer service was ok other than not bringing me my darn chips. 

I would go give it another try for the heck of the sliders and lemonades but it will be a while.

Give 4 stars cause took way too long to get my food. I had the famous chicken pot pie in a jar and the Mac n cheese bites. Both great!
U also have to try the strawberry bruschetta... Mmmm good!!

Finally a Place to dance and have fun.  The music and the vibe was great.  Not too heavy on hip hop - thank you - little bit of everything.  
Yes there is a lot going on here, but the place is awesome.  You could spend all day here just hanging out.  Though I was confused about the boxing ring?

Whether you're a resident of the Phoenix area or just here for a few days, The Duce should definitely be on your list of places to venture to. They offer a unique experience that is fostered by an open concept floor plan. They have a wide variety of games and other activities to partake in and the selection of music is very eclectic so everyone can find something to dance to. The food and drinks are amazing and not outrageously priced.
I've not had so much fun in a long time. The games, great mix of music, delicious drinks, eclectic interior design, this place has it all.

Love this place when it's not summer.  It's a converted building (used to be a boxing gym back when buildings were built of chewing tobacco, brick and fear) so it is hot.  There is no cool air circulating in the place.  Food is tasty (sliders, fried mac and cheese) etc.  But really just come for the cocktails.  It's nice to have another place that takes pride in it's mixers.  They make their own lemonade, they steep some of their own liquors.  More importantly, they make one of the best grey hounds I've ever had in this town.   Granted it's a little far south and can get warm, but the good news is, you can come on over, pretend that you aren't an aging hipster and order a few cocktails that will remind you of why it is you still work that 9-5 job.

I was in need of a joint that was somewhat close and offered karaoke on a Thursday night.  I had heard about this place from friends, and watched the DDD episode a few years ago.  I hadn't yet gone due to the reports of the long waits for service and higher than average prices.

The valet service is nice since the parking there is tricky, the fellas were friendly and quick when we arrived.  I walked in and immediately was entertained by the idea that people go to The Duce and spend $120 on a pair of sweat pants, which are for sale in the boutique near the front entrance.

Next we wandered over to the bar and realized we had infiltrated a private party, to which we were immediately invited to leave.  Walked past the boxing ring, which I find both awesome and bizarre, and on to the karaoke area.

Immediately I noticed that the other folks there were better than average, which I'll be honest kind of intimidated me.  I ordered a couple of drinks, they were about $10 each and come in a decent sized mason jar.  

After I had a few sips, the prices made sense and I had zero buyers remorse (which happens from time to time whenever you're spending double digits on a freaking drink).  The servers were as quick as they could be, as crafting handmade artisan cocktails isn't necessarily easy!

The dj was cranky, but he warmed up to us after a while, and we all had a great time drinking and singing until the place closed down.  I didn't get to experience the food, or any of the other random and cool things there, but I did have a great time, and would recommend coming on a school night to avoid the big crowds and long waits.

4 stars for this spot as a bar/hang out spot to come with friends, but 2 stars for their desserts. The Duce is an interesting hipster/eclectic space where you can eat, drink, and also play games (ping pong, fooze ball, corn hole, hula hoop). They even have a boxing ring available on the weekends! We came in on a Thursday night at 10pm, and it wasn't very busy at that time. Their parking lot is really small, so they have mandatory valet. From what I could see, there isn't much street parking available. We already had dinner before coming, but decided to order dessert since they had cakes to choose from. We tried:

-Hot Vanilla Cake (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=BrzfsBWAmpAuXIerY9DMuw&userid=76vIFZcC7owykCBjMfGVXg, https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=uuOzYCOMHhbASGwMETqNdA&userid=76vIFZcC7owykCBjMfGVXg): Way too sweet, and the cake was really dense and not at all moist. Skip!
-S'mores Cheesecake (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=CJ4wTEKLmiY5qd5q-APXnw&userid=76vIFZcC7owykCBjMfGVXg, https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=cLAUFBbK6zX3Hu3AqfItvw&userid=76vIFZcC7owykCBjMfGVXg): Just ok. I liked the torched marshmallow on top but the s'mores flavor didn't really integrate well as a cheesecake. I wouldn't get this again. 

We spent a couple of hours playing the games here. This is a giant space so it's nice that you can walk around and go to different areas. I would come back for the games and to hang out, and give their food a try, but just pass on the cakes.

What The Duce!?

For starters, where the heck is this place? At first, I wasn't sure if I should be walking in simply because the factory workshop look threw me off!  Um ... hello?  No worries, once we walked into the store area that's when the fun started.  This place really got my interest.  Seems to me you can purchase some vintage items and clothes.  They had stadium-seating area with a projector screen, an ice cream shake area, boxing ring, and a small gym -- where the heck am I!   

We finally found the restaurant area shortly.  The kitchen is an old school food truck, then again everything about this place is old school; chairs, tables, etc.  I ordered the sliders because it was a recommendation - meatball, chicken sausage, and bbq brisket.  A bottle of coke -- yep it figures.  Meatball sliders were the best of the 3, the sausage was definitely and acquired taste.   My sis, had the eggs and avocado one and it was okay.  

I enjoy my visit to the Duce simply because of it's odd ball nature.  It's definitely an experience wortha visit.  -  Enjoy!

The Duce never fails to impress. The Mac and Cheese Bites, the Short Rib Sliders and the Meatball Sliders are a few of their best. All guaranteed to give you that you Ratatouille movie moment with a single bite. Do your mouth a favor and go there now.

After flying in to Phoenix, my friend picked me up and suggested we head over to the Duce. I had never been there before and got there around 10:30pm on a Tuesday night. By the time we got there the crowd had thinned out but there were a few stragglers dancing and having a good time. The decor is decidedly retro in a good way. There are ping pong tables, shuffleboard, a boxing ring and corn hole to be played. I think they serve food too but we apparently arrived too late to sample their wares. They do have a full bar though and that seemed to be the draw for many people. If I get in to town earlier next time I will definitely check it out again.

Let's start at the top, the drinks are outstanding.  There's no other place to get a 24ish ounce jar of Old Fashioned that was perfect for two people, and not just the volume was impressive, the drink itself was top notch.  Followed by some cranberry drink with enough vodka to knock out a horse, but tasted like I was drinking straight juice, very well done.  For food we ordered three items off the menu, all were good, but the surprising star in the food category was the home made chips.  No doubt I will be back.

This is one of the best restaurants I have ever been a patron of.  If you give it any less than 5/5 stars then you hate things that America stands for!  

The decor is awesome!  The food is served out of an old airstream trailer named dutchess.  It seems like everything around is collected from local thrifts.  It's mainly retro and hodgepodge.  There is a boxing ring you can step into and a store as well.  They do different events on different nights to include swing dancing, boxing, old school workouts.    

The food is spectacular!  There is a wide range of sliders, salads and drinks.  They have salads and shareable dishes to include Mac n cheese muffin bites and chicken pot pie in a mason jar.  All the drinks are served out of mason jars as well.  They have 16oz jars and 32oz jars if you're looking for a little more liquid courage.  

Give this place a shot!  You won't be let down.  They do group events and functions and can be reserved for just about anything.  So cool!

Service wasn't awesome, it's an order on your own at the food truck or bar and pick up your own order. No waiters or waitresses. But the vibe is awesome. Nice mix of people. Awesome music (old school 90s, 80s,70s, etc). Karaoke was super fun. All in all a great time. Also the drinks are awesome :-)

My friends & I came here Friday night after going to the river. The Duce is right near the Diamondbacks' stadium, so we were able to see fireworks as we pulled into the parking lot.

This restaurant/bar is cute! It's in a former warehouse, partially outdoors with the metal sliding doors wide open. It doesn't get hot inside as there was a giant fan. 

The streamline trailer dished out eats, and the drinks were served in Mason jars. Everything is made from scratch, and drinks use fresh squeezed juice. There was a dance floor, karaoke, boxing rink, hula hoops, soda fountain. It was random, it was retro, it was cool!

Eclectic decor provides an awesome atmosphere. It's something that Phoenix seems to lack, that rustic feel. A contrast from all the new and modern decor bars and lounges that scatter the area. There's definitely something inside that will catch your eye and worthy of an instagram post. It's a large open space that is nicely sectioned into smaller areas by clever placement of bars and yard games and patio space. 

My only complaint is the prices of drinks seems pretty steep for even some of the most simple cocktails. Ginger and whiskey came out to be a little over $9.
Loved it.   Food came out in a reasonable time.  Person taking orders was friendly and helpful for first time eating there.  Mac and Cheese Muffins  are fantastic.

I just happened to watch the TRIPLE D SHOW featuring the Duce...whow..the chicken pot pie I had barely resembled the one shown on Triple D...my crust..was raw and the pie barely had any ingredients..along with chicken scraps...wow..Guy was rooked and so was I...could not believe what I was seeing...just not the same at all

Talk about a great time!! Went here on Saturday night for my birthday and I  was immediately impressed by the whole place. They offer corn hole, ping pong, and other fun games, an awesome dance floor, but better yet.... The drinks! Dan, the best bartender in the world, took great care of myself and my entire group. He was a mastermind behind that bar. All the employees are extremely friendly and involved, but Dan and David stood out the most. The only downside was how hot it was.. But hey it's the middle of July. We ended up eventually leaving due to the heat, but found ourselves wanting to go back that night after other bars just didn't measure up. The Duce is awesome and I want to thank Dan and David for making my 21st birthday so special!!

Ok, I didn't want to do this.  I had a bad night there for St. Patrick's Day, but I gave it another shot for Mothers Day brunch.  This is not the same Duce I first stepped foot into two years ago.  Defrosting cheesecake is not the same as last years Rock Spring Pie, and last but not at all least YOU DO NOT SERVE ALCOHOL IN CUPCAKES TO KIDS!  Even worse, with out them marked as containing alcohol, I sent my poor mother who is in recovery and allergic to alcohol, to go ahead and eat one!  This was the worst experience yet at the Duce.  It is just not the same place it use to be.  At 20 dollars a head for brunch, I could not even find juice and had to pay for lemonades at the bar.  So for the second time this year, I spent too much money for mediocre drinks and bad cheesecake.  The sliders and fruit bread were dried out.  I am soo disappointed, I loved this place at first.  When a show turns a bad corner, they say it has jumped the shark.  Well I am sad to report that the Duce has definitely jumped the shark.

Visiting Phoenix for the week and was so glad we came here! The food was fantastic and the drinks amazing! Highly recommend the bacon Mac and cheese muffins, chicken pot pie and the amazing s'mores cheesecake (to share). The black and blue mojito was tasty as well. 
Love love the games and atmosphere! Will definitely come here again!

Very funky place. 
I'd been wanting to check it out for some time and took the opportunity last week.
Was surprised to find it fairly empty on a Sunday Funday afternoon. There were maybe 8 guests...it was a bit odd.
My girl and I took some time to explore, and finally made our way to the trailer to order some food.
Staff was very friendly. We had a tuna melt and a Chicago dog. Though the tuna was good, it was not what I expected in that it was in a hoagie roll and so was not a melt in the traditional sense. The bread was dry and crunchy. It'd have been nice to have this information beforehand. So, good but disappointing. The dog was good. We also had corn which was good.

Additionally we grabbed Bloody Mary's at a bar stand. Very full of stuff but the mix was especially bitter, or vinegary. I am not a fan. Another quirky disappointment that might best to be explained to newbies, which I proclaimed.

Also, valet parking for an empty parking lot? No thanks. 

I enjoyed some of the quirks, but would've preferred a more traditional tuna melt and bloody mary or would at least have liked to be told otherwise.

Meh.

Very interesting establishment.  Not a lot of parking but they do have valet.  We walked in to a very large space.  There was a gift shop to one side, boxing ring straight ahead and lots and lots of tables.  Very eclectically decorated.  It was a bit overwhelming.  From the initial space, there was a dance floor and bar, beyond that here where tables and the places to order outside. The ordering process was confusing.  We needed to go outside to order and wait to hear our name called. The music was loud and made it difficult to hear. I don't know how that would work out if they were really busy. The food was good. The alcoholic drinks were excellent. If the ordering process were clear, music at a reasonable level and parking situation better, they would have gotten 5 stars.

Saturday night. Drink was ok. Bartender slapped a 27% tip on there. Signed for it then realized it later - not pleased, considering I was at a bar counter and not seated. C'mon. Drink was so so. Parking is a pain. Was here only because a friend's farewell gathering was here. Not coming back.
Great fun place to go with a group.  We loved the fruit filled drinks and the ping pong!

You will either love it or hate it. 

Awesome old fashion drinks

Awesome decor and history

Not your daily radio top hit remixed music. They play all kinds....I mean Nsync and Journey. 

Just try it out....will be warm during summer time.

I too was at the Duce during the latest wine walk.  We were also told that there was no happy hour even though the sign out front clearly indicated there was one.  Tried to get s drink from the bar but it was chaos.  Ended up outside at the beer cart. 
There seemed to be enough folks working the bar but they did not have their act together.  I seriously doubt that I will ever see the inside of this place again.  After listening to the recorded voice message, I guess the owner does not care anyways.  Must be nice to be that independent.

This was our first stop in Phoenix after reading about it from Diners, Drive-ins and Dives. What a fun place! My boys loved playing all the games-ping pong,  corn hole, connect 4-while waiting on the food. Lemonade was excellent, as were the Mac and cheese bites and chicken pot pie. The Shepards Pie was also good, although a little hard to dig down past the green lease at first. Great music and a super nice and fun staff made for an all around good time. So glad we went!

It was a Sunday afternoon and some friends insisted on visiting the Deuce since I haven't been there before. We made the trek across town and showed up to what appeared to be a large hangar on the outskirts of downtown. I didn't know exactly what to expect, as my friends had given me an eclectic array of things that happened there.
Little did I know that they were right.

We walked in after the Valet took the car, and I took a look around. The high rafters of this place made it quite spacious, the decor was a bit of everything. There is a boxing ring for fight nights, some trendy distressed looking stuff and a place to purchase their Tee shirts, which have some smart quotes and sayings on them. 

We wandered around the corner, and Lo! A bar!... But it was Sunday and we needed food before beverages. In the courtyard is a food truck, and we ordered Ribs, sliders and some other stuff. The Ribs were delicious, the Barbecue sauce was sweet and tasty. The sliders were not as good, but they were still tasty. To finish lunch off we had some mixed cocktails.

I enjoy a good bloody mary, so I ordered one, knowing the ingredients were all fresh and 'wholesome', but it lacked a bit of spice for me. Thinking I had the solution, I added a few drops of the hot sauce to it, only to discover I way overcompensated. 

I would definitely recommend this place to bring some friends and have lunch, but I've also heard great things about this place once the sun goes down. It turns into more of a party venue, and they have boxing and burlesque on select nights, and from my friends' stories, it's an awesome time!

It's a food truck, essentially. The ambience is kinda cool - eclectic & fun, there's a lot to do; ping pong tables, hula hoops, etc. but there's also kids running around, so there's that. As a food truck, I suppose it's ok, but it's WAY overpriced. We got a hotdog, meatball sliders, "Reuben" sliders that turned out to be a bbq beef w/cole slaw & shredded cheese, hamburger sliders, 2 lemonades, a tea & a coke - for $59! All sides are extra. No free refills on anything but tea & all soda & beer appears to be served in cans or bottles. You pay before you eat, & they ask you for either a 15% or 20% tip! You order at the counter, you pick up your food when they call you, & we waited nearly an hour from the time we ordered until our food was ready - what service exactly am I tipping for? Cocktails range $10-$13 - EACH, & shots are $7-$8. It's VERY loud, music playing constantly & loud enough to be heard inside & outside, making conversation almost impossible. Parking is almost impossible, but they do have "complimentary" valet service, which you also must wait for. Power is provided by several large (& loud) generators - maybe that's why the music is so loud?
The cocktails here are seriously next level. The fresh fruit realllly makes a difference and it's totally worth the price! I just wish they had A/C and some better tunez

Way too expensive for what it was.  The food was pretty good but not great.  The ambience felt like hipsters trying to be cool and different, but it didn't quite come together for me.  Drinks were too expensive for the venue and I can't get over their abbreviation of "Ou" for "ounce".  There's already a standard abbreviation--Oz--and it doesn't sound cool or hip to use something else; it just sounds lame.

I love the Duce it is super fun and they have great drinks. They hold a Hulu hoop contest every Friday night where you can win a drink unless I'm there then I'm going to win the free drink. Please check the Duce remember to have a designated driver you will need it after all the hula hooping corn hole and pull ups. They have an organic produce lemonade available but unfortunately not a ton of vegan options on the food menu hopefully they will have some coming soon!

The Duce is by far one of my favorite spots to visit and my go-to when showing friends around Phoenix. I mainly come on Thursdays for salsa and always have a blast.

The food is also amazing. The brisket sliders and spinach mac and cheese muffins are some of my favorites. I LOVE the s'mores cheesecake but it is way too big for just a couple people unless you have a massive sweet tooth. I would only get it if I have a large party with me. 

While the staff are friendly, the service for food can be slow at times, especially if it's a busy night.
I would recommend to order food first before doing anything else. So while you are waiting for your name to be called, you can go off dancing, hula hoop, play ping pong, or shop.

Rally in the Valley was in full effect for the visiting NY Mets fans part of the "7 Line Army" supporter group. Really excited to have been a part of this exclusive event with mostly Mets fans, pre-game festivities. The venue was a perfect selection for the amount of fans that were in the establishment, and the service offered from the staff was outstanding! How many places that serve food and drinks have a boxing ring inside...that in itself is impressive! Very wide open floor plan with ping pong tables, and other outdoor recreational games. 
As far as food I did have a classic hot dog, sprinkled with freshly cut onions. My drink was the strawberry limeade, which came with Vodka, mixed with smashed strawberries, limes, soda and agave mix. This drink was specifically refreshing for the humid day! Talk about a memorable sporting event in a cool location in downtown phoenix!

The Duce was awesome!  Teenagers loved it. Food was great. Amazing atmosphere and great place to hang out with the kids. One warning, we were there in July, and it's hot!  Just dress accordingly because it's worth it. Great time!

Solid four  stars for the drinks and atmosphere. A little bummed that they didn't live up to their offer on urban wine walk event . Actually, really bummed bit I'm about to give up on the walk and have a strawberry shortcake cocktail... Maybe that'll make it better. We do love the Duce!

The Duce was the last stop for my last night of 39 and got their before the midnight hour forced me into the Fab & 40 club. I have never been to The Duce and had been looking forward to going.  As soon as I walked into The Duce, I was awe struck, I absolutely love this place! 

At the last stop my friends and I were at, I left a lil tipsy and was in need of some food, so when we 1st got to the Duce, 1st item of business that needed taken care of was order some food, after surveying the menu and debating on if I wanted something sweet or not, I went with the cheeseburger sliders.  Let me tell you, these were the best cheeseburger sliders I have had in a very very long time, the bread was soft, tender yet held the sliders together well, the cheese was perfectly melted over the burger, oh it was just delish!

The Duce has plenty to offer everyone, corn hole, foosball, Ping-Pong, hula hooping, dancing, singing, drinking or just chilling, The Duce has space for it all!  Only down side I have is that it's hot, but that's the Phoenix summer weather, I am sure when it's no longer summer ticket, The Duce would be rocking! I am looking forward to coming back and playing some games for sure!

Came here twice. The first time was not bad. Since we were the only customer, we did not really notice the speed of the service, even though it was not very attentive, we figured it was kind of the attitude of the place. Food was great though.

The second time we came back, thinking it is a decent place to get a bite and recommended to our friends to come here for lunch, was a mistake.

There was a swing dance type event, however, most people seemed to be ordering drinks. And there were lots of empty tables. So we figured that there should not be too long of a wait because we were all pretty hungry.

It took 20-30 minutes just to get someone to attend to us and take our orders at the bar. The staff taking our orders were constantly distracted and very slow.

We waited for 45 min then found out we had to go to the bar and ask for our drinks. None of them were made or served without us continuously asking about whether our order was getting made or not. 

After we finally got our drinks, we entertained ourselves at the play area that has a ping pong table and couple of other games, but after another hour, we were running out of patience.

We waited 2 hours for our food, and the last person that ordered waited 2.5 hours, which is after everyone had already finished eating. Again, the food was great, but the service was not very attentive. It did seem like they were a little under staffed for the crowd, but still... there was not a real good system for getting your food or drinks after you have ordered, especially when the music is blaring. Your "nick name" was called over the muffled speaker for you to either pick up or someone from the staff "might" bring it to you, if they know where or who you are. I'd recommend checking periodically to make sure you did not miss it if you go.

The food got 4 stars, when we finally got them but the service was so bad that I had to take two stars off. And the food was not really worth the 2-hour wait, especially when the service was really little to none during the wait. 

It really was sucky for us because we paid upfront when we ordered and even tipped, and finding out later that we weren't really going to get much service at all, we regretted that we included the tip.

My advice for this place, make sure they are not busy before you decide to go there hungry... or if you have hours to kill and not super hungry, not a bad place to hangout if you do not expect to be serviced.

I want to like this place~ Unfortunately, given this place two tries, we will not return again, due to lack of service.

The best Moscow Mule in town. It's gotta be ginger beer and we don't need a fancy copper mug; just give us the Duce Jar.  Two rounds will do ya good.

For what it's worth, I don't care how many rounds I have, I don't see myself ever spending $58 on a graphic tee. That's just nuts~

I love the idea of The Duce and had a blast hanging out with friends here, but the service was very lacking. We had a group of 15+ people by the end of the night. a handful of us were here from 7pm- midnight. We enjoyed many handmade cocktails that were freshly muddled and served in quart size mason jars - at the tune of $15-21. But a quart does last quite a while...but is watered down by the end. One friend was trying to get the bartenders attention for a while before moving onto another bar to try to get a drink. A couple times he disappeared from his 'station' (the small bar near the food counter). We joked that we should just hop in there and make our own...but he finally came back. 

I was in the party with another reviewer who mentions our food taking an hour and a half to get ready...and after that hour and a half we still had not heard our name being called. We go to the pick up window and ask if it's ready and it's there. Freezing cold. The cook says, oh yea, that's been sitting there a while. No offer to re-make, warm it up or anything. And our group was hanging out right near the food counter. How did we miss it and why didn't they get our attention when the food was ready? I'm sure we didn't hear the name being called because it was later in the night and the DJ had started blasting music for the dance floor. A better system is in order for serving food when we have to rely on a loudspeaker that is drowned out by the dance music. 

The valet situation was horrible at the end of the night. I've been to many other downtown spots that have valet and crowds but never a line that takes 20 minutes. We finally asked for our keys and were directed to where the car was parked so we could walk and get it ourselves. 

I'll probably be back but hope The Duce can improve their service, pay more attention to paying customers and figure out the valet situation. It's not the best area so I don't want to walk a block or two on this dark, sketchy block.
Very random. Boxing Rink, Mason Jars and Mixologist. You have to try it to get it. Good Soild Food, Great Drinks. Alot of RANDOM FUN!

I can't say enough about our experience at the Duce. We searched for weeks for a good venue for our party of 650 people. We were coming in for a convention. We stumbled upon the Duce. It was absolutely perfect. 

First, the pricing we paid to rent the whole place out was very reasonable. There were bar stations set up everywhere. You literally never had to wait for a drink. If one bar was crowded, there were 6 or 7 other ones set up around the place. 

This place is huge. Some people wanted to sit and have conversation by the food truck. Some wanted to dance. Some wanted to box and play games on the other side. There was something for everyone. The hula hoop contest was a big hit. 

The DJ did a pretty good job or playing a good mix between stuff the older crowd wanted and dance music later on as the older crowd left. 

The only minor "complaint" I have is if you know 600+ people are showing up at the same time for a party, maybe some other way of taking orders and getting food to patrons should be worked out. The food line was long, and some people waited well over an hour to eat. And it was hard to hear the names as they were called out over the music. Bigger bathrooms would also be great. 

Other than that, everything was perfect. We've thrown many parties after conventions, and this was by far the biggest hit amongst our group. I just wish you guys had one of these in Nashville for our next party!

Bravo.

Too busy, this place is just not my demographic.  The music is great but it just feels like a going to a large estate sale in the Midwest where people are drinking cocktails while shopping for that eclectic item that no one else wants besides themselves.  Drinks are good, little spendy considering the vibe.  Great eye candy for me, kinda of like an old school Dr Pepper commercial, great for thirty seconds, you can look but not touch.

Location: Not my favorite at all!  I hate walking down here from downtown.  

Food:  Pretty tasty! I have enjoyed all that I have ordered.

Drinks: Super pricey but super delicious!  I had one of the strawberry lemonades, and a friend got the basil something drink.  They put quite a bit of produce in the drinks.   

Service: The bartender was rather friendly and interesting to chat with. Of course, the friend I was with talks to everyone, but still, it was fun! 

The concept of the Duce is a bit confusing to me. The boxing ring, rope and weights seem out of place.   Also, the clothing / goods here are rather overpriced.  

Parking:  is a pain! Meters are now not as free for as long as they were before August of 2014, and there's a teeny tiny lot near the Duce.  Walking is OK if you're with someone - but still rather sketch.

Fun & funky. We went there on a Sunday late afternoon, so it wasn't very crowded. I'm sure it's a MUCH different vibe at night or on the weekends. Lots of retro kitsch all over the place, in a good way. Plenty of games to play and things to see. A couple of craft beers available, but I decided to go "ironic" and get a Hamm's and a Schlitz. Yup, just as crappy as I ever remembered, but brought back great memories. Food was good - ribs and housemade chips, sliders and salads for friends and kids. Servers were super-friendly. My only complaint -- on a 100 degree day it gets HOT in there. Uncomfortably hot. Could really use some A/C or even some much stronger fans.

So far I'm not exactly impressed. I know that I should give it a few more goes until I write up my review but I just couldn't believe how rude and pushy the men were behind every single bar counter. On my birthday seriously. I could not believe it. My boyfriend had ordered me a drink n walked away because the bartender at the main bar was taking forever to make my drink until he was finished to pay for it for my bday.  The bartender finished and looked over me and asked rudely excuse me do you want a drink? I said that's the rio verde right? My boyfriend ordered that for me and then he asked me for my id and barely looked at it. Then handed it back quickly asking if I wanted to close or leave the tab open, since my boyfriend was the one stuck on his phone not paying attention I decided to close and pay for it since I did not want to be anywhere near that damn bar before I blew a fuse. I've had it with rude people and the second bar guy near the bar close to the kitchen was rude as well when we were trying to leave. Which I refuse to get into because the bartenders were just ungodly rude and I personally don't want to go back but my boyfriend says he will only go back for the drinks since we can make the food so much better than what we tried. We tried the brisket and short ribs sliders and were kind of disgusted in a way because they lacked flavor along with the Mac and cheese muffins since my home made Mac and cheese is amazing.

If I were to return would be some kind of nonsense because my boyfriend would like drinks. I would not enjoy being in the establishment to say the least.
This place has it all!  Pot Pie. Mac and cheese muffins. Sliders. A boxing ring. Table tennis. Bleachers. Clothing store. Outside sitting. Great staff!!!  Wow!!!  Go there now!!!!
Good food but not worth the wait....very slow to take your order and excruciatingly slow to get food out.  Even a slightly slow lunch crowd

It was a friend's birthday outing and they chose this spot. I was a little skeptical of course because out of all the years I've lived in Phoenix, I've never heard of this place. They have self parking and valet there. I suggest valet though because some of my friends got tickets that night. Walked in and I think there was a private party going on in one end. 

Then, we walked over to the other side. I noticed a boxing ring in there and that was different, lol. There was a dancing area, had their own little DJ booth, and even corn hole. Also, a ping pong table and two bars, random to be, but I really enjoyed it! You served your own water too at the water station, lol. If you were hungry they had it to where it was a food truck style place. Some variety on the menu. I was bummed out because they ran out of pot pie. I settled with some sliders. I had the brisket and meatball. Those were pretty good!  Some of us also shared an alcoholic beverage in a big jug. I forgot the name of the drink, but that did not disappoint either!

It was really a chill spot. Everything was roomy, i felt relaxed, and most importantly there was just plenty of diversity there. A cool thing about it was that when you order you HAVE TO provide a nickname so that the DJ can call you on the mic when you food is ready! Speaking of the DJ, a lot of oldies, but every song was just the right kind of song because of how the mood was there. Chilled and relax. Should be back here for some drinks soon.

The Duce offers the right vibe for everyone. We got there a little early so it was still kid friendly. The yard games and plenary of places to sit made for a unique and comfortable backyard environment. I ordered a vodka lemonade with their fresh squeezed juice but it wasn't very cold... anywhere. They could have used a couple more swamp coolers and fans, but it is July in Arizona after all.

The food was very good the lemonade was delicious it's very big and open, it's a fun place to be with a group of friends or family they have many games you can play such as corn hole or ping pong also Foos ball they also have a section where you can buy clothes and shoes you can also work out in the boxing ring to

Great spot near the Suns and Diamondback games.

Everyone is ordering labor intensive drinks, so the bar moves somewhat slowly, but that's sort of the Duce's thing... these drinks are real good and everything is made from scratch. The specialty drinks are worth the wait, but know that you have to wait the same amount of time to pay over $4 for an Old Style 12 oz can...

Love love love this spot! Try the chicken pot pie in a jar! Delish. I've had two birthday parties here! At night they have a DJ and music. Mac-n-cheese bites are superb. I really dig the nostalgic atmosphere!

Awesome place especially when the weather is great. Higher prices in drinks but the corned bee sliders are pretty amazing. Like Leprechaun and a U I corn having a golden baby that becomes president amazing. The rest is good. Be sure to take out a small loan or bring a good cosigner I you're making a night o it because you'll need it. Maybe. Second mortgage. They have a $25 mojito with berries n stuff. They sell baby butt soft t-shirts for $33 dollars. I could have a Thai child build me a house for the price of a shirt here. Anyways they have ping pong so it's all worth it.

I was there this weekend for the first time and I love so many things about that place. 1. The space is lovely. 
2. DJ was amazing.
3. So many things to do. Played ping pong, foosball. Never got to the bean bags.
4. The teen with us loved her pot pie
Not so great things
1.  I was not impressed with the customer service when ordering dinner. I explained we were newbies and I didn't get the warm and fuzzy, let me tell you now things work here feeling. Very disappointing. 
2. We played ping pong near the big floor fan/boxing ring. Both my niece, 14 yrs old and I fell chasing the ball. That raised area tripled us both. My knee still has some swelling. Btw, I don't drink.
3. Dinner for 3 without drinks (we drank water) was $52 + tip. My niece thought her food was great. My daughter had the sliders she said was lukewarm. I had the ribs and I felt like they were drowned in sauce. Sauce was tasty but the ribs didn't taste grilled. More like they were baked or boiled. I was not impressed considering what I paid for them.  And it took about 45 mins to get it to use. Corn and potatoes were good.
I will be back as I really had a great time. Even after I fell, I suffered through the pain to finish my ping pong game.

Was going to goto last exit till I stumbled upon this place , pretty big place and had some girls inside so I gave it a shot,  music , karoke, clothing store, tennis , bean bags, boxing ring,  weird setup but cool at the same time , great elements for a place to chill , eat, and get drunk

Mixed feelings about this place. I suppose maybe I needed a warning and didn't read the yelp reviews ;) the atmosphere if this place is amazing!!! Yard games to play, a boxing ring and punching bags. A dance floor with a love dj on a Saturday night. Lots of space which is perfect for anther crowd. So is the fact that they have picnic tables to fit in your larger group if you plan to eat together. The drinks weren't cheap but each was individually made. The juices all freshly squeezed and lots of fancy garnishes! The Moscow mile was very tasty and the Cranberry Cobbler was sweet but very good also. The food...another story. We weren't hungry upon arriving so we decided to have some drinks and hang out with friends. We checked out the place and decided we should order some food since a friend mentioned hers was going to take 20 minutes. By the time we got to the line to order the wait was one and a half hour. 1.5 hours?!?!?! WTF!!!!! I was completely shocked. Do they only cook one meal at a time? I know the kitchen is on the smaller side but I'd just never heard of such a thing. I work in the food industry so I brushed it off, enjoyed a couple more drinks while patiently watching the clock. Right around that 1.5 hour mark we notice food sitting in the window, although not wanting to be rude we didn't want to bother anyone to ask. About 10 minutes later was walk up there since we hadn't heard our name and were starving at this point. The man said the food had been sitting there for quite some time. Our sweet potato chips were completely cold and our sliders were not appetizing at all. He didn't offer anything for us or to maybe reheat the food we had waited the hour and a half for, just blamed us for not listening for our name well enough. What a disappointment!!! Can't say I'd eat there again, the cold food was terrible, even after having a couple drinks!

You walk in and are surrounded by music, clanking of games being played, and laughter. The food was top-notch and the atmosphere was amazing. The set up to get your food and drinks was a little different but I felt that is what gave the place a unique vibe. We had the sliders and macaroni bites. They were absolutely delish.
So eclectic ... shopping, hula hoops, boxing, ping pong, bags - oh plus food and drink.  Super Fun for a summer active outing.

After the endless bro-bar scene in Scottsdale  this is a really nice change of pace. Friendly staff, great music, and so many activities. (Insert step brothers joke here) boxing, ping pong, shuffle board, karaoke, and many more.  plus, ever spill your drink on your date? Awkward right? Never fear, full clothing store in the bar. That's what I call solid foresight.

This is one of our faves for the fam! Ping pong, cornhole, BOXING! What? Why? How? Our preteens  love it as much as we do! Drinks are speakeasy style and the bartenders / mixologists are pretty much pros! My only, only, only thing that keeps me from a five star is that the prices are very steep.

What a fun place! Came with a group for a company event. Everything went off flawlessly- service, food, drinks: not one hiccup. When we got there we weren't sure where our tables were but it gave us time to walk around and check out the place while looking for our seats. Games  surround you and they even have special events in the boxing ring. Tonight people were playing bags and ping pong- nothing going on for boxing. We got our seats and off to the bar! The drinks here are phenominal. All craft cocktails made fresh. They have a specialty list of mojito's so that's what I got while my friend got a whiskey sour. Both garnished with fruit and both really yummy! (they also have quite the extensive beer menu)

As we chatted the food started coming in.. bites of mac and cheese muffins, Duce dip, 3 cheese dip, beer can chicken (roasted on a can of Old Milwaukee!) and little mini salads in tiny mason jars! The spread was incredible! Side note- you will not be on a diet here! Even the salads are dressing heavy but when here make it a cheat nite! 

While parking is challenging here we were lucky to be on a night where they had complimentary valet.  

Everyone needs to check out the Duce in its uniqueness and all the funness it provides!

This place is amazing wish we had one back home love the atmosphere and people are really friendly. 
We will be coming back again,for sure.

I'm so happy I found this place because it's now my ultimate favorite! I came in on Friday night on a double date and it was non stop fun! You get corn hole, fuse ball, ping pong and many other games. Plus a dj and a dance floor! What topped everything off for me was how good the drinks were! Plus the whole place is so so nice. The only downfall is that they have no ac. Yet even then you totally forget that it's hot because of how much fun you're having!
I was here for a family birthday party recently. The grapefruit mimosa is great. I had some chicken was which was okay and the brisket was not so good.

I like this bar. 

Seriously. Karaoke. The theme. The boxing ring. The games. And the drinks are so cheap.

Honestly, this bar is perfect. If you read my reviews, you know I am not one for hanging out in bars that are overly crowded (Sorry. I like to have my personal space to myself). The Duce gets pretty busy, however, it has the floor space to handle it. It's a pretty large bar with a couple of different areas to hang out in. This is awesome because if you want to dance, you can. If you want to hang out with friends and chat, you can. If you want to go browse the random marketplace that is attached... you can...... random. But whatever. I do have to say that this bar will continue to be one that I will return to.

I love everything about this place. The location is perfect. Yes at first you are like, "Is this the place?" The atmosphere when you go in is like a smooth, chill, relaxed, breathe of fresh air. I need to go when there are more people like on a weekend. I went on a Wednesday and there were a few people there. I ordered the chicken pot pie, the brisket sliders, and I have to tell you it blew me away with how much I loved it.  The staff were awesome with me and they were very friendly. I will definitely be back to try out their swing dancing, if anyone wants to go, and their karaoke, if anyone wants to go.
Sadler and Frankie were exceptionally great service. Thank you!!! We will be looking forward to coming back and enjoying the drinks....soon!!!

I was lucky enough to celebrate my 22nd birthday here a few weeks back with some good friends. I couldn't have picked a better place! We arrived around 9 and stayed till closing, alternating between dancing, drinking, and trying out the games. The drinks were delicious, and I loved drinking out out of mason jars. The ice cream shakes were also really good! The drinks are kind of expensive, (about $8-$10 per drink). However, I am totally alright with paying those prices thanks to the great staff, fun atmosphere, and excellent dancing. Can't wait to go back!

Funky place! We shared the slider sampler--7 different ones--favorites were the brisket and the egg slider which sounded boring, but was surprisingly flavorful and loaded with bacon. The s'mores cheesecake is incredible and could feed at least 4 hungry people which  were not after eating the sliders. We passed on the overpriced drinks. Great music in the background, interesting retro items for sale--a fun change and we will be back. But do go early and avoid the sun.

Definitely a fun place to dine. Had our last dinner there after a weekend in the Scottsdale/Phoenix area. Had to get the Mac n Cheese muffins after watching Guy freak out over them on triple D. They were yummy but definitely need to be shared by three or more! Would love to stop by when the ring is open for sparring! Really good food and fun atmosphere!

Just ok. We went on a mid day on Saturday for our first time,The concept is great - eat, play, drink. Parking is valet and not much room. Metered street parking available a little further away. A bit confusing when you walk in. From what we could tell there is no table service only self service. Food was mediocre. We ordered Chicago dogs but the bun was too heavy and plain and the dog itself was overloaded and messy. If we return again, we will try something else to see if food is always just so-so. Very fun vibe and whimsical decorations.

Gosh I want to I really want to give The Duce more stars but sadly that won't be happening ...
We came here tonight for a work holiday party.. and let me say this place is freaking weird it's like hipster spot or something i really can't tell.. but 19 salons all on one side of the place.. 
so this girls walking around with macaroni muffins topped with goat cheese. Omg they tasted so bland. The goat cheese over powered it take that off. So now the lines of "buffet" style food more like small appetizer bites of buffet style food.. not sure if this is how the are here with just small bites not a real meal?
Ok so let's start with the chicken in a beer can. Not bad it had a ton of flavor the skin omg the skin so tasty .. then a build ur own mashed potatoes now this was so good tons of flavor and so cute it was in a little mason jar. We got salads again in cute little mason jars only thing was the vinaigrette was nonexistent. Then again the ladies walked around with my little bites this time it was a cheese roll which was good if it didn't have a huge dollop of goat cheese..it didn't need the dang goat cheese it really took away from the roll... and a meatball roll which was more like a dry meatball with no flavor...but the best thing out of tonight was the little chicken pot pies again in a Manson jar lmao.. but that was the best best little bite of the night.
So not sure if we would come back here like just because but it was nice to get out of Glendale and have a fun Sunday night with the comp

The Duce is a great place to have some fun! Whether you want to play corn hole, ping pong, have dinner, drinks, dessert, or just dance, they have it all! You can spend as much $ or as little as you'd like. I've been here a couple times. If you go late, leave your little ones at home. We'll be back!

Don't come here in the summer. It's very hot and they don't have AC running. Food is great and have tons of games. However, lack of staff. Takes forever to order drinks from the bartender, and it's awkward to just stand there and wait at the bar since there is no server at the table.
Love everything about this place. Good drinks, and great staff. Family friendly, and amazing Mac and cheese muffins. Will recommend this place more and continue to be a guest.
Different and fun, good amount of parking. Great date place with lots of fun folks

Went here for a birthday party in which my classmates rented out the whole place.  This place has awesome decor and im happy with the location.  I wish Phoenix had more original bars like this.  The food was tasty, the cocktails outstanding, and the beer service was good.

WOW! I want a place like this in Chicago. What a cool space. What friendly staff. What incredible food! 

We stopped by here for a few light bites and a couple of drinks during our first day in Phoenix and were completely blown away by everything about The Duce. I only wish we had more time to hang out longer and sample more of the goodies they had to offer. 

Not to mention the fact that it was super cool to see a couple casually stroll in with their canine companion. My wife and I were missing our four-legged friends something fierce and we would've loved to enjoy their company in this chill atmosphere. 

Next time I'm in the area, this is a MUST visit. No complaints. 

Oh, and be sure to order the mac & cheese muffin bite things. They're so good, they should actually rename them "AMAZEBALLS." (I hate myself for saying that). ((But it's true.))

Can't really leave a fair review as they were out of like 75% of the food menu. Strike one
When food was ordered SOMEHOW part of the order was missed (even tho the cashier answered a specific question about the food that she forgot to order) Strike two
Couldn't access half of the place due to a private event. Strike three
The drinks were ok and the atmosphere was pretty laid back. Not enough to bring me back again tho...I'm sure there are plenty more patio bars around

Should you ever find yourself in need of a vintage french military jacket, a deviled egg platter, a pair of PF Flyers and a quick spar in the boxing ring, all with a side of delicious meatball sliders and a gimlet, The Duce has you covered.  
Love it.  Love that it's close to work.  My new fave! :)

The Duce will be everything you put into it. It's a Rorschach Test. If you're a lame, it's gonna be lame. If you know how to have fun, you won't find a better spot to let loose in. 

Quality here is key. The ingredients, the accents, the care in preparation. Ask their staff, their cooks, on what they make their food with. Down to the slightest detail they will provide you goods (and they are surprisingly health conscious when approaching even the "comforty foods" that would seem otherwise). 

THEY HAVE THE BEST CUBA LIBRE IN ARIZONA. Not even joking. Rum Bar in downtown couldn't even touch the Rum they have in the well. Organic, spiced, incredible. Best of all: Served in a Mason Jar, big daddy style. 

Try the chips. Prepared on the spot. Ask them how they're made, the health considerations they've made in the approach. 

The Sliders are must-have fare. 

The pies in a jar... UNREAL. Go here for dessert. Go here for the pie. In a jar. Take the jar home. Drink booze in said jar (winning formula right there). 

Okay, back to the booze. Old school spin on all of it. Their mint and other garnish: gorgeous. Nothing shoddy looking. Juices squeezed right in front of your eyes with some old school hardware: a press afixed to the bar itself. 

For the lo-fi: plenty of PBR, Schlitz and the like at a dirt cheap price. 

If you're man enough: make one of the workouts with Steve "Coach" on Wednesday, Friday and/or Sunday. Old school style, featured on now a couple of TV shows (I want to say the Travel Channel...?). Legit. The camaraderie there is incredible. The personal care is unmatched - I don't think I've met two owners who care more and POUR MORE of themselves into a place. These two (Steve and Andi) have the touch. 

Tell them GECKO sent you and you'll get love. 

DINE ON

ok. man. 

i'm on yelp pretty frequently, and although i usually just opt for posting photos of restaurants and their food instead of actually writing reviews, my experience of the duce just has to be told. 

so it's your average sunday. the weather outside was perfect and i wanted to get out and try something new for lunch and possibly get some day drinking in.  after looking over a few places downtown on yelp, the dude and i settled on the duce.  

WHAT A TERRIBLE, TERRIBLE, MISTAKE. 

now don't get me wrong, i knew that the duce was going to be in an old warehouse downtown that someone had turned into a restaurant.  in fact, that's what drew me in in the first place.  that and the menu sounded like they had some choice lunch items. meatball sliders? yeah man, let's do this.  that and in addition to the restaurant, they also sell clothing and other accessories. it was all sounding pretty good. 

when we first entered the warehouse, we were in the area that sold clothing and other knick-knacks.  because the place is pretty huge, we weren't exactly sure where the restaurant was, and were hoping one of the MANY employees who were standing around might steer us in the correct direction. but no, not a single word from anyone. ok fine, whatever. 

so we locate the restaurant portion of the warehouse, and see many long bench style tables, a bar, and an outside portion with more seating.  we spot the bartender and say hello as we're walking up, hoping that she'll inform us of how this all works (do we just sit wherever and have a waiter take our order? do we order at the bar? etc.). the bartender shoots back a quick hello and then immediately begins to chat it up with another waitress, completely ignoring that we're even there. ooook, i guess we're just supposed to figure this out ourselves!  we see that they've got their menu posted on the wall, so we begin looking at it, trying to figure out what we're going to order since we're assuming at this point that we just order at the bar.  after deciding on what we wanted, we stood around for literally another five minutes while the bartender and the waitress continued to chat and totally ignore us while we were just standing around clearly looking confused. oh, and did i mention we're THE ONLY PEOPLE THERE? 

eventually we became so annoyed with this that we decided to go outside and have a seat at one of the tables hoping that would get the attention of someone.  so we have a seat and anticipate that maybe one of the ten or so people outside who clearly worked there would maybe attempt to help us or even acknowledge our presence at some point, but again, no! literally no one said anything to us! 

after a few minutes of discussing how severely uncomfortable this was and whether or not we should just leave, the bartender comes rushing out and says, "so did you guys want to order or what?".  uh, ok! whatever! let's order now that you've decided we exist!  she then tells us that we're going to have to actually get up and come back inside to the bar to order, and that they'll call our name when the food is ready.  the hell? you can't take our order here since we're already seated and were too busy having some chit-chat time when we were standing inside trying to order before? screw. this. place.  and i haven't even tried the food yet.  oh, and you would also assume that since we ordered the food at the bar, we would pick it up at the bar as well, but again, no. you pick it up at the trailer that's parked outside where they're cooking it.  and yanno, this would have been fine had the bartender taken five seconds to actually mention this. 

so the food was surprisingly quite good (shocking!), but honestly, who even cares at this point.  i was so angry at how annoyingly awful this experience was that it just didn't matter to me how the food tasted, and i really just wanted to get the hell out of there.  upon leaving, no one said goodbye to us or even acknowledged that we were exiting, but i was pretty much expecting that.  and just in case you forgot,  can i say again how we were THE ONLY PEOPLE THERE?  

the concept of the duce may be a good one, but with such extremely rude employees that can't take five seconds to tell you how the restaurant works (oh hey! you order at the bar, we'll call you're name, you pick up the food at the trailer!) or even acknowledge that they have customers, i really can't understand how this place is going to survive.  i honestly do hate to be hard on a local restaurant, and wish i could say that maybe this could have been an isolated incident, but based on a lot of the other reviews, i can see that it's not. 

so in summary: i would never, ever, under any circumstance, go here again. this was truly the worst restaurant experience i've had in...uh, ever.

I'm not sure if I would come back.  We went to The Duce around 7:45pm and parking was hard to come by.  Maybe I'm too cheap to do valet but we had to hoof it cause something was going on downtown because the side streets had alot of parked cars.  The environment was loud and fun.  It was kind of hard to find our way around.  First we wandered through the store and found ourselves standing in front of a boxing ring.  After throwing a few punches into the body bag we wandered to the bar.  We were trying to decided where to place our order.  

Food was different as far as taste and blends.  But it was okay.  I was really hoping that the food be dang good but it was just okay.  We ordered the half rack ribs and Chicago dog with potatoe crisp with bottled root beers.  Not impressed.  The root beer was awesome!  When the food was ready they called out our orders on a megaphone.  We couldn't hear it because of the DJ and karaoke.  Oh and the serviced sucked too.

Alot of social bugs showed up on a tour bus and the place started jumping.  It was fun and a great place to socialize and drink some expensive beer.

This spot is like no other place I've been. Bags, boxing ring, ping-pong, beer, dance floor, karaoke, bar, apparel shop, and the list goes on. They play truly good music and everyone really dances. I mean REALLY DANCES! None of this grinding all over one another crap. Real, having a good time, good vibes, moving bodies, dancing. Great spot if you are wanting a change of pace from the club or bar scene. I love coming here with a small group of friends and just enjoying one another's company.

I loved this place when I checked it out a year ago and I love it even more now that I've seen they've made improvements. I went dancing there quite some time ago and the air circulation was nonexistent so it was impossible not to get overheated but last night (April '14) I never thought twice about the temperature and I danced to their sweet swinging tunes all night long. Swing nights are probably my new favorite night of the week. The only reason that I didn't give them a 5 star review was that I was a little concerned about their bar tender. She was nice and made good drinks (freaking delicious actually) but she was very slow at making just two drinks and she used her hands to handle all of the ingredients. Like, tipped the jar of blueberries into her hand to put them in my drink. Don't bartenders typically use those spears to out that stuff in? It just seemed a little bit of excessive touching of something I'm going to be drinking.

We spend most family birthdays here. We come early to avoid the lines and to grab a table. While the adults enjoy "crafty" beers and hand-muddled cocktails, the kids blow off massive amounts if energy on old exercise equipment, shuffleboard, and ping-pong. The food is delicious. The atmosphere is great. Prices are reasonable.

Love the fact that this isn't the plastic type bar and people you find in Scottsdale.  The Duce is in an unusual area of town but is worth the drive.   Great vibe, eclectic crowd of all ages, fantastic hand crafted cocktails, and fun dj/music.   The food truck inside is a nice change up; chicken pot pie is amazing, as was the cheesecake I heard.  The sliders were pretty mediocre though...tough bread.  There's a cute little shop, art to browse, and fun games to play as well.  Oh, it is almost all open air so when the weather is perfect it's awesome but I can't imagine its very comfortable throughout the summer months.  

It's a hard concept to explain but our group loved it and I would totally go back.

DJ WAS AWFUL!! I came with 15 young ladies last night for a bachelorette and he refused to play any music (karaoke night!) we wanted even though we were basically the only people there. He was insulting and rude and just beyond awful. The manager named Brian was very nice when I complained but also said there wasn't much he could do because the DJ had been at the location forever. I can't believe that such an establishment continues to pay for such poor service. Waitress was very nice and drinks were good if a bit over-priced but all of that is completely overshadowed by the rude DJ. I will NOT be returning.

This is a super hipster hang out place. It seems pretty family friendly as we saw families here with kids dropping by for dinner and a chill night. The music does seem to get loud so I'm not sure if it's good for kids to stay long here. 

There is a variety of food trucks and drinks you can get here as well as a dance floor. My friend took us here on a Friday night and they only played '80s & '90s throw back songs so not sure what other songs they play here other nights. The outdoor area does seem to get hot in the summer so make sure to dress cool (even at night)!

Just your typical historic building turned into a great restaurant, bar, boxing gym, vintage clothing shop, dance hall and boxing gymnasium---no big deal. The Duce is awesome, it's a Phoenix gem and something we should all be proud of. The owners of the Duce took a  chance on the Warehouse district long before most people and are on the vanguard of bringing downtown Phoenix back and making it awesome. The food is delicious, the drinks are cold and yummy, the staff is great. I love the Duce.

Such a fun place! The macaroni and cheese muffins are a must have. The chicken pot pie in a jar is the best I've ever had by far. Such a unique vintage place that plays great oldies and has such a positive and fun vibe.

This place had the coolest atmosphere!  The outside is very deceiving- looks like an abandoned warehouse but you step inside (patio area too) & I was just amazed!  Food was great & service was spectacular!  We went for an early lunch but started filling up as we left.  Can't even imagine the fun at night!

Come here on a saturday night and the place was totally dead. 
Ordered Ribs and a Salad and my friend had the sliders. All three were terrible food. 

The $21 vodka mixer was good but not $21 worth. the $6 Sluggs were great value. 

All in all just not a happening place!!

We saw this place during the zombie walk on Saturday 29th and we came back for drink after.
This place is cutely retro. We didn't eat at this place since we already eat before we came, but the drinks were excellent!  I had basil cocktail, it was deliciously fresh! I wish they have more wine list since I'm not beer drinker. 
Love the retro decor, it was just perfect!

Holy hipster Batman!

How this place has 4 stars is beyond me. The service is absolutely terrible. And if there's one thing you should focus on above all, it's the service. It gets 2 stars simply for being unique and interesting. It's a very large place and has a ton of knick knacks everywhere. They also fresh-squeeze all of their juices, which is pretty awesome to watch. The drinks are all unique, but slightly overpriced in my eyes. But the bartenders - oh the bartenders. Seriously, pick the pace up. I waited for 25 minutes just to even order my drink. Most bartenders will ask you want you want to drink WHILE making the previous customer's drink to help move things along more quickly. Not these guys. Nope. They have all the time in the world apparently. And it gets to the point to where you just simply want to leave because you're growing tired of just standing at the bar, waiting to order a damned drink. I'm a fairly patient person and I understand things get busy and you have to wait your turn, but this was just annoying and frustrating. My friend did order the sliders and they were rather tasty, although incredibly greasy. Nevertheless, I have no desire to spend a ton of time standing at the bar waiting for a frou frou drink that's costing me $11 when I could just go elsewhere and get a vodka cran for $4 in 5 minutes or less. Pick up the pace and I'd love to come back.

Had a wonderful time with someone special. Dj played that funk music (according) to my bf. Food is excellent. Try their slider sampler and mac n cheese muffin. We we're satisfy with all the food. You can also play games, dance (YMCA lol) but it is def hot hot hot outside in the summer time

This place is very strange. Weird seating arrangement. They also have a boxing ring inside. I've never been a big fan of going to a place that runs out of something in they're menu? How do you run out of sausage?

This place... omg is the cutest. I love the rustic vibe throughout the restaurant. Service was great, food is really good! I love how they ask for a unique name for your order to be called out for. We will definitely be coming back even if it's just for deserts

This place is so much fun!
Yummy cocktails and food! (macaroni & cheese muffins). I'm not a fan of the parking and it can get super crowded at night - but I can deal with that with all the fun games, food and drink, and people watching.
The PotPie was off the hook and the space was relaxing I could find myself back. Drink prices a little high though $23.00 seemed.... Well

This review could be really long because this place has so much going on. I will make it short and to the point. 

1) Food was delicious. My only complaint was that is was luke warm when served. 
-Mac and cheese balls, brisket sand, breakfast sand-all really good. The kugel was almost as good as mine, and I am critical. Dad had chicken pot pie and liked it a lot. Some items served in mason jars-really cute touch. 

Service was really slow. Staff was friendly. 

2) There is so much going on. Music playing, table tennis, boxing area. It was a lot to take in, but would be a ton of fun to go again now that I know what to expect. 

3) It does get loud, but my 75 year old dad enjoyed himself.

This place is trying, but failing. The whole concept is cool, but they are just not pulling it off. Very unorganized, and mismanaged. My husband and a friend went in for drinks and food, and after settling in to our table were informed that our table was reserved and we were going to have to move. Even though there were no signs on the table stating the tables reserved, they forgot to put them up. As my husband joked- that's nothing that a beer can't fix- the girl rudely told us that would not be possible, and we were going to have to move before the party showed up the table is reserved for. Horrible customer service. Untrained staff. And then later one of my clients informed me that she had gone to this venue with her friends and one of the free weights had rolled off the shelf and fallen on her hand, her finger broke through her skin-there was blood all over- she passed out. and the manager on duty just offered her a cup of ice. No other assistance was offered. This client has since had several surgeries and now her finger has been amputated. As far as I know the Duce  has not contacted her to at least apologize or try to offer any assistance with all of the medical bills that she has incurred.
Love this place!  Food was tasty!!  And the atmosphere is so cool!  If you haven't been before, you really need to check it out.  Unlike anything in the area!

It's a bit out of the way and in a dicey neighborhood. Once inside it is like a big playground. Liked the feel. They have ping pong, shuffle board, bean bag toss, a boxing ring, shopping for too expensive fatigues, etc...... That was fun. However for me the Happy Hour food was just okay and so was the orange blossom beer. Have had better. Not a good value. HH only goes till 6 so it is difficult to make it there after work. Liked the music. A good mix of the new and old.

AMAZING and Unique!!!!!! Last Thursday was my first time at the Duce and I can't wait to go back.  Valet parking was very convenient.  

You can order drinks from any of the bars.  All drinks are organic with fresh squeezed juices.  I started with the Duce lemonade which was not my  favorite.  I was not fond of the taste so I decided to go with a bloody mary for the second round.  The bloody mary was very tasty just a little to spicy for my liking so I ordered  Mule next.  The Mule was just what I was looking for in fact I had 2 more.  

One of the downfalls is servers do not take food orders.  When you are ready to order you have to go place your order at  the trailer.  For me, I like the convenience of having a server come to my table, take my order, bring the food and drinks.  As for the food it is mind blowing delicious.  The strawberry brushetta is do die for and is a must as well as the mac and cheese muffins.  

Thursday is Karaoke night and DJ seems to wide range of music from 80's and 90's. Make sure you know what you want to sing because there is no book to choose from.  I was a little turned off when the DJ made an announcement that everyone needed to get the F*@& out of the place.  Just not the greatest choice in words.

Overall it was great experience and I WILL be going back.

This place is one of my favorites!  I live in California and every time I'm in Phoenix The Duce is a must. The only thing is the prices are pretty high.  Other than that this is a great place...cool atmosphere and fantasticly yummy drinks!

Pros: Unique hipster hangout. Good food  (only had 200 calories left for the day, so I had the egg scramble). Fun drinks (spiked root beer float). Cute decor. Easy system to order and pick up food. 

Cons: They sell super cute clothing items; unfortunately I find it difficult to pay $80 for a t-shirt. Complimentary valet; no private parking. I feel compelled to tip a person to perform a service I normally perform myself. Hate that.

Wildly inconsistent experiences, but it definitely delivers in the uniqueness category.  The bartenders and staff are really great, though the drinks take forever mainly because they go a little over board with the fruit muddling and the like.  Jamie makes me Old Fashion's the way I like them, so I keep coming back, no matter how long it takes to make that drink.  

Overall, this place has nearly limitless potential, they just need to stop being so stubborn and stop being different for different's sake (with regards to the bar)
Very chill place to go with a group of friends that aren't into getting super drunk or all dressed up for the club. Fun games for everyone and great DJ on Saturday nights!

Saw this place on triple D and had to try it. The atmosphere is different, very open patio sorta layout mixing country comfort with modern and industrial, I dig it. Being an open layout makes it a bit uncomfortable during the summer. As a newbie it was a bit confusing where to start and what not. The staff is nice and full of energy. First, I ordered a Strawberry Limeade. It was absolutely delicious and very refreshing however a bit pricey, the price would not stop me from ordering again because it was so yummy. Second, I ordered Mac n Cheese Biscuits and Pot Pie in a Jar. The mac n cheese biscuits were good but something seemed missing though, maybe a sprinkle of salt or some other spicy would fill in that void. Also the price was reasonable for the Mac n cheese biscuits. The pot pie was very good. A bit small for the price but no complaints on taste or anything like that. Over all everything was good. I'll definitely be back.

An annex full of open seating, ping pong tables, corn hole, and a foosball table. Good cocktails, creative bar food, decent looking boozy desserts and a small clothing shop. Definitely worth checking out.

Cool, unconventional place. The brisket sliders are a must. The meat is so tender and just yummy. The bun was also so good. Tasted like a fresh bakery roll. The cheese sliders also had great flavor. The macaroni and cheese balls/muffins were tasty, too. 

The cocktails - oh my. I tried the Southside and the Cherry Sidecar. Both were amazing. I love that all the cocktails are vintage inspired.

Interesting place, Went here for a party. Had a lot of fun. The place is a center of activity. You can play corn hole, ping pong, box your friends, or shop at the surplus store. Lots of space, long tables mostly, as far as seating goes. To stay with their retro style, you are limited to retro beers such as Schlitz, Miller, and Hamms. Not really my thing. They have a couple drafts as well. We had fun knocking around the punching bags, tossing the medicine ball. The place turns into a cowboy bar later in the day, lots of hats and boots, if you are into that,. Its trendy, really crowded on weekends and a must-do at least once...It will only be once for me, unless there's another party...then I will get my Schlitz on!
Awesome place so cool and fun could use a few more ping pong tables some shuffle board and foos ball though but such a good atmosphere we all really loved it and really cool dj .

This place is the type of place that you want to go with a big group of friends. There is a lot of cool things to check out like the corn hole area, the shuffleboard game, and pingpong tables Not to forget the abundance of hula hoops that are just hanging around. It's very cute inside with the food truck being the main source for delicious food like fried mac n cheese bites. They make all their cocktails concoctions with real ingredients. You want a grapefruit margarita? Well prepare yourself for the freshest one you'll ever taste! 

One downside is that it gets pricey FAST. I ordered two cocktails and one appetizers and wound up spending over $40 (with tip) on MYSELF. I love good food and booze but I can't afford to come here every weekend. This is a place I'll save for the special occasions. :) Or at least until I win the lottery then I'll go EVERY WEEKEND. 

There is something different going on every day so check their online calendar to see what's going on that night. Overall, a very lively atmosphere.
Great spot! High energy incredible food: chicken pot pie and beer can chicken were the choice tonight. Both were amazing! Nate the bartender was amazing!

Loved it!
Very fun place to hang out with a group of friends. Prices are a little high but the food and drinks are great. 
Took them a while to make an appetizer that i ordered  but it was delicious in the end.

Fun place. Drinks are pretty freakn pricey. Stick to the beer and your wallet will be okay. They have things to do here though which is awesome! drinking beer, playing a number of games like cornhole, shuffle board, ping pong. who can ask for more?

great place to hang out with some friends for sure.
I was disappointed with the service. I really enjoyed  the ambiance but I don't know when I'll be back.

This was the ultimate COOL place!  Wifey and I walked into this joint and, after looking at each other, both of us said "wow, cool!"  The first thing you see is the ping pong tables!  Then you see the boxing ring...yes, boxing ring!  And it is a restaurant/bar...kind of...it is also a gym, kind of...but...overall...just cool.

We were on our last few hours in Phoenix...and this was a great choice of place to hang out until our flight...

Ok...so...we were there to eat...

First, you go outside to the trailer and counter order your food.  We decided to go for three appetizers...the Mac and Cheese Balls, Pickle Slaw in a Jar and Chicken Pot Pie Jar.  So, how were they?  Very good!

High expectations for the Mac and Cheese Balls...I was not a fan, but wifey thought they were very good.  So, I guess that rounds out to be a balance!  Probably just personal preference!

The Pickle Slaw was interestingly good!  Fresh cabbage, cinnamon pickles, golden raisins and pineapple.  Kind of a crazy mix of things...but...really good...after that first bite of introduction!

The Pot Pie?  OUTSTANDING!  Wifey and I both really liked this one!  We almost licked the jar clean...just get it!

We also just relaxed for over an hour and half, it was that comfortable!

While in Phoenix, we ate at several great restaurants...this was, obviously, one of these...and...we both ranked them...out of the 8 restaurants we ate at, this one ranked...

Wifey - #1 for atmosphere and #1 for food
Me - #1 for atmosphere and #4 (but the top 4 are separated by very, very, very little!)
A really interesting and trendy bar, with actual local color and one of a kind flair. Tasty drinks and special atmosphere that is family friendly and fun.

This is a nice kick back bar near my work that's a nice place to hang with the guys and throw back a few cold ones. They don't necessarily have the best drink specials but they do have craft beer and good food to enjoy. I enjoy playing some bags in the air conditioning and the mood is right. Service was good no real complaints besides getting a warm beer from the outside bar. I would recommend this place if your not dressed up and just want something casual. It's overall a decent bar. Check it out.

Wow! What a space! Sadly I can't see going here all that much due to the location.
