And I'm guessing that the prices on clothing are about the cost of the local residence's weekly wage. 

I'm hoping for the best but fearing the worst.

I don't like giving Bad reviews, so I will try to be as accurate as possible. After hearing many good things about this restaurant, Thursday afternoon I decided to stop by and finally give it a try. After spending $22 on a side of corn, a hotdog, and a margarita I was already somewhat unsatisfied with the price. However I did see organic listed on many menu items. After my food arrived it looked very appealing, garnished well. I tried the margarita, it was good but I questioned if the drinks were measured or free poured as I couldn't taste any alcohol. Moving back on, the corn was simple corn off the cob with butter, at this point all mediocre. The bad review started when I bit into the hot dog to discover the casing on the dog was soggy, chewy and not crisp. This hot dog was like rubber, I had to rip it apart. I'm used to a good hot dog having a "snap" when you bite in. Also the hotdog was so drown in relish it's all you could taste, and the rock hard bun couldn't hold in the toppings.  So after gnawing through this under/over cooked hot dog (I'm not sure which it was) I quickly wrapped up and left. Safe to say I will not be returning solely on the price of this below average food. I've honestly had better food at a dive. This place should shut down their kitchen and just be a bar with the ambiance factor. 
That's really the only reason there's 2 stars, it's got a nice hip feel to it. There's too many good restaurants in the area to waste time or money here. Additionally I would like to note there is zero service here. Unless you walk up to the workers you will be entire left alone, some people might like that, I thought it was poor service for how slow it was on this afternoon. A simple follow up with "how was your food" would have avoided this review but like I said, zero service. Avoid this place if you've heard good, evaluate who told you it was good and ask, why? Clearly not because of their food. How do you mess up hotdogs? I could have boiled a better hot dog at home.  The only thing they seem to be doing right is creating a good initial environment, so good job to whoever put this place together.

They really could do a much better job. Great location and great venue but just a lack of execution. Over priced drinks and awful food. 

The bathrooms are dreadful both male and female. 

Also...what the hell are kids doing in this place after 7pm. 

The wait staff was constantly carrying dirty/clean dishes right through the flow of the building. Not there fault at all in fact the servers and bar tenders are the only reason it's not a one star. 

Do better

Good cold  beer real nice people who are friendly and polite and good at what they do.
I had a couple 24 oz beers 10 bucks apiece whoooaaa
Did I mention it was cold,,,, that's a good thing
I ordered the shepherds pie parfait which is a shepherds pie in a parfait glass.
The problem is that it's not a pie and it's not a parfait and it is 10 bucks
It was a side dish at best
It's served in an ice cream fountain glass layered mashed potatoes hamburger and peas shredded cheese on top
I guess I expected to be fed a meal of some sort for ten bucks
One of the people I was seated with had the family pack of sliders which looked enough for 1 maybe 2 people
It is an interesting place but not worth the money, I had to go home and get something to eat

This place was way cooler than I expected. 

First of all it's HUGE. They host events (an art gallery when I was there). 

They have a prohibition theme, so they have all these drinks from "prohibition era" that are pretty rare to be made today. 

Go check it out!

Again mixed feelings - came here as a customer and loved the entire concept but noticed they needed a lot of help behind the bar.

Asked for a job bartending and they offered it to me on the spot.  Came in to train for bartending and they had me train as one of the trailer cashiers instead.  Wasn't really happy about this - plus I disagreed with a lot of their customer service practices, and decided to leave after a couple of weeks.

As a week or more went on and I got to know the owners I also found out that they used to be primarily clothing designers and had sold their Fatigues brand to Chicos and had then invested their time and money into the Duce.

Again I love their entire concept and really think it could be an amazing place one day.  My only two suggestions would be to bring in bar and restaurant manager with lots of experience with a FOOD not RETAIL background.

came here with family on a Thursday night and was pretty busy but not overly packed but only one guy running the valet so the cars are backed into the street and he is running with his head cutoff, he did a great job considering. 
I ordered the mac n cheese muffins and chicken pot pie in a jar. I would have bet $100 that I would like the mac n cheese muffins over the pot pie but I loved the chicken pot pie and didn't really care for the mac n cheese muffins. my cousin liked them though. the kids loved playing ping pong etc...

The Duce is really unique. It's like a big warehouse full of most of the stuff I could ever want. The store has some pretty cute stuff, but it can be pretty overpriced for just adding one embellishment to a plain white pair of  long underwear. I have sucked it up in the past and purchased an old French ammunition bag that had a couple embellishments added onto it and to this day it's one of my favorites and gets tons of comments when I bring it along with me.

They have stuff for men, women, and shoes and housewares as well. Lots of nice vintage sports wear for men, purses and clothes for women, perfumes and body lotions and the like, vintage glasses, bowls and cookware as well as cookbooks. 

But.. it's not just a store. There's also a soda and coffee shop which are vintage and adorable. Every time I've been there though, they've never been open :(

Also, there's a boxing ring. Yes. A real one.

When you made it past the wares you'll find a huge gorgeous antique bar with all the typical drinks as well as the vintage. You can get an Old Fashioned here. A real one. I introduced a friend to Old Fashions for the first time here. He couldn't take them. Ha.

Outside and inside has seating to drink or eat or chit chat and the patio out back has a food truck for the cookin'. You can get sliders, appetizers, breakfast... and nothing I've had is bad.

Beware on hot days though, there's no air or wasn't last year and we roasted in July.

Steve and Andi Rosenstein have taken on a large space and given it more personality than Meryl Streep on steroids.  You have to see it to really understand it, but this review will attempt to offer a written tour.

The first thing Steve and Andi did was to plant a lemon tree and an orange tree right in the middle of the building, in homage to the neighborhood's once being the produce district of Phoenix.

Then there's the vast retail area.  The couple own R & R Surplus clothing and sell it at The Duce.  It's comfortable vintage with a little special bling added.

The kitchen is housed in an old silver Airstream trailer, on a large patio filled with long wooden picnic tables.  Even the extra beer is iced in vintage coolers on the patio.  And The Duce provides the same beer brands that are served at Wrigley Field. 

The menu is small but select.  Brunch and sliders are served all day.  And "supper" is served from five until closing.  Brisket beef sliders are one of the house specialties.  Besides the regular menu, each night the grillmaster decides what he feels like cooking.  They were offering hot dogs (my personal favorite) the night I was there so I took advantage of that.  The fixings included the freshest, greenest, most delicious relish I have ever tasted, and the coleslaw is made with cinnamon pickled dressing.

The whole experience combines to make guests feel as though they are at a neighborhood barbecue, albeit one where your neighbor presents a check at the end of the night.  But that's okay.  All fun comes with a price.  And The Duce is nothing if not fun

For a full review and more background on owners Steve and Andi, read http://www.examiner.com/x-4463-Transplants-To-Phoenix-Examiner~y2010m7d19-The-Duce-where-fresh-produce-meets-Prohibition

The place overall is cute and has some fun things to see and maybe do along with a great variety of music.The drinks and freshness of the fruit they use to make the drinks are awesome... And that's it! The staff rating I choose to give is about three stars (fair rating). The bartenders are meh, with no attempt to really be friendly or try and make some type of good relationship with their customers. I get you might be overwhelmed and busy with bartending and making drinks, but these people are the ones choosing your gratuity- be friendly or atleast make an effort! Really no main issue with the staff since they just come off as impersonal and not really approachable or approaching to their customers- so it's a blah there. The atmosphere is awful. Unless of course you enjoy surrounding yourself around snobby individuals. When you go out for an evening (anywhere) to a place with good music and awesome drinks, it's normal to maybe have a conversation starter with the bartender, person next to you at the bar waiting for a drink, or out by the dance floor. Not here. People look at you as if you're an alien from another planet or as if lobsters are Coming out of your ears. And the funny part is that youre no where near Scottsdale. Lol!
Oh yeah, and if you want some special kind of pajama pants, go there, they're at a whopping great deal for $106.00!!!

The Duce is truly an adult playground. As I walked into the warehouse-turned-bar, I was surrounded by folks playing pin pong, foosball, and baggos. A boxing ring caught my eye, though it was not in use at the time. 

I immediately felt at home as I was welcomed by employees in CHICAGO CUBS GEAR!!!! Go cubbies! They played the Cubs anthem and had a wide range of Chicago classic beers, including 312s & Hamm's. 

I decided to venture to the outdoor seating area, where I immediately saw a vintage metal food truck and a lit up bar filled with people. 

I ordered the brisket sliders, the Mac and cheese muffins, and a shandy. Everything was delicious but I especially loved the muffins. Lightly dusted with Parmesan cheese, the dough to cheese ratio was perfection. Enjoyed every bite of these babies. 

The best thing about this bar? The atmosphere. I couldn't help but dance along to Stevie Wonder and the classic rock songs that were booming from the speakers. Everyone there looked so happy and my mood was immediately brought up thanks to this place. 

The only negative- It took a LONG time to even order my food. It wasn't excessively crowded enough to excuse the wait. I waited for over 20 minutes to order, then another 15 for my food. They only had one lady taking orders, getting everyone drinks, and giving the orders to the cooks.

Overall I'd for sure come here again. Loved the atmosphere and the perks this place offered!

I just went there for a visit, and it was half an hour till last call (which is midnight there on a business day), so my review can't really comment on the food or the drinks. BUT the atmosphere was really cool. To get to the bar, you have to walk through the whole shop and "gym". It's certainly interesting, different than any bar I know. It's kind of an open area, so cold at night - but they've got heaters (yes, inside). Considering the sketchy neighborhood, I would never imagine something so cool there. Tons of vintage drinks served in big drink glasses and an awesome food menu. I'm excited to come here when it's open for a bit longer to indulge! I would recommend longer hours though, especially around the holidays. It's definitely someplace different to go to, and in Downtown Phoenix, there's not many of these places. Take a break from Lost Leaf and check this place out.

It's hipster haven! Located in a refurbished warehouse with a modified vintage Airstream camper serving as the kitchen, this place has something fun for almost everyone: hula hoops for use, a boxing ring, bean bag tosses, a foosball table, a great craft bar with a list of killer cocktails, and some old beers available (think Hamm's, Coors, PBR, Miller High Life) as well as some craft brewery suds too. Daily changes in music and entertainment also add to he vibe. If you can't find something to occupy your interest here you should probably should check yourself for a pulse. The vittles offered are eclectic and all over the map so unless you are a complete hater of food, you can likely find something you can eat. Portions aren't huge but prices are not stratospheric either. The one thing that I can recommend is the Beer Can Chicken which promises an entire local bird with a can of Old Milwaukee shoved up its nether regions. It is basted on the outside with some type of sweet siracha BBQ sauce. I recommend drinking the remnants in the beer can once you've gnawed off all the bones. It mortified the server but then she told me later she thought about it and it sounded pretty good. She was right as it was like adult chicken soup! Go during nice weather and sit under the open roof for a fun different place to spend some time. Highly recommended!
Great food! Love the drinks there. DJ is a nice touch if you're looking to just eat, drink, and groove.

Went there many times and the latest was after a busy Cardinal's game at Wrigley. We went about 3 hrs after the game ended and I cut my foot on a rusted piece of metal that is bent outward. We asked the waiter for the attention of management to put a cone or something up that would prevent others from suffering a cut by rusty metal like ninjas and after one hour we got their attention. They asked if I needed an ambulance which they admitted they have to by law and then put a cone up. I refused that option as I can walk but will need to see if I need a tetanus shot.

First off, this place was NOT air conditioned. The only thing they have are large fans. So the whole place is hot and humid. Secondly, all of their chairs and tables look like they were from a junk yard. I figured they were trying to go for a outdoor, maybe country, vintage look but it looked like the tables were falling apart. Also, since it was hard, all the tables and chairs were sticky. Thirdly, food was not great. I got a chicken pot pie in a mason jar and it was not worth the $7 I spent. Not only was it almost watery, but it was teeny! If anything, it was worth $2 or $3. I also tried there sliders and nothing special. If you want overly priced, mediocre sliders, then this is the place to go. Last but not least, were the employees. The only reason this rating was 2 starts instead of 1 were the employees. Very nice people.

This place is hipster haven. I kinda love it.

The decor is perfect for instagram photos. The tiny shops are like a pinterest board filled with etsy items. There are hula hoops, bag games, old person shuffleboard, a boxing ring, adorable picnic tables... I mean, wtf is this even.

Drinks take a while to be made, because the bartenders actually put effort into each cocktail you request. Muddling galore here. It's lovely. I got a giant mason jar of a raspberry mule and it was in-fucking-credible. Highest of recommendations. Be warned, you'll be spending a good amount of your hard earned blogger cash because this place ain't cheap. twenty something bucks for my drink, but it was damn tasty. Also, I was already halfway to drunk, so I couldn't be bothered to care.

Grab your fixie, don your favorite fedora, and good luck pretending not to be impressed.

I absolutely love this place the atmosphere and the food was delish the macaroni bites are so darn delish!!!!! My husband had his company party there and it was so much fun. There are games you can play corn hole , Foosball, ping pong. I will be back with friends music was great too and don't forget the drinks with their fresh selection of fruits...

I came to the Duce for a work happy hour and loved this place. The corky decorations, gift shop, bleachers, cornhole and drinks in a mason jar. 

Really awesome hang out - in a strange location behind the ball park. I'll return

I'd like to give a review of the food and the establishment itself, but I never really got the chance to experience it. It looked like a ton of fun with some unique fare, but we only managed to spend about 15 minutes inside before giving up.

My Dad has mentioned seeing The Duce on Food Network a couple times, so I decided to take him there after my family attended an event at the nearby Talking Stick Resort Arena. When we arrived there was some sort of a private party taking up nearly half of the place. That's fine. But it took sometime to try to secure a table inside since the temperature was a little more cool than usual that day. Then when I went to grab some menus, I heard the cashier tell the people ordering at the time that it was going to be an hour for food. No. We didn't have that kind of time. We're going somewhere else.

I don't want to tell anyone how to run their business. But if you are going to host a private party and remain open to the public, you may want to make sure your kitchen can handle the load. I would have been much happier and more understanding if we had just been turned away at the door.

I had been wanting to go here ever since I saw Guy Fieri's take on the place on Triple D. He correctly touted it as retro, kitschy and funky. What he failed to mention was that it is also uncomfortable (ridiculous table and bench setups, tables and chairs with torn upholstery from the 50s, no air conditioning or heating, etc.), tight fisted on servings and....well, dirty. The dining area is open to the elements, even when you choose to eat "inside" so whatever flies, drifts or blows in....does. The tray our food was served on had a glob of grease underneath right where my fingers came to rest as I carried it. Our table had probably seen soap and water maybe several days earlier. In the middle of the warehouse (yep, that's what it is) is a boxing ring which we knew about, and a clothing emporium which we didn't know about. Too much going on to feel comfortable. This warehouse didn't know what it wanted to be when it grew up.

Now about the food. The brisket sliders were awesome! The mac & cheese muffins were fun, tasty and we had enough left to take home. That's where the good part ended.  The sweet potato chips were almost microscopic and we could not figure out where they got such tiny sweet potatoes. Most were sized between the size of a dime and a quarter. Several chips were burned beyond recognition. The iced tea was served in a small mason jar and there were no free refills. If you prefer a non-nutritive sweetener, make sure you bring your own. They only have raw sugar and agave. And everything is ala carte. If you have a huge appetite, bring a sizable wallet with you.

For the hype from Triple D, this was not worth the trip for us. We have no desire to go through the discomfort of sitting in that place again.  If I get a strong jones for those brisket sliders I will definitely call ahead for take-out.

This is a super cute restaurant/bar/sweet stop/playground for adults! And the perfect way to end my vacation from Havasupai falls!

I came here in a group of 6 on a weekday a little bit before 4pm for an early dinner. There was barely anyone here (as most people were probably at work) and it was really easy to find a table for us. The outdoor bar/station was where we ordered food and beer, the bar inside served more drinks, and there was a soda fountain for ordering dessert! We made it just in time for happy hour ($2 off the sampler slider and select beer) so I got the sampler sliders with a mango beer by Papago brewing. My group shared their artichoke dip & five cheese dip as well as their sampler mac& cheese muffins that were rated to be a must-try at this place. The sampler sliders consisted of 3 sliders; one meatball, one chicken sausage, and one brisket. Brisket was definitely my favorite. One of my friends got the breakfast sliders which were literally an egg and sausage patty, and she wasn't much of a fan of the bread they used.

While you're waiting for food, they have a bunch of games to play such as cornhole, giant connect four, pingpong, or a boxing ring if you're trying to throw some punches. This place doubles as a workout gym too! And they have a lot of picturesque spots here that will probably look good on your IG such as a herb wall and a little garden in their outdoor patio. Check out their merchandise section too, as they have some funky stuff to sell.

What's your name? Whatever you want it to be baby.

Asking you to pick an alias for your order and awaiting it over the intercom is just one of the fun details to be found at the Duce. Mac and cheese muffins and alcohol infused milkshakes are the icing on a delicious cake. The strawberry shortcake kind, with vodka, muddled strawberries and whipped cream. Oh yes. 

This place is a smorgasbord of so many things. A boxing ring with your brunch, a backyard BBQ of ping pong and corn hole, a serene Sunday of yoga?  It never ends. It's a warehouse-o-joy with no room for the snoody foodie kinds. OK, there's so much room. But it's reserved for those that like to dance and smile and hula hoop. The food wasn't my favorite ever, but it was an eclectic experience. And I enjoyed it. Hard to sit and savor when surrounded by this sweet sensory overload anyhow. 

Go. Eat. Don't Eat? Drink. Sing? Doesn't Matter. Just have fun. So-much-fun.

Always love coming to The Duce.  Not only is the environment great, the food is yummy and the drinks are awesome! There's always something to do, even if it's just people watch.  They have ping pong tables, a dance floor, a couple bars, and even a boxing rink.  

The employees are very nice and helpful whether it be your first time or 17th.  It's in a quieter part of downtown but still close to all the busyness.  Perfect spot to include on your next bar hopping adventure.  May I recommend renting an Ofo bicycle for only a buck an hour and cruising down here?  Doooooo it!

It's a little quiet on the weekends sometimes, but every now and then it gets quite crazy with everyone piling in to have a good time :)

This is such a great hang out spot and their drinks are freshly made with real fruit probably one of the best drinks I've had is here. Super friendly environment and you'll definitely have a great time
Great place with lots of interesting aspects. Fun with friends and plenty to do there. The food is wonderful, especially the chicken pot pie in a mini jar! The drinks are ok. Definitely will go back.

My boyfriend and I had a blast at The Duce! We had the strawberry kiwi mango bruschetta and the pot pie in a jar. Both were absolutely delicious. The pot pie in a jar tasted so warm and comforting with a creamy, rich base. Very herby as well. The bruschetta was refreshingly sweet and desert like with a tang from the goat cheese and balsamic reduction. Nice crunchy baguette bread too. We also enjoyed the bars throughout The Duce. Nice to be able to move around and go to less busy bars. The cocktail were fresh and fun. I loved watching the bartenders create my drink before my very eyes. Fresh fruit and interesting flavors. Fun games and fabulous DJ. Big dance floor and boxing ring. Lovely, sweet and nostalgic atmosphere. Not to mention the to die for merchandise. Superb candles. I will be back to The Duce!

01/20/11

A group of girlfriends and I met here for happy hour and really enjoyed ourselves!  I arrived first and so was able to secure a parking spot right at the entrance of the venue.  The shopping area of this establishment was an eclectic mix of "vintage" and contemporary items ranging from leather jackets that sell by the pound and tree-hugger organic tees to hand-painted glasses and nostalgic candies in old-fashioned wrappers.  There's even a boxing rink for those who suddenly feel the itch to go a few rounds!  (Back to those vintage jackets- I took this to mean that every jacket was weighed and charged a fixed price per pound, but this wasn't so... Each jacket I tried on had a different dollar amount per pound assigned.  A gimmick that initially piqued my curiosity suddenly made me want to leave the shopping area and just head over to the restaurant and check out the drink and food offerings.)  The indoor dining area was set up for community-style dining, w/ long rectangular tables and high benches.  Outdoors, there were picnic tables and chairs on one side and a silver streamliner at the other where all food orders are placed, w/ people lining up to order, pay, and then retrieve their orders when called.  Another gimmick that I probably wouldn't mind if I were dining outside, but didn't care for since I was dining indoors w/ friends, a couple who'd ordered food and a couple who didn't, away from cigarette smoke and the cold air...

Two of the three girlfriends had arrived before the 6p HH cut-off, but one, Linda, had to take a call, and she was therefore left out of the "duce off" each drink deal.  This was the first time I ever had a grasshopper (cremes de menthe and cacao and cream over ice), and I enjoyed it very much!  So much, I bought my own supplies  to make my own version a few days later!  The friend who was not given the discount had originally wanted a light beer (@ 5:50p), but was told none were offered here.  We all liked our selections and agreed that we'd very much like to meet again for HH.

One of us is allergic to gluten (no, not me!) AND a vegetarian, so after she had asked HER set of questions, she ordered the omelet skillet, first w/ ingredients that the kitchen was out of (asparagus?), so she settled w/ mushrooms, spinach, and goat cheese.  She enjoyed the dish, and stated that the veggies were very fresh!  I had the Brisket sliders and an order of house-made potato crisps, which I was told were coated w/ EVOO and baked, not fried (the streamliner kitchen was not equipped w/ a fryer).  I found the chips to be too greasy and overcooked (see photos), but my gluten-free vegetarian friend found them addictive!  I liked the brisket sliders ("the best you've ever tasted," said a co-owner) at the restaurant, although I did find some of the meat tough to chew so I put those aside, but found the leftovers fatty and sinewy- a chore to chew- the next day.  Not worth ordering again.  Linda decided to order dessert to share- the baked cinnamon-pecan French toast.  This sweet looked so enticing that I finally broke down and tried it, even though I have a pecan allergy.  I ate the caramelized toast pieces around the nuts (which doesn't prevent an allergic response since the oil is baked throughout the dessert) and found THIS delight addictive!  I hope the kitchen comes up w/ other versions that use other nuts, such as walnuts, almonds, even hazelnuts...

Those of us that sampled the food agreed that while we may not be in a hurry to come back for a meal, us meeting here for happy hour is certainly not out of the question!

The food and drinks here were amazing. I had the baked cinnamon pecan french toast with maple syrup. My boyfriend had cheeseburger sliders both had great flavor. Reasonably priced. Tons of different varieties of drinks both alcholic and non. I got a pomegranate margaritas and the boyfriend got an old fashion. Atmosphere is great. Family friendy and a relaxing place to hang out with friends.

Finally got a chance to go to The Duce!  I've been meaning to come here for a long time, but we just never got a chance to do it.  Well finally, after a Dbacks game I suggested to my group to finally check it out.  Glad we all did!

The Duce is a giant historic wearhouse with lots of activities to do.  We were lucky enough to park right out front, and from where you walk in, hint it's in the rear, you walk past a Streamliner trailer that you can order food from.  I've seen the Triple D esposide where Guy loved the mac and cheese muffins, so I had to try them too.  $4 for 9 mini muffians seemed like a great deal.

After putting in my food order, I was told that it was happy hour all day and bottles of beer were half off.  I ended up ordering a round of PBR.  If anyone follows my reviews then you have to know that I'm a craft beer fan, not PBR!  But the Duce only had 2 craft beers on tap which didn't really appeal to me.  At first, I was thinking that The Duce wasn't going to be that good because of the lack of beer choices, but after I ordered a spiked lemonade for my wife at the the main bar I realized that beer doesn't matter here at the Duce, it's all about their speciality drinks!!!!  

The lemonade was amazing.  On our next round I shared a Greyhound with my wife and it was the best!  Just 2 ingredients, freshly squeezed grapefruit and vodka.  It took a few mins to make the drinks, but that's because they are all freshly made.  I was very impressed.  

While waiting for the mac and cheese I saw my friends had grabbed hula hoops and started to play with them.  I went back to pick up the mac and cheese which came in a basket, perfect for sharing.  We then walked around and went to station to station.  I mean, we saw punching bags, so we put on gloves and hit the bags.  Saw corn-hole, then played a doubles game. Then saw foosball and had to play.  

Thats where the fun of the Duce comes in.  You have get involved.  There is really so much to do.  I saw ping pong as well but we were worn out after all of the activities they have to offer.  I'd like to add that the music they were playing was a lot of fun and there were people dancing on their dance floor.  This place is so huge that you can sit right next to the speakers, or in a corner that is quiet, or outside on old fashion lawn chairs.  It's all up to you.

I saw the owner walking around, picking up gloves and putting away weights and talked to him briefly about the activities.  I told him that I really enjoyed what he had done and told him that I would be back.  He shook my hand and thanked me.  He also explained that in the afternoons they offer boxing classes.  That explains the ring they have.lol.

To sum up the Duce...thats hard...I would say if you are wanting a good time with a super cool concept then come here.  I could see if you just went to eat or drink and just sit there then it might not be that good for you..

We all had such a great time that we couldn't stop talking about it.  Too bad they had to close early on our visit, 5:30 for a private wedding.  While we were leaving we saw the wedding party and it appeared that they were actually going to use it as a ceremony and reception place.  My wife and I looked at each other and said that this would have been awesome!
Really cool place to go with a big group! Love the vibe. I recommend the black and blue mojito!

Great food, great music and cheap beer! Life doesn't get any better than this. 

Come here, you won't regret it.
Love this place, so fun! Food can be hit or miss, but cool vibe, great music- unique!

Ohhh The Duce, I was SO excited to check you out, and you left me heart broken and feeling a bit abused. I never read yelp reviews before I go somewhere because I am a firm believer in trying it for myself, but for those of you that are avid Yelpers, here's a lil review for ya. Myself and my fianc√©, along with our photographer friend and his wife were downtown shooting engagement photos and I heard this place had a very eclectic, hip vibe, totally our style. So we walked in and took a look around. We totally loved the decor and all the funky props. We decided to belly up to the inside bar where there were 4 others waiting. No bartender in sight, not even at the outside bar... We sat for about 10 minutes looking through their amazing craft cocktail list, salivating and hoping to order... Finally a rather surly bartender asked us "what do you want"? Ummm hello to you too! We ordered two cranberry cobblers, a Moscow mule, and an orange blossom beer. $42 later we decided to attempt some photos when we were told there is a fee to photograph in their space. We agreed that if the fee was a reasonable amount it would be worth it because the space is THAT COOL. A manager quickly approached us and said the owners do not allow photos to be taken there. Period. The place was not busy so we would not have been bothering anyone, we did not have a big obnoxious set up, just a Nikon and two subjects... This no picture policy was hard for us to comprehend because it's basically free promotion, and isn't word of mouth one of the best ways to promote your establishment?! The manager tried to explain to us that it didn't make sense to her either... Blah blah blah, fake attempt at trying to please us. All in all the service was rude and slow, but the atmosphere was really cool, the beer was flat, but the cocktails were yummy, even after waiting 10 minutes to order, and another 10 minutes for the bartender to make them. I get it, craft takes time, but part of the craft is the experience, rude staff makes for a pretty crappy experience. We tried. I won't be recommending this place, nor will I ever return. Better luck to you all!

This place is so unique! I was disappointed that it was closed the weekend of my birthday in July, but I won't hold that against them!

This bar/boxing ring/vintage store/food truck/soda fountain is super awesome! My cousin took me here a few years ago and since then it's been a place that I always show friends and family members when they want to go out downtown. The drink list is pretty extensive, with lots of organic cocktails served in cute mason jars. You definitely get a good sized drink! The beers are cheap, the food is so-so. I think it's a bit overpriced, so I'd recommend eating somewhere else beforehand. 

The boxing ring is random, but I've seen friends go up there and fight in a drunken stupor, and that is a sight I'll never regret seeing. Some nights they have karaoke, which I've chosen to partake in a few times. I've seen DJ's there on the weekends, and I really like how they switch up the music genre each time. Sometimes it's rap, others rockabilly and oldies. On Tuesday nights they do FREE swing dancing lessons and I've been really wanting to try that!

i love the vintage feel to the place and am surprised it's not packed all the time!

This place confuses me. There is A LOT happening here between a boxing ring, boutique, dance floor and food. I am not a huge fan, but can see why other people would be. I will likely not return, but if I do I will definitely try the food.

I went to this place on a Pub Crawl last night. It's  my new favorite spot. Hipsters galore, an ice cream parlor, great DJ, a boxing ring and I can pick up some vintage salt and pepper shakers....sold! It was 80's night last night and it was totally rad. :) I will come back here on my next trip for sure.

We recently went to the Duce for a company party. We had part of the venue sectioned off with two bars and a dj dedicated to our group. We were served toasted bread with cheese spread and spinach artichoke dip to start, the appetizers kept on flowing with cheese and veggie boards. Eventually the big guns game out! We had roasted chicken with a mashed potato bar, ceasar salad, and sliders (meatball and beef). The beef sliders were just fair but everything else was very good! We had drink tickets for the bar but the drinks were overly muddled with fruit that I would have been very disappointed if I had paid full price for them. The service was absolutely fantastic and on that alone I would highly recommend this venue for an event.
Great place to hang out with friends and family. Very unique place, love the music. Will recommend this place. I dont put 5 stars cause the parking in downtown really sucks.

This place is a 11/10 . The people who work here are nice, and the owner shows his appreciation towards customers, I had the cheeseburger sliders, they were really good, and I also had the mac and cheese balls that were outstanding
I like the ambiance but it's way to hot. I bet if there was air conditioning it would even be busy than it is now. I like that it's kid friendly and my girls had a blast okapi big.

The environment is nice but I didn't get to eat because the waiting was over 1 hour. We opted to eat desert . The vanilla hot milk cake was super dry and is not hot as the name suggests .. I honestly didn't like it at all :(

Just spent my last Friday night here. It was so fun!
The drinks were great and the food was good. Did I mention the drinks were great?!??!? They fresh squeeze the citrus for your drink right then and there. So yummy. 

The food was good, very country down home cookin.
The reason for the 4 stars is the menu. It would be nice to have a few more menu options, like vegan or gluten free (that's not just a salad). Yes, I know how that all sounds, but the option would be nice.

Fun games to play, very relaxed environment. Great decor. Great band.

Good place to go for a fun night out.

Great place!  Dismiss the haters who are whining about the fact that they ran out of ingredients for items they just saw on a Food Network rerun, all of whom raced out with their culinary lemming friends the next day to try the "as seen on TV" items.  Get out of your comfort zone and try some of the other great menu items (the egg, tuna and short rib sliders are phenomenal).  Don't ding them just because they've had a run on the one or two items that you had your heart set on because they're the ones that Guy Fieri ate on TV (causing every Phoenix couch potato to rush out to get one for themselves).  This is a very cool space with a great vibe. If you're looking for a great place to chill and enjoy, you've found it.  However, if you're wound tight and like to have everything be very predictable, I recommend that you take your business to Outback Steakhouse or McDonalds.

Maybe I was overcome by my first visit yesterday, but I was shocked that the Duce only had 3.5 stars. I would smash a place if the people were jerks, so I get that review! And yes, the menu is limited, and the food took a while to come out, but that did not make a difference to us, because we loved the atmosphere and the people. 

We had some amazing cocktails created from fresh fruits with vegetable garnishes. The old fashioned was solid. He didn't spare the bourbon and he was easy on the soda. Delicious!

This place is supposedly known for their sliders and I can see why. The sparerib sliders were tender and tasty. They have a lot of options, but we only got to the one. The artichoke dip was average, but I'm not a huge fan of the artichoke flavor (yea, dumb order, then) and it is prevalent. Probably good for artichoke lovers. 

Finally, I had the pot pie. If a place has a pot pie, I'll order it. Also, beware that I rarely meet a pot pie I don't like. This one is no exception. The sauce is on the runny side, but full of flavor. Usually, I like a thicker sauce, but this was good. Also, the crust was amazing and full of fat ... just like it should be. The heat from cooking makes it nice and crispy wherever the crust touches the little glass jar containing the pie. 

Just a couple comments on the building. There is a great space inside the barn and outdoor patio. The barn (maybe I should call it a shed) had a DJ playing really good 80s music, which is normally terrible, but the DJ had great control over the music. And they had hula hoops. Who's does that? Well, about 20 people while we were there. Funny stuff. 

The adjacent building seems like fun with foosball, ping pong and some other things to see, or shop through. They have a boxing ring for something and it appears they have classes for yoga and other exercises.

Loved the Duce. Coming back soon.

The Duce is one of my favorite date night hot spots. The ambiance is unique, theres always something cool going on and theres so much going on you won't find anywhere else. 

Drinks are good at reasonable prices. The food is unique, each thing has a little twist on it. My favorite things are the sweet potato chips and the Kugel Noodle. 

What I really liked / appreciated at the Duce which brought my rating up to 4 stars is the customer service and friendliness of everyone there. 

I saw that on the warehouse side there was a movie screen and projector and asked if I could hold a private date there to screen the favorite movie of the girl I was dating at the time. I spoke with a manager and she asked me what the occassion was and actually let me have the space for FREE. When we came in they had setup a private table for us with fresh flowers and it was the coolest thing ever. 

Although the girl I took on this special date is long gone the memory of taking someones breath away will always remain and for that I will always be a big fan of the duce!

Excellent time at the burlesque show last night. Chris did a great job organizing and I was happy to meet her. Great Axe the girl with the fire the girl on The Hoop all the dancers and singers even the LL Cool J guy who helped with the ring was awesome. 

Great food, we enjoyed cinnamon cheesecake, they had complementary roasted chicken, the Green-Eyed Lady cocktail special was really really good... Made with fresh lemonade. Lots of different areas to explore and games to play while you're waiting between shows, lots of fun! 

Oh and additional bonus, complimentary valet parking after the evening of fun!

I'm a huge fan of the duce because it has great sliders and cheap beer.  The setting is different but very enjoyable.  My recommendation is to get a brisket sliders with a miller high life.  You will be loving life after that.  If you are looking for a cool, new, but different scene this is the place.  I will be going back for punch and pie.

This place is very laid back. When we walked up we were greeted by a very friendly waiter whom have us menus an that we could sit anywhere than come up an order when ready. The food is really good it's bar/dinner type food sliders side dishes pie  milkshakes. The pie in a jar is fantastic There is a boxing gym inside sometimes the music felt it was being turned up (a little loud)

Giving three stars for the nice indoor bartenders and delicious grapefruit shammy. Other than that, this was probably one of the more confusing service experiences ever. 
When you walk in, it's not readily apparent what you are supposed to do...it's like you walked in to a hipster house party and everyone else knows the drill. You can sit wherever you want, but you place food and beer orders at one counter and other drink orders at another bar. Then you have a seat and wait to be called to come pick up your food. Well, most people do. I noticed the couple behind us had food brought to them by a staff member. Maybe VIPs, who knows. 
We placed an order for the artichoke dip and the beer can chicken at the outdoor cart. The person taking the order actually had me wait while she indulged this drunk idiot who barged in yammering on about White Castle sliders. She was nice enough, but that was kind of off putting. This is definitely the kind of place where the service improves if you are a regular. Anyway- placed an order at the indoor bar for a shimmy drink and a beer. Bartenders were very nice and engaging and drink was delicious. 
The food itself was a bit of a letdown. The artichoke dip was good, but a really small portion for the price. The beer can chicken was not very meaty but had a delicious glaze. It tasted good, but for $20 you'd think they could have thrown in a side of sauce or something. We weren't even given plates with the chicken and it was hard to eat without making a mess. 
I'd return for the drinks, but the food isn't outstanding and it's overpriced for the portion size.

My girlfriends and I was looking for a place to have a quick drink and came in around 1pm. Although I've been here before, it's been many years. Parking is limited but we were lucky to park by the doors today. We were greeted as we came through the door and said we were here only for drinks. There were only a few patrons inside with us but it had a nice vibe. I ordered a Moscow Mule and was happy with it. Although my girlfriends and I was there for a little bit, we were able to catch up without the music being too loud. There is an assortment of things within the building to keep anyone from being bored. We opted to play ping pong & attempted a game of cornhole. I remember thinking that this would be a cool place as a wedding venue. After being there for an hour, we rolled into Happy Hour which was from 3p - 6p. I saw the sign but thought it was funny when the bartender didn't know it was already HH. 
I really like the vibe here and looking forward to coming back with a bigger group and trying out some food.

We had our company holiday party at The Duce, it's a cool, relaxed place and food was delicious.  Keely was our server for the evening.  She was amazing with an undeniable welcoming personality and is very customer focused...."No" was not in her vocabulary (not saying it shouldn't be when needed).  She was readily available, incredibly organized ensuring the food was well timed with when our group was arriving, we had lots of food and she helped facilitate the ease of to-go arrangements for our folks and so much more.  Planning the event was not a great experience with the sales/event coordinator we worked with but I put this aside solely due to Keely, the other staff that helped her and the yummy food at the party!
Loved the atmosphere! The music was great!  Was not a fan of the mac n cheese muffins but the pot pie, brisket slider, and hamburger slider where AMAZING!

Still live in Flagstaff, still love The Duce, and I'd like to think DJ Luis is still my bff even after all these years. While I love the overall atmosphere and drinks, Luis and his karaoke/music playing prowess are basically why I go out of my way to stop at the Duce whenever I'm in town. He has pretty much any song you' d ever want to hear or sing and he's totally cool, no better place in town to sing karaoke and there's plenty of room on the dance floor to get down!
Don't come here unless you have 45 minutes to wait for a cold ass fake Chicago style hot dog.

The Duce is always a fun experience! My friend and I went on a Wednesday night for appetizers and drinks. I love a good Mule but decided to go with the bartenders recommendation, a Basil Gimlet with Raspberries. It was beyond delicious! 

We split the mac and cheese muffins and the baked artichoke, asparagus, and goat cheese dip. It came with veggies and tiny pieces of toasts. 

We also experienced karaoke! The DJ was rad and the singers surprisingly good. 

Highly recommended!

I am changing this review as we went in with a party of 10 last night & we are very certain 7 of us have food poisoning. The atmosphere is great but I've never gotten sick at a restaurant before. The atmosphere is the best! We took the family & there were swing dance lessons, games, ping pong, hula hoops & more. I'd proceed with caution on the food.

Great Vibes! Big area to do lots of things like hoo la  hoop, play cornhole, shop for some vintage/hipster gear. They have a plethora of PF Flyers to choose from?

Food here is cool, like literally coolMac n cheese muffins, and slider samplers. ..they also have a drink menu that can take you through time as they are specific to the times...

Indoor and outdoor so it fits everyone's needs! Two bars! And the food is served out of an old trailer! I personally love the boxing ring and workout equipment within the area! They hold classes during the week! Come check it out, great for everyone!

It's a tough call here. The drinks were awesome, the staff was friendly, and the building is pretty darn cool. 

However, it was loud and got louder. And the food...well...it took over an hour and a half for our hot dogs (two of them) and chips and dip. We also ordered the Duce Dip, but they decided not to give it to us. We tried to cancel our order after we passed the 90 minute mark. The cashier was friendly and tried to be helpful. The manager was cranky, rude, and unapologetic. Eventually the found our lost order (most of it), refunded our food, and let us eat our hot dogs. Good on them for trying to make things right. 

The food was okay. Nothing special. The hot dogs tasted like hot dogs, the chips tasted like chips. The prices were fine. 

Had we gotten our food in a timely manner (they estimated it would take 45 min to an hour, which we were okay with) and/of had the manager been as friendly as the staff, all would have been good. 

We would go back again if invited, but probably not on a Saturday night.

Beer list is bad and I just don't understand this place. It seems to have a lot of potential and is in a cool location - I'll probably come back just for these two reasons. But Ive never understood what brings it all together (could use Lebowski's rug, right?). Lot's going on, and I'm not sure it makes much sense or has the appeal that I'd think the owners are after. Nonetheless, worth popping in, I guess, just once.... just to confirm that Guy Fierri isn't the only one who loves this place. Speaking of Guy Fierri, why do they have his face on a baking pan that hangs on the wall? I think that turned me off more than the country-meets-RnB dancing that was going on when my wife and I stopped in last weekend. And why did they get rid of the Rock Springs pie bar? That was one good thing about this place that I miss. Oh well.
Brandon is an awesome bartender! He makes the best basil gimlet! He gives The Duce a quality name that convinced our group to come back the next night. Love this place! It's must experience!

Insanely fun place for a group. Food was so delicious! We got a little of everything but missed th chicken pot pie because they were sold out. Mac and cheese muffins and brisket sliders were a must! Cocktails were super strong and tasty. Would definitely recommend for anyone in Scottsdale or Phoenix

Fun place to hangout with friends, play backyard games, have some cheap beer.   It is open air more or less, so bring your heat tolerance with you.  One fun part (besides the boxing ring, ping pong, cornhole games is the food truck permanently installed in the middle of the venue.

This is my favorite place of ALL TIME! It's the most adorable and surprising place you will stumble upon in Phoenix--I can guarantee you! First, you'll walk into the cutest little courtyard, decked out with a vintage trailer car that serves you food-cart style. When you place your order, they will ask you for a creative nickname for which to announce your order by, which always makes for a great laugh later when you hear all the hilarious names called when the orders are ready.

But the awesomeness does not end there!! Oh no, not even close. If you continue on indoors, into their garage/warehouse-like area that simply looks like it houses more seating for customers, you will discover that it's so much more. Once you turn the corner, you'll find that this place is HUMONGOUS. Not only does it have a bunch of quirky little items and clothing on sale, there are also vintage decorations decking out the entire room, plus a real boxing ring (whaaaat???)!

The food is also great! Their sliders are delicious, and their drinks are served in mason jars (very in-keeping with their vintage vibe). I've also had their mac & cheese muffins as well as their sweet potato crisps, which are all scrumptious. I've only come here during the daytime for lunch, when there aren't a lot of people, so it's a good time to relax and soak in the ambience of the place. But I know they have a lot of interesting activities on different nights, and they also have karaoke!

The Duce is just such a creative and unique spot. Duce yourself a favor and come check this place out! ;)

We were here for a private event and had half of the building. I liked the wide, open space to mix and mingle with ~300 folks in our group. We had two bars and the milkshake booth in our roped off area. Agree with other reviews that this place tries to be many different things... beer, lemonade, milkshakes, plus gift shop, boxing ring. It goes on. Seems like the venue will try anything to see what sticks. We had apps and pulled pork sandwiches. all were tasty... when hot. Wished they would've paced out the distribution through the night, vs. leaving everything on the tables early on, so there was only cold food available later. Like the look/feel of the place and the valet parking was a nice touch.

The Duce is such a cute place with a lot of potential. When you walk in you really aren't quite sure as to what you should do or where you should go. There is no one there to direct you. As you continue you into the warehouse there is a "hostess" stand on your right that helps you. It would be better if this station was at the front entrance. I was unimpressed with the game offerings with only two ping pong tables, foosball, and some corn hole. There were also a lot of children running around. If I go back it'll probably be later in the evening to avoid all of the children.

I love the Duce! Such a fun place with something for everyone. Seriously- they have corn hole (aka Duce bag), ping pong, a dance floor (they play like the best of the 90s), a boxing ring and a store. And you can dress super casual! Love it love it love it!

This is a great place with an eclectic atmosphere with much to keep the eye entertained including a boxing ring. A good mix of classic rock and pop music was lingering in the background in an old brick and tin warehouse setting. We made our way back to an outdoor eating area that hosts an old shiny aluminum  travel trailer for a kitchen with  rustic wood benches for seating and shabby chic d√©cor.

We ordered our food from the counter a cheeseburger sliders and a brat. And here's why I didn't tack a few more stars on the review. It took a long time for the food to come out, over 30 minutes. Which seems like a very long time in an uncrowded environment on a cool and breezy Saturday. The food arrived and is served in a very basic way, no fries pickles or garnishes . My son said the Brat was good, the sliders were okay but bland and the bread was dry, some mayo and seasoning would help. Add a couple of diet cokes and tip and the bill was $26 seemed a bit high for basic food with minimal service. I'm not complaining as I like this place and hope to go back for beers but I think more care could be taken in food prep and delivery time.

What a unique place and setting for games and fun. Our group ordered drinks which were very good from the mojitos to the bloody Mary's all served in Mason Jars. Took us 30 minutes of patiently waiting for a food server before finding out we needed to go outside and order at the trailer. This explains the annoying, loud calls of names over the speaker system which ruins all songs playing and makes conversation impossible. The games, Foosball, Cornhole, Ping Pong and Hula Hoops looked like it would be fun but each was occupied by 6-14 year old unsupervised children. (A Bar with Daycare) We ordered food which they were out of chicken, brisket and pot pies so we opted for the short rib and cheeseburger sliders which were ok except for the stale and crusty buns , another had a hot dog which was good and one ordered the cheeseburger sliders with egg but the cook forgot the eggs. We had apps of the mac n cheese muffins which were tasty but overpriced for what you get. The 45 minute wait to get food after ordering, the missing items as well as the lack of quality on a slow Sunday evening is the reason for only 2 stars. The drinks were great, the place seems fun and interesting but next time I want to spend $400.00 on my group of friends, it won't be here.

Such a fresh, fun place! It was enjoyable to hula hoop, play ping pong and corn hole while waiting for your food. The vibe was totally shabby chic. I would have given it five stars but it was quite pricey (easily $10-$16 a meal) and I got my food as nearly everyone else in my group was finishing. We ordered on the same ticket! I would still recommend this to friends and return. :)

Came to The Duce today and it was a great! Other than the wait times for food, the atmosphere for brunch is so much fun. Between the random hula hopping, workout session in the boxing ring, and oldies music, you will not be disappointed coming here.

The reviews are great but reality is this is just a normal burger place. The mac n cheese muffins are just muffin rolled in crunch and baked in muffin tin. Nothing special. The clothing is way way over priced. My suggestion is to skip it. I went because i saw it on triple D. Not impressed. The pot pie was not the best I've ever had. It was delicious though.  I like Marie calendars better.

Being a fan of Pop the Soda Shop I had to come by here.  I had the original Dr. Pepper and my hubby a chocolate shake.  He makes his sodas fresh at his old school soda fountain.  Both were delicious.

It is an interesting little place with a lot of different things going on.  I'll be back for a soda and perhaps for a meal one day.

Love this spot, it's a converted warehouse so there is plenty of room. The place has a great atmosphere awesome drinks (best Old Fashions in the game), good spot to go with a group. If you want to experience a truly unique bar ethis is the spot for you. It's a breath of fresh air from the Scottsdale, Arcadia or Tempe scene.

Dropped in on Saturday night, cocktails are always fresh and perfect. All the different spaces offer a little something for every mood. With the cooler weather there isn't a bad spot in the house. Great service all the way around.

Boasting faux-southern comfort food and old-timey vibes, The Duce is a jack-of-all trades sort of establishment and event space left perhaps marred by service and environmental issues. 

Make no mistake, there's a lot going on here. A LOT. We're talking (kick)boxing, yoga, ping pong, weights, Latin dance nights...it's a pretty vast warehouse, so they're constantly innovating ways to utilize it all.

I'd stepped in on a sweltering Wednesday evening to meet up with some colleagues. no more than 10 steps in, an employee ran...literally RAN behind me screaming "wait! You can't be here!" It turned heads. I'd stumbled onto a private event, rendering all that fun stuff I'm talking about unavailable. How they were so sure so fast that I wasn't supposed to be in a section with no signs and no name tags of sort is beyond me, but the unwanted attention was actually kinda embarrassing. I felt uncomfortable in less than 30 seconds--a record for sure--but I don't hold a grudge. Moving on. 

I walked around and found my table of 15 or so. The table was nice and spacious, leaving unobstructed views of all those fun attractions we'd save for another day. Reserving a portion of an establishment for a private event is cool. Alienating other paying customers by having absolutely no games of any sort on the other side of The Duce came across as poor planning at best. There were menus here, but no one is taking your orders. You wait in line at a trailer outdoors and place them. So while I waited for my order, I visited the bar. It has a decent beer selection, and a great assortment of everyday cocktails like the Grasshopper, Old Fashioned, etc. These aren't the most stiff, which is great since they're huge and served in mason jars. The bar was actually my favorite part of this experience, along with the very cool DJ. 

When you order food, you're not given a number or anything...they just call your name. From where they call it, I have no clue! I never heard mine and neither did most of my colleagues. We just had to kinda see someone who ordered before us grab their meal and then hope ours was ready shortly thereafter. My sliders, however filling, were just OK, with rock-hard rolls that disappointed everyone at my table who ordered them. 

The disappointment doesn't stop there. 

Most (keyword: MOST) of our party momentarily left for the dance floor for a quick round of happy birthday singing. In that time, staff swooped in and began cleaning up at our table. My friend's food was thrown away! We had a couple people left there at the table and were by no means finished, but they were just so eager to take care of this that writing an account of it irritates me. Naturally, my friend was upset and complained like "heeey you threw away like half my dinner". She was met by some prick who did nothing but repeat "WHAT CAN I DO TO MAKE IT BETTER" several times, in perhaps the most annoyed, almost hostile tone I've heard from an industry worker who is clearly in the wrong. They did not bother comping her meal. 

The food is so-so, and I think the heat makes staff more brusque than courteous. So do I think The Duce has potential to be cool? Yes. I'll totally give them another shot...eventually. I really want to believe I'd have a better experience dancing or something here instead of just eating. But my co-workers probably won't, and and they're unlikely to suggest it again. Until then, I can drink and dance in cooler places downtown.

*Disclaimer* we went on a Summer Night when it quite possibly was 190 degrees inside this place - That said, the fact that I'm still giving it 3 stars should be seen as a testament to the Duce's charm.  And by "charm" I mean 32 ounce Old Fashioned's.  

The Duce is a cool spot on the south side of downtown Phoenix.  With the outside look of an old warehouse and the inside look of a full service bar that just happens to have a boxing gym, ping pong / cornhole stadium and a boutique inside of it - the Duce is a great place to come away with an interesting story.  (*second disclaimer* I am not drunk while writing this review, I am giving you an honest description)

I can't speak to food, as I was drinking my dinner this evening - but I can say that if you're looking for a place to drink a meal, they serve cocktails in 32oz mason jars which are up to the task.  Also, when I ordered a 32 oz greyhound - the bar tender split and squeezed the grapefruit directly into the vodka before my eyes.  Top Quality bar, No complaints on service.  

I want to complain about it being hot.  Partly because it was, but mostly because I'm self centered - BUT then I remember that the wait staff was still attentive and friendly even though they 1) were probably hotter than the customers were and 2) they have to deal with it day in / day out while we are able to come and go as we please - so I won't.  

I will come here again, preferably when it's under 100 degrees outside - and I have a feeling it will earn a few more stars in my book.

This is really a huge warehouse with many different bars and seating areas.   They make excellent hand crafted cocktails using fresh fruit & herbs.  The beef brisket was very tender.  Service was friendly and attentive.  Spend time checking out all the different areas of this cool place.  We are going back today before heading home.

Been here twice now, most recently a Saturday night with a group of friends killing time before we could go to a nearby cocktail lounge. The place was lively, we were greeted with 80s music as we walked in and made our way to a bar (there are a few located throughout the area). I got a strawberry limeade with was just ok, the bartender was fun to watch and the ambience was cool so it made up for the lackluster drink. There was a dance area going in one side, people hanging out and talking at another area and a section for games. Overall the space is great, but the drink wasn't anything special. I still chose to give 4 stars because it's a fun environment to hang out in for a bit.

What a fun place to be! I've been to The Duce a couple of times - 1st one was for an art show event and 2nd time for a casual Sunday afternoon. The space is large and there's various things to do here: bars, desserts, food, games, and more.

For brunch, I had the scrambled eggs and fresh-squeezed lemonade. The eggs were organic and a large serving, but they were ok. The lemonade was refreshing for a warm morning. I do wish that the food menu could be bigger. 

We wanted to grab some desserts at the dessert bar, but after standing around for 10 mins and looking for someone to serve us, nobody ever came. It was not a busy day at all so I was surprised .

Overall, I think this is a good place for drinking and hanging out with friends, but I wouldn't come here to eat.

The Duce is a pretty cool spot.
Taking on this huge warehouse is quite a challenge, but I think they did it nicely.  
The airstream they serve the food from is a cool touch, marking your order with a nickname (they have a list of some if you can't think of one) is kinda neat too.
The old timey bar, soda jerk fountain, and boxing ring are cool touches.
The drinks, while pricey, are pretty darn good.  My husband loves a good old fashioned, and its a pain to find one, the Duce didn't really deliver there, but their Tom Collins made up for it!
Everyone was friendly and fun.
The food was good.  The sliders were amazing and I will be coming back for those corn coins, so so good.
I also hear they have swing dancing on Tuesdays, can't wait to check that out.

Down sides:  the old fashioned needs some work, its was unbearably hot when the gigantic fan turned off for no apparent reason, its was just bearable when it was on, but that to be expected in an old ware house during and Arizona summer.
Also, the corrugated steel bathroom stalls make me feel like I am hunkering down for the zombie apocalypse when all I need to do is tinkle.
Courtney's drinks taste like pure happiness.  I'll go back just for her amazing mojitos! The Duce has a great vibe with hula hoops and corn hole.  Can't wait to go back!

One of the most unique places I've ever had a drink at. From the triple D representation to the boxing ring and bag toss/corn hole it's worth having a drink at.

Unique libations w/ a twist. The food wasn't for me but I enjoyed the vibe.

Good for groups

- Pretty cool environment. Fun, open space.  Surprisingly large and not too crowded
- Could use more and larger TVs
- Service is friendly (and persistent!)
- Parking sucks
- The food was very good.  The dips, especially that magic cheese one were savory.  The spinach one was a little watery.  Nice variety of sliders.  I particularly like the one that was like pot roast on a bun.  The sausage one was relatively flavorless.  The burger had a nice salty bite

I joined @PatrickEm and @PaulValach at @TheDucePHX for brunch this morning.

I had their cinnamon pecan french toast, but without the pecans.

It was simply amazing!

Amanda was our server, and she epitomizes what I think a server should be. Keep her around, Duce!

Also had fresh-squeezed orange juice. Delicious!

I think the Duce would do well to add a few fans, just to move the air a bit.

But I really enjoy this place, and will definitely be back.
Been here a couple times.. it has decent food and a good drink selection.. nice place to hang out With ur friends..
Amazing place with amazing atmosphere!! The food is by far my favorite in phoenix! And the ping pong tables along with the corn hole provides such amazing entertainment!!

The positives; the place is cool, decorating is on point, the mix of clientele was fun, the amount of seating was perfect, the variety of bars was excellent, the food tasted fantastic. Overall the vibe and flow was very easygoing. Negatives; we did separate food tickets and asked if our sample mac and cheese muffins could come out first. We had ordered the beer butt chicken and were told there would be an hour wait, no problem since we would be snacking on the muffins while we waited. The cashier said this was how to do it, separate tickets. Nope, all the food arrived at once. We had one muffin each (2) and decided to have the chicken, corn and potatoes because they were getting cold. We loved the chicken, I'll bring my own chicken shears next time because cutting it with a serrated steak knife is silly. We pushed the ten muffins aside intending to get a to-go box. Nope, bus-lady came by and took them away. I had turned my back to see a ping pong match heat up and she just swooped in. Left a bunch of trash but the metal vessels were all gone. So much for my ten mac and cheese muffin breakfast. 
The food is really good, I really enjoy the atmosphere, I will return and be better prepared for the minor shortcomings.
Very fun vintage place with awesome food! Brisket is delightful the drinks are fruity and good! A nice place for a fun afternoon!! Will be back!

I want to love The Duce. It has an awesome concept, and I love the atmosphere in the place, however, my experience, has not been the best. My biggest issue is the booze. I get the retro muddled feel, but on a bloody mary? Not quite the best. Also the bartender took forever. I want to try the food, but I fear similar experiences. The staff in the store area was super nice, and they have a cool assortment of goods. Hopefully my next trip will yield better results, however for now its just a-ok.
I really enjoyed myself at this place!! I absolutely loved the strawberry limeade drink I had. I never tried the food but the atmosphere and drinks were totally worth visiting!

I've been here before and enjoyed it... Then I had dinner there. Pretty terrible. I ordered a Moscow mule and it was unrecognizable as that beverage, the waitress never brought the silverware I requested, and instead of delivering my food to the table where my dining companions had already received their food, my food was left at the bar in the midst of all the swing dancing as it got cold until finally someone announced it over the loud speaker for me to come get. Do not get the tuna or tuna melt sliders. It was basically tuna straight from a can, sprinkled with some cheese and a little mayo on hard bread. It was cold and gross.

This place has a lot of atmosphere, that's for sure. Sixty year old mid-century dinettes? Check! Vintage marble soda counter? Check! Antique phone booth? Check! Boxing ring? Check! But at the end of the night it's all just an un-themed collection of hipster nonsense. The drinks are heavy on sour fruits like grape fruit and lemon with a scant spoonful of agave syrup to "sweeten" it. They have well over two dozen drinks on their menu, and the four of them that I tried were undrinkable. If, on the other hand, you like your liquor served straight with bitter citrus pulp, you will definitely love this place. How is it that hipsters can take a cocktail like a Sidecar and make it into something that tastes like prison Pruno? As for their food, I am pretty sure everything has some form of goat cheese in it so that's a plus if you like goat cheese. So in summary, go for the boxing, stay for the Pruno.

The Duce was a really good experience for my family and I. At first, we felt like we did not belong there on a Friday afternoon due to the slow feel. I guess we were some of the first people there. However, once we got through the order process with Bree's help and Hannah taking care of our organic drink order, we felt that the staff took really good care of us.  The food was awesome and the atmosphere was fun, yes, even for the kids.  We tried a new menu item, the Apple/Pear crisp for dessert, and it too was delicious. Overall I would recommend The Duce if you are looking for a different, laid back, good flavorful food experience.  Oh, and bring you appetite.

Came here with some friends on a Saturday - what a great find!  We all tried some of their vodka berry cocktails which are served in a mason jar - all of them were tasty and could easily have had a few of them.  They have ping pong, corn hole, and many more games.  Also, they have a cool little market that sells quality shirts and other stuff.  The highlight was probably the service - we had someone in our group celebrating a birthday.  I asked the server if she could put some candles in their bacon mac n cheese muffins and she did that and helped us sign happy birthday! The Duce rocks.

This place is just awesome! Random layout, you can do anything from play ping pong, to drink, or karaoke. There's something for everyone. 

I really appreciated how awesome the staff was. They have a shop there, and Ashley was running it. She is the most adorable person ever! so sweet, friendly, and professional, she could practically be running the place. 

The owner is awesome too. Just a great atmosphere, highly recommended!

For a hangout drinking joint, this place is a good alternative to the typical bars. The atmosphere is very casual. The music they play is an eclectic arrangement from whatever time period. It's not too loud, and it's brightly lit compared to most other places. There are activities, such as, ping pong and cornhole to keep things fun.

The food and drinks are quite pricey, but they use fresh squeezed fruit juices if the drink calls for it. So it's pretty tasty.

Had a blast! I had never been before and went out for margaritas and dancing. The DJ was great played a nice variety of music. The bartender was a little rude he was more interested in some girls at the bar. I didn't let it ruin the fun, I actually started going to the other end to another bartender. I had no idea until now it was also a restaurant. I loved the retail items you could purchase, T-shirt's, hats, jerseys etc. It was a really unique concept. My friends and I danced with hula hoops that they provided while on the dance floor. Next time I will try the food and hopefully it won't disappoint.

Really like this place.  Went on Tues. evening around 8.  Free valet.  Fresh squeezed juices.  Warehouse...Other reviewers who have rated it high have said it all.  I just wanted to add that if you go during the summer months, it is HOT!  They have swamp coolers that work hard, but don't quite make it cool everywhere.  Neat that on this night, they had a huge line up of bands and there were two stages.  While one band played, the other set up so there was literally no downtime.  Would like to go back.
The Duce. Really like this place and becoming a regular. Sadler is a great conversationalist behind the bar and Frankie's awesome. Great spot on weekends and weekdays when it's more low key.

Awesome place.

Warehouse style.

Good tequila.

Ping pong.

Bags.

Good pre game place!

We went to The Duce to kill some time before our flight home based on seeing them on DDD.  We weren't disappointed.  We tried the Mac and Cheese bites, as well as the Shrimp in a Jar and Sliders.  All were delicious.  The bartender working in the afternoon was very helpful giving us the lay of the land and making a great drink.  She even remade it without being asked to because she wasn't 100% happy with it.  I'd for sure come back here.  Cool place with a neat atmosphere.

The Duce is a  great place to get a taste of the urban side of dt Phoenix. It is a converted warehouse that is a food trailer/bar/thrift store/ice cream parlor/boxing ring? Their bartender is a DOLL, probably from the same era as when the warehouse was built. There are ping pong tables and bags set up inside, and they have different events on different nights. This place is a hodgepodge of different things and definitely hard to describe. Your best bet is to try it out for yourself.

Overall. The Duce is perfect if you want to try somewhere new and get a different feel for this city.

After an evening at the Duce, when I told my husband about this place, I felt like "Stefan" from SNL (Please note that all of the below are 100% true from my single 3-hour visit):

"Phoenix's new hotspot is called, 'The Duce.' They have EVERYTHING - wedding rehearsals, sorority costume date parties, fancy fruit drinks in mason jars, old refrigerators, a boxing ring, 13-year-old youth group members dancing to the oldies, hula hooping, lots of signs written on chalkboards, local celebrity Lin Sue Cooney, a newborn baby, an indoor food truck that takes 70 minutes to serve a hamburger, karaoke, a giant gift shop, ice cream floats, and lots of bearded twentysomethings." 

I see how this COULD be fun, in theory. However, in practice, there was just way too much going on and this place can't seem to figure out what it is. It honestly seemed like someone spent about a month pinning everything they saw on Pinterest and just threw it into a single location.

All this said, at 35, I'm probably older than their target demographic, so maybe I'm just crotchety and out of touch. :)

"The Duce" Great Food, Great Cocktails, Great Atmosphere, Great Spot! I would definitely come back again. My husband found this place on Yelp for date night and to my surprise he found a gem here in Phoenix. Love it!

The duce exceeds expectations! Went out to Phoenix  with a handful of friends and we all had a hell of a good time. The setup of the place was very creative. It felt like a huge bar with gym like qualities intermixed! Such a fun atmosphere with a good variety of people enjoying themselves! There was literally something there for everyone.

 I didnt eat much but the drinks were made to perfection! The cranberry cobbler was my favorite but they had tons to chose from! The staff was very accommodating. I actually had the pleasure of meeting the owner Steve. Very cool guy! My friends and I were hanging out by the ring and were beating up the punching bag when Steve asked if I'd like to box in the ring with him! That alone was a thrilling experience. Very genuine to take the time to treat the customers with such hospitality! But besides all that they had Foosball, ping pong tables, and hulla hoops set up in the middle for entertainment! There was a good variety of tunes and I really liked the different sitting areas they had available!

 I'll be coming back for sure.. I need to try their food and sweets and I want to see how good I can box before all the drinks! Seriously if you haven't been here, take a group of people and check it out. I throughly enjoyed it!

Great on everything. Handmade drinks with natural ingredients made right in front of you. The food portions are small but delicious. Coolest inside of a bar or restaurant I've ever been too, similar to Camp Social but bigger with a boxing ring.

Interesting place, lots to do and look at. 
I love places like this but not when the drinks are around $8-10 for a pint of beer.
Service was poor when we went, two bartenders at a not very busy bar, one was more focused on chatting up women at the end of the bar while the other did all the work.
It was just OK. Sunday evening... It wasn't busy but waited close to an hour for food... Half of the food was cold (I think they forgot our order)... But the drinks were good. Music was to loud...

This place is an out of the way jewel! A little hole in the wall that takes you back in time through their 50's, 60's, and 70's atmosphere! The food is excellent. They serve American fare in fun packages. The flavor is mouthwatering and the portions perfect!

I came in with 6 people and ordered Chicken Sausage slider. The cups for water were all wet and looked dirty, the place also was swarmed with flies. Everyone got their food except me. So I know they might have forgot my order. I talked to the cashier girl who got my order to check if they do. She comfirmed they're making it so i continue to wait.
