After everyone done eating, my order still hasnt come. I checked with the cashier girl again and she finally said the kitchen staff lost my order. I gave this place 2 stars since the manager was decent enough to get my order to-go with an extra apple pie and get me a refund as I demanded. I highly doubt that I would ever come back here again.
Great shakes, ok food and service sucks. It doesn't matter what time of day you go service is always slow..

Cool place definitely would not have come here if I hadn't seen it on yelp. Looks like a dump on the outside but they definitely get their clientele through word of mouth. Nice place to grab a few drinks and hang with friends or significant others they have games like pong pong and cornhole which is also cool. I only give it three stars because I'm a beer guy and they don't have 1 ipa and their selection is less then stellar. It would be nice to see them add some craft beers to the menu but their cocktail list is extensive. Also it gets pretty hot in their in the summer they have fans but it only helps a little. Will definitely be back in the fall

Before coming to the Duce, I had heard some decent compliments about the atmosphere and drinks.

I don't live close by for the night life, but a co-worker and I decided to try it out for lunch.

I am not a teacher, but I would give the food a "C." We decided to split the slider sampler. This proved to be messy and was no fault of the restaurant. It is hard to cut a meatball in the bread... And the short ribs... Even the chicken sausage. Aside from that, the food was just ok.

The tuna was meh, not like mamas! The short ribs were ok. The chicken sausage: ok. Just all of it was ok. 

The highlights for the experience was the staff: super friendly and helpful. I like that there are drink stations around that I can help myself to. The building and decorations are really great. I can certainly see why it would be so much fun to hang out and enjoy company here.

Unfortunately, the lunch was just not the best. Not for the price at least. I would try it again, but at night, when I am not hungry.

Loved the atmosphere. Loved the booze. Loved the vintage, hip vibe throughout the whole place! Can't wait until the future hubs starts wanting to go to more baseball games this summer! We're definitely going to hit up this place a lot! :o)

This place wasn't quite what I expected. I had heard good things but this place just confused me. You walk in and you're immediately in some kind of shop. And once you walk through that there is a wide open warehouse room and a lot of long picnic tables. I finally found the bar which seemed disproportionately small for the size of this place. It got very crowded fast so I decided to order a bucket of PBRs for my girlfriend and I. I could see the place went further back where I've heard food was, but after finishing the bucket we left. I wouldn't come back, not because of anything negative, it's just not my cup of tea. Seems like a hybrid dive bar/club. So it definitely seems geared towards younger people.

We had 2 company dinners at the Duce. Food was ok and the service was slow. The main problem was manager. He was rude and very uncooperative. He made it clear he didn't care about us or our business. Avoid the Duce because of the manager.

I've been here three times...

First time, I came on a Saturday night...it was completely dead...DJ, Karaoke..there were maybe five people here...the fresh squeezed drinks are a good concept. Clothing is ridiculously overrated and priced. As for the food...The sliders were okay. Not half bad...

Second time, I had take-out since the I thought the sliders were decent the first time...but, I unfortunately got the food and it was super greasy and cold...only good thing were the cupcakes for dessert...

Third time, I said maybe it was a fluke...I'll try to bring my kids..since it's suppose to be "family friendly"...took my kids to the ice cream bar or what not. No one was there to help us. Had to walk around the place, finally found someone to help us and the customer service well, let's just say they were obligated and it showed..also met the owners..decent people BUT it seems they allow anyone to work here. Overheard employees In the trailer where the food is prepped and cooked...not trying to eavesdrop, but there are felon's on probation working here. Not ideally "family" friendly. Maybe they should rethink their hiring process. Makes me wonder if they allow sex offender's to work here, too? Guess they don't require background checks...

Anything goes at The Duce.  This is a warehouse, trailer park, and backyard all rolled into one.  Everything in The Duce is vintage.  I love the picnic table concept and food truck kitchen.  The food has some serious down-home feel to it.  They have Mac & Cheese muffins, Sweet Potato Chips and Noodle Kugel with Granny Smith apples.  I didn't know what Kugel was but it was delicious.  The Chicken Sausage Sliders are my favorite.  The Duce knows how to makes some serious cocktails.  They use fresh ingredients and serve up their cocktails in Manson jars.  I don't think I've had a drink on their menu I didn't like.  Old Fashioneds and Moscow Mules are my favorite and The Duce's creations are perfect!  The Duce is a unique place that will be great to meet friends before a game or just a night out for drinks.

Very, very hip, trendy place to hang out.  They have it all here. Great place for families and hipsters alike.  The shopping looks really cool with vintage clothing galore.  The PF Flyers were especially interesting.  Tried the famliy pack of Sliders, Brisket, Sausage, Meatball and Tuna. They also have Egg and Chicken I think.  Also tried the Apple Fritter desert.  Very good.  The night I went was the first night they tried music.  it seemed to go over well and the owner, Steve told me they plan to have more music acts in the coming months. 

Since I mentioned Steve, the owner, Let's go ahead and mention the staff.  The second I walked into the place I was greeted by an employee.  Welcomed and given the nickel tour.  The Staff at the bar and the trailer-kitchen (More about that in a min) were very friendly.  

The creative use of the space was so interesting. Its one of those places that the first time you are there you just sit and look around the space.  Vintage records hang from the wall, An authentic Hamm's Bear beer statue. Original Brick walls and exposed building trusses. 

Now to the vintage Airstream travel trailer.  They use it as an outdoor kitchen. You order your food from a picnic table and they make it in the trailer/kitchen.  Very Cleaver.  

For me, the best part was the vintage cocktails. I have been reading a lot about the trend to recreate old style cocktails that for one reason or another are not made anymore. Drinks like the old-fashion, the Cuba Libre, or Rusty Nail.  I could go on about the authentic soda fountain, the bakery and ice cream if I had more time. I will just say go to the Duce and see for yourself 

One slight bummer is the prices.  Slightly expensive. $8 bucks for 3 sliders.  $10 for a desert that was pretty small.  Cocktails are all $10 and above. They seem to try to offer some inexpensive alternatives $3 for PBR's and Hamm's beer.  That may be a fun novelty but the reason those beers are nearly defunct is because they suck. I guess if you want to save some cash by chocking down some horrible beer, Knock  yourself out.  But if you want to get something decent, you need to be prepared to pay just a little more at the Duce. 

All in all I highly recommend this place. Go check it out for yourself.  I know I am looking forward to my next visit.

The Duce defies my expectations of what it exactly is... hipster event space? restaurant? bar? 

Reminds me of the Step Brothers movie quote "So many activities!". Perfect for anyone with ADD and/or a short attention span. Corn hole, boxing ring, dancing, foosball, and ping pong!! Oh and a fun hula hoop contest!

One of my friends organized an outing for our Meetup group to have "adult homecoming" one weekend evening. He negotiated a few drink tickets + finger food apps + reserved table space as such, and it was roughly $30/person. Compared to their menu, I figured that was a great deal! 

Unfortunately it was also the night of a Dbacks game, so the parking & local driving situation was horrendous- no space for the valet service to take our car and my friend who drove had to park blocks away... and of course they don't have much of a parking lot to begin with. 

Once we got into the building they gave our group wristbands to identify us... although since we were all fairly well-dressed it wasn't hard to point us out. Our tables were altogether with the food beautifully displayed. The plates were odd- just like a plain metal mini serving tray. Lots of bites including their famous Mac n cheese muffins, bruschetta, dips, and sliders! 

The most disappointing part of the night was their drinks. Yes, they are served in really cool mason jars and their bartenders know how to make slinging them into a show, but the taste left a lot to be desired. Between my friends and I, we tried a lot on the menu (sampling amongst ourselves the Strawberry Limeade, Duce Limeade, Moscow Mile, Cranberry Cobbler, Mojito, Basil Gimlet). If the drink wasn't bland, it just wasn't that good. Not really sure what could be done to make them better. It was the one thing that stood out above the fun night that was a buzz kill.

Love the concept! I've been to the Duce a number of times for get togethers. Huge eclectic space, awesome comfort food (features on Diners, Dives and Drive in) churned out from an airstream trailer, and hand crafted prohibition Era cocktails. 

While its a great place to visit during the fall, winter and spring, we found it is not as comfortable during the summer. Because its an old warehouse- they rely on fans to cool... Which can make summer months sweltering. 

Drinks: hand crafted, and served in mason jars!

Food: love their wide array of sliders. I had heard great things about their macaroni and cheese. While at first I was hesitant about fried macaroni and cheese balls, I discovered their awesomeness.

I LOVE this place!  The owner Steve, rocks!  It's an eclectic mix of 1950's antiques, movies in the background, boxing ring, outdoor patio, unique clothes line and forthcoming "Pie Hole" for fresh pies!  He has a blend of everything for everyone and the atmosphere is local, urban, energetic, and tons of space!  Food and drinks are excellent and Steve talks to everyone!

If that isn't enough, go on a Sunday for his Punch & Crunch Brunch!  That is a workout you won't forget and work up an appetite for a great brunch!  You aren't a Phoenix Hipster unless you've been here!

Great place - love how cute the venue is! Got the mac & cheese muffins & sliders (comes with 3 of them) for 2 people which is more than enough. Sliders were delicious however mac & cheese muffins were good but not as amazing as described in these reviews. They were fried so they turned out a bit oily...

Cute place however... I did spot a few cockroaches scurrying around on the ground :( I was in the outdoor seating area...but still was not a pleasant sight.

The deuce has a pretty cool spot to hang out with friends on the weekend or even for happy hour. drinks are handcrafted with fresh local ingredients which is also a plus for me. I love their mules and  Margaritas are on point. Definitely go on happy hour.. take advantage of the cheaper prices.  in my opinion they are a little pricey. I think it's cute how you can go up and order your food and give them a fake name for an interesting dining experience,  but  make sure you are paying attention, can be easy to miss your food order. And who wants cold food? I'm obsessed with their macaroni and cheese muffins they are so delicious so flavorful that's really the only thing that I order when I go. It's cool because this spot is close to home, so it's convenient little spot to drop in if I want to have a nice drink.  I bring my daughter here sometimes and we play table tennis so it could also be a cool spot to bring teenagers or even little ones to indulge in cornhole as well.

I love that this place. Is an old warehouse converted to be a night club. Early in the evening the place wasn't as packed. There is a nice little dance floor for some fun and pool tables in the back.  Also available is a small shop for t-shirts and other items. The bartender I dealt with was not the most personable. There is great outdoor patio and indoor seating so large or small groups can just chill during their night.
This place is great if you like to unwind on the weekend nights! The ambiance was great! There is a little bit of everything! From playing games to dancing and eating.

If you are looking for an interesting, fun and all-round party of a time, then come to The Duce. Seriously, the environment is pretty out of this world. The owner is a trip. He is really invested in this place. From the Milkshake bar to the boxing ring to the wing dances to the face floor. This vintage gem in the heart of downtown will leave you wanting more. The only reason i am leaving 4 and not 5 stars, is that the food could be better.

Pricey drinks and food but an undeniable different spot to go to. Wish they had cocktail waitresses but I'm just being picky. You definitely need to hunt down your own drinks and food. Drinks are garnished generously and you will pay for it. The spot is definitely worth going to if you want outside of the regular.

I dare you to try and describe the Duce in under 50 words. By far the most unique bar/venue/ restaurant in Phoenix.  The food is really good. Chicken apple sliders, milkshake shots, hand made organic drinks, brisket, schlitz beer, hamms beer, PBR etc. all excellent. 

We love it so much we decided to have our wedding there. Everyone was fantastic to us from start to finish. We could not be happier that we had our wedding there. Our pictures turned out AMAZING!!!!  And I say that as the groom. You can't imagine how pumped my wife is. All ofthe guests were blown away by the place. 

Andi and Steve are true visionaries. What they have done with an old produce wear house is almost a miracle. Ellen, who helped us plan everything, was fantastic. Thy have turned a once sketchy part of Phoenix into a gem. 

Everyone in Phoenix has to at least try this place. If you don't fall in love its not for you. Stay at the ultra lounge you are used to. It's creative, unique, and incredibly welcoming. 

Yes, drinks can take a while to make, but they are hand squeezed juices and organic cocktails. Somethings take minute.

Stumbled on this place and thought I'd give it a try. Can't say I'll go back. The food was gross and expensive. I got the brisket sliders and they were gloppy and sickeningly SWEET.  The people seemed nice enough. Very groovy decor. I wandered around a bit. Not much was going on as it was 6 on a Friday night. They had some groovy clothing on sale and there were vintage tank tops for $120. I think my eyes may have been playing tricks on me. I'm glad they are trying to do some commercial venture in this area but unfortunately it doesn't work for me....

I had the French Toast along with a mimosa or two and both were delicious!
I love the patio of this place and can not wait until the weather is cooler to frequent it more often. 
The only things that i might do differently are
 1. Not have SO many things going on, it makes it a bit overwhelming. Cool concept but also confusing.

2. Fresh squeezed juices are AWESOME but take a LONG time when done to-order & there are a few drinks requiring it. I suggest to perhaps just prep some fresh squeezed juices that are ready to go for the day?

3. PBR is supposed to be cheap... it is cheap... keep it that way.

4. I too think it would HIGHLY benefit if the hours were later and had more of a bar scene... Heck I'd even stay open at 3 am a bit and experiment with late nighters who need a bite to eat after drinking.

Each and everytime I come here, I am happy for being able to be here and thankful that Get to have my favorite  Mac & Cheese bites. Service is a lil slow because they're legitimately busy, but plenty of social things to do and games to play for all ages.
Fun place with amazing drinks! Highly recommended and they also have a ton of games! Ping pong, shuffleboard, & cornhole!

The Duce is an awesome place to go for day drinking, groups of friends, and celebrations, but you have to just reign in your expectations before going. 
Things to know: They are not that great with event planning. I tried twice in the past to try and have an event with them, one for my Engagement Party and two for a separate private event. Never heard from them both times, so my events never materialized.
In addition, the most recent time I went, we ordered food and they messed up our order. They DOUBLED everything we ordered. So instead of one order of mac and cheese bites, we got two. We went home with a billion mac and cheese bites because when we tried to tell them the mix up they pretty much dismissed us. 
Finally, the parking is horrible. They have valet sometimes to help with the situation but on a busy night this can be a crazy show.
Okay now that those things are on the table, the drinks are awesome, albeit a little overpriced, depending on what you order - but they are sure to get you tipsy in no time. The food is delicious! I particularly like the mashed potato parfait and the mac and cheese bites. We tried the sliders as well but they weren't as good. 
If you're in it for the 'gram, this place is totally Insta-grammable. But again as I said, just tailor your expectations before you go.
Every time I have been here I have had a blast! From foosball to bags to bike riding, you never really know what's gonna happen, but it is a guaranteed good time.

I love The Duce! I'm super bummed a place like this does not exist in SoCal. I have been here two times over the last year once for the Phoenix Lindy Exchange and more recently just to grab drinks and hang out. 

Pro's: 
It's true the drinks are expensive but yummy, fresh, and strong, totally worth it in my opinion

Lots of activities to do if you are not dancing, drinking or eating. They have a bean-bag toss, vintage board games, and retro exercise equipment to play with and explore

The music and DJ were awesome on Friday nights, no attitude and open to requests

Have valet, and plenty of street parking not dangerously far from the venue, I felt safe

Overall a great place to dance, drink and eat with friends, check it out at least once!

The Duce is a great place. Excellent food, fun games and unique decor. Of course, it's owned by a former Chicagoan so I would expect nothing less. The place has atmosphere. We came here after the Cubs lost to the Dbacks and there were plenty of Cubbie fans here having a beer and playing some cornhole. Definitely coming back here. This is our kinda place!
Very cool and lay low place. They have ping pong, bags, foozeball, and punching bags. Karaoke is fun to watch. The drinks are good but a little on the high end.

I really have a mixed feeling every time I'm at the Duce. Last night, I was here for a birthday celebration. They had a wedding and another special event so it was crowded, especially indoors. We ended sitting out in the patio area. I just wish they had more heaters turned on. Burrr, it was cold!

If you ordered food, you can't hear them calling your name on the patio. You constant have to go to the trailer to check your order. They need speakers or better notification/service. A few of us had waited a bit for the food. 

The energy and the unique vibe make this a happening place in this neighborhood. It's still a sketchy area at night. If you don't valet park, park at your own risk!

Been here twice. First time we didn't have the best experience. They were out of about half of the food we wanted to order so we had to quickly make some second choices. We had stood in line to order for 30 minutes so  just wanted to get something coming. Waited an hour for our food. Food was good not great but okay. we thought the atmosphere was very cool so tried them again this past Saturday night. Got there at 5:30, they weren't extremely busy,just a few tables going. They had three specials on the board and they all sounded yummy. Tried to order all three... they were out of TWO of them. Really? Are you serious? Okay then give us the chips with onion dip. Nope. Out of the dip too. If the Duce thinks they are being exclusive or exotic by not having half the food offered,they are missing the mark. Too many other great places to go in Phx. We won't be giving them a third try.

Limited parking, fortunately I was able to valet but no one else in my party was able to. The mixologist really gets into his job but is very slow and by the time you get your drink, the ice has melted in the hot sun. Definitely need to put the bar and the whole outside deal under cover. This is AZ! 
Someone in the group had ribs and did say they were very good. I had the Mac and cheese muffins. Greasy but tasteless, really. Plenty good portion. Prices are a bit high on the food and the beverages. When they call your name it is difficult to understand what they are saying. This is a great place for the 20-30 crowd. Really a disorganized after thought. It wasn't very busy; I can't imagine what they do when it is.

Maybe if we didn't have to wait an hour for our food and watch at least three different parties who arrived after us get their orders before us, I might give this place more stars. The food, when it finally arrived, was good but pricey. What got me is why the wait? You place your order at the front and pick up your own food. But what really got me was the girl that took our order gave us an extra drink and some popcorn but neither time did she apologies for the wait. Twice I went up to question the wait. Twice I was told ours was next. Twice it wasn't. Maybe a little more acknowledgment of the situation would have me giving the a second chance. But not after just pretending there was nothing wrong.

This was exactly what we needed after working at a conference. Everyone in our group was ragged and worn but this place was so upbeat and whimsical, and in no time we had a mean game of corn hole going. Next sliders, with cold beer and pie in the jar. Great for groups of all ages who want to engage in great food, hula hoops, lawn games or just people watching.

Great revived space, awesome hidden location right near the ballpark downtown.  Ice cream, alcohol, boxing, soda, sliders, foozeball, ping pong, the list goes on and on.  I never thought it eating in the gym would feel so hip!

The Duce is located just south of Downtown Phoenix, in an old Boxing Gym that was converted into one of my favorite places in the Valley.  This is an inside/outside restaurant with plenty of activities and spots to sit to enjoy your surroundings. 

The service may be slow, but only because all the drinks are fresh made.  Citrus is squeezed just for your drink, but everyone is super friendly.

The food from the Food Trailer located on the property is too die for, and just a reminder during your summer months tip extra the food trailer as the cooks have no air and working their butt off for your appetites. The macaroni and cheese muffins are absolutely my favorite, and the 4 cheese dip is addicting.

Summer Months *** Dress for the weather

It's been a long day at work, it's Friday night, and I want to chill. Then my wife reluctantly tells me that we're meeting friends tonight. I say, "OK... I guess. What about the kid?" No babysitter. The kids is coming along...so much for chilling out. 

We end up at The Duce. Chill is written all over and we immediately fell in love with this place. After a short stop at the vintage soda fountain (and it really works), we headed to the bar and ordered a round. Then sat down in the atruim-like area and ordered the Whole Maple Roasted Chicken (they were out of brisket, which is supposed to be really good), baked beans and a salad. The kitchen is an old Airstream and the BBQ is out back. Total bill - less than 20 bucks with a tip. The chicken was killer, so were the beans (portions could be bigger). Best part - instead of giving you a number or taking your name when your order is ready they ask for a nickname. After taking longer than normal to place our order we went with "Indecisive" as our nickname. Seemed to fit at the time. 

My kid was so enthusiastic about the soda fountain that we had to stop and have a malt. Apparently it was really good, because my wife and daughter finished it before I could have a taste. 

The Duce has something for just about everyone - food, drinks, candy, candle, produce, vintage bikes and heck, they even had the D-backs game on next to some old school gymnasium bleachers. The Duce is an awesome place to chillout with friends and family (very kid friendly). Certainly going back for more.
Awful service. Awful way to take orders. Awful parking. Don't try this place unless you enjoy waiting 20 minutes to order and 20 minutes for cheesy hush puppies.

To be honest, I was expecting a lot more. We went Saturday night for a 40th birthday, to get some food and drinks. It took over an hour to get the fresh corn, sliders, and two salads - but, they forgot one of the salads so that took an extra 20 minutes. It wasn't even that busy. Nonetheless, there were kids (ages 5-9) running all around, in between all the tables. The music was along the lines of middle school dance, and it was just a fairly odd group of people (adults who want to drink and a daycare center??). The food and drinks were really good, but the wait was ridiculous. The restaurant itself was very cute and the games looked fun (we'd have played, but there were literally kids on each one). I suggest setting an age limit after 5pm on weekends - it's really not a family restaurant.

I walked in and was just confused.  There was waaaaay to much going on.   It was like a dive bar, shake shack, farmers market, food trunk, night club with hula hops, a boxing ring, corn hole, and ping pong.  I couldn't get into it because I could focus on one thing.   It was just overwhelming.

We came here for a weekend brunch & had high hopes.  The parking confused most of our party & the place is huge so it took a minute to find our group. The waitstaff doesn't come to you, you go to them. Yes the drinks are fresh but crazy overpriced. The Mac and cheese muffins were super dry. The sliders were ok but not worth the price. Will not be going back because it is overpriced.

congrats i just saw your restauarant on craziest restaurants in America on the food network channel...,,,,i read some of the reciews and your restaurant sounds like fun and great food and company,,,see ya soon.

I love this place.  I really hope it becomes a staple to the downtown scene.  I suppose, in a sense, it already is.  But, as other reviewers have commented, the service this past Friday was atrocious.  We were there this past friday while the Beer and Pancake Fest (?) was going on.  I can only imagine the thousands of dollars being lost by terrible service that was going on behind the bar.  

If you guys are going to figure out how to handle a decent sized event like this, please get some pros in behind the bar!  I'll be back because I really want to support the burgeoning downtown scene.  But, I might not stay very long if the drink service doesn't get it's act together.

Reading the negative reviews I almost didn't check this place out. Stopped in on my way back home to California. Prior to stopping I had read if your not a regular you'd receive terrible service this was so far from the truth. Super neat place food was good, service excellent, drinks amazing loaded with a ton of ripe delicious fruit! Yes it's a little pricey but it's not your average place. I will definitely stop by again! Thank you Duce for stepping outside of the box and coming up with a super unique dining experience!m

The duce seems to be everything you want it to be really. Picnic table, boxing ring, vintage items, gym, karaoke, wedding reception and a dance floor. :) 
The atmosphere was was awesome. The set up to this place was funm

I had the cheesy sliders, it was a great flavor. their roll was phenomenal. Yummmm.

I shall be backk.

Went here for the first time for a rehearsal dinner. The atmosphere was pretty awesome.  My four kids loved it. They had a ping pong table that kept them busy. They do offer healthy food choices like grass fed beef and organic eggs but as far as ingredients go, I don't know.  Their food tasted good, their staff were phenomenal and it appears pretty clean.  They did  have a broken Foosball table that may be way beyond repairable. They seem to do well enough financially to be able to buy a new one. Their prices do look a little pricey especially for the amount of food they give you and they also have a complimentary valet but I'd rather park the vehicle myself. You just can't not tip the dude!

The Duce, is nothing but short of awesome. Great food, your basically in slider heaven, with drink concoctions to keep your mind stimulated and wanting more, the Duce offers a nice haven for getting away. Whether with a group of friend or just a few drinks with a friend, the Duce has even a quite good collection of pf flyers and vintage shirts to keep any hipster at bay. It's definitely worth checking and super approved by us here at cafehunters.

The Duce - a boxing ring, etc.!

Knock-out:
- s'mores cheesecake "for four" "people" blowtorched to order.
- bacon mac 'n' cheese muffins because don't be a sociopath just get them.
- the chicken pot pie that will accompany Marie Callender's resignation letter.
- ping pong, hula hooping, karaoke, vintage kitchen, bleachers, memorabilia, nostalgia.  

Other boxing term for decent:
- banana cream pie milkshake brings a few boys to the yard.
- noodle kugel, served cold and fruity for instant "Shabbat moment" flavor.
- breakfast and meatball slider rated edible by 9/10 gastroenterologists.
- tons of seating only it's hot AF and everyone wants to be at the 4 cool tables.

Third boxing term for not preferable:
- chicken sausage reminiscent of wet cat food in a tube.
- corn hole.

I don't know sh*t about boxing. Not all the food is awesome, but pretty much everything else is, and the festivities are free. Also, all the food was made in a trailer so stop whining. Now get up in the ring and lemme hear ya sing "ROXXXXAAAAANE."

Stopping in here while I was on a Sunday morning Downtown bike ride,  I wasn't prepared [with cash or cards] as I wasn't expecting to stop anywhere.  I parked my bike and walked in.  Roaming through their retail area I was surprised to see that there were alteast 8-10 cars outside and several people inside.  The clothes....hummm I will reserve my opinion.  Glanced over at the bar and a seperate soda fountain.  I finally made my way to the patio to check out the airstream kitchen.  Cool!....I had heard they had a statue of the Hams Bear in here somewhere too....did I miss it...Bummer!

I will have to check out the food some other time maybe on my next ride that way...as I wouldn't feel too cozy walking solo that way even in the light of day...It's pretty dead downtown on a Sunday but there was still someone lurking around just about every corner.

Last night a group of us went to The Duce in downtown Phoenix. It. Was. Fantastic. An old 1928 brick warehouse, the space is all indoor/outdoor, the food is roach coach style, the speciality "vintage cocktails" are served in mason jars and the overall vibe is uber hip & comfortable. We bought some vintage Love Button jewelery, ate Chicago style hot dogs, meatball sliders and waffles while mingling with a magician and singing along to 60's tunes. What more could you ask for? Oh, bottomless fresh squeezed grapefruit mimosas for a dog friendly Sunday brunch? Sign me up. One of the coolest spots in Phoenix for sure. The service was a little slow but that didn't bother me as everyone was super nice and quite frankly - I wasn't in a hurry and didn't mind waiting for a drink. Two thumbs up.

Like the idea- cool spot. It was hot when we got there but I would enjoy returning after sunset. Loved my whiskey sour- pricy but good. Skip the food- had the chips & onion dip, 3 slider combo & chicken brat- eh wasn't impressed with any of the food to be honest. Skip the food come for a cocktail, maybe a shot or two! Nice atmosphere! Loved the cashier- blonde, skinny gal with tattoos- she was new & so nice!

Beautifully decorated. A really comfortable place to get a beer and some dinner. We ordered their chicken pot pie, grass fed beef sliders, a Chicago dog (legit neon relish on that) and Mac n cheese muffins. All of which were really great! But that chicken pot pie was our favorite. Next time I'm in Phoenix I'll most definitely make my way out there.

I had so much fun with my friends here. The music they play is awesome. Drinks are a bit over priced for the amount of Ice the bartenders add. But I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a fun place to hang out.

Neat!! This place has the most random set up as you will find in other reviews. Menu is all organic, our bar tender/ server was very entertaining. The location was a bit hole in the wall, but once inside very worth it!
The Duce is great during our beautiful spring weather!!  Loved listening to the Rolling Stones AND The Bee Gees while drinking my delightfully fun Sunday Rose'

Took my brother and sister-in-law here to see the live music and enjoy the finally cooler weather central phx has to offer...we had a good time.  I heard there was karaoke here though, and i guess we came on the wrong night, we would of really loved to see some ppl go crazy on the stage--which is a boxing ring!  

We had Whiskey Sours, that were served with fruit and mint on the rim in mason jars--really good!  The potato crisps were not that great---and really expensive.  

Overall, the place wasn't too crowded and we were able to enjoy the music without ppl stepping on our toes and decent seating. 

Oh, and i love how they have Valet parking---didn't have to worry about finding a parking on the street in case the very tiny parking lot was full.

I don't care how good your food truck cuisine supposedly is, when there are a dozen people standing around "working" and none of them can take your order, there is a problem. I don't care how "trendy" your establishment is, bad service is just that. Indifferent employees, potholes in the parking lot the size of swimming pools, and an empty water dispenser were only a few of the items that have ensured I will not come back here.

We went there last July or so, this place gets one star because this place HAS NO AC.
No AC in Phoenix.  Lol it was 192 degrees in there at night. No thank you.
We had our Best Western corporate mixer here what a great spot food was good and we had a lot of fun very cool retro place.

This is a really chill spot. Came here after work and had a awesome experience. Environment was really laid back they have a boxing ring ping pong table dance lessons it was all of the above.. lots of room for a big group. Customer service was great food was really good for bar food scene. Overall I would def put this on my list to come back to when I'm in town.

Tasty drinks but that's about it. Waiters, bartenders and even managers are not only incompetent but quite rude also. 

Yesterday I set up a poetry set to showcase a few local Phoenix artist. I had told the management on multiple occasions what we where going to be doing and the nature of our show. We had the spot reserved for over a month and a half! Not only where they not ready (understaffed and one of their bars closed) but once our audience started showing up (most of color), all of a sudden there was a problem with our show. 

What makes the whole situation worse is that the place was DEAD, maybe 10 people at most. My group had about 50 people with another 40 expected to show up. All ordering drinks and food. But the owner Steve still decided to kick us out because we where going to "offend" his clientele. The same clients that were coming up to me and my group wanting to take pictures with us, some even asking to buy tickets to the event. The shirts that Steve claimed to be offensive to his clients where all BOUGHT from us by his clients at the place. Some even going as far as buying the shirts off our back Literally! 

As a successful Real Estate Investor it is obvious to me that this place does not know how to run a business. And further more this place is willing to give up a very profitable night turning away close to 100 customers willing to consume food and drinks, just because we look different than their normal audience.

I don't care what other people say or write. I haven't read a thing anybody has said before starting this.

As long as the season allows it, bring all your out of town family here. This is as original destination. The ambiance is unlike anything you have ever been too for a dinning experience. Not sure I would bring kids too young here.

Food is simple; sliders and macaroni muffins are all you need to order with your choice of an adult beverage. 

Come in, take a seat, then find the trailer to place your order. You and your guests will absolutely love.

Love how the drinks are made as everything is fresh and they are amazing... wish the bartenders were more friendly. I always order the brisket sliders as they are delicious! It's more of a hipster crowd lacking more of a diverse crowd... still a good time! Music isn't great but again it's a hipster crowd so more main stream music.
This place was great! The atmosphere was not "clubby" which is great! The karaoke was also wonderful.  I would defintely come back again to dance the night away.

Booo! Arrived at 5:30, ordered food at 5:45 as it took 10 minutes to get drinks..and it's now 7p with no food. One person in our party got a refund, the rest of us are headed in the same direction. They have a wedding going on on one side and a bar Mitzvah on the other and the rest of us are just sort of in the middle looking for a spot to sit. We have music and announcements coming from both sides which is distracting. Just too much happening at one time so maybe one event at a time? Anyway, the place is packed so you would think they'd have more staff but not the case. The ordering process needs serious improvement as you just stand in front of a small station for food or another one for drinks. Maybe it wouldn't  be an issue if there weren't so many people and there was room for a line. Not the case so people are sort or piled in and the girl taking the orders doesn't know who supposed to be next. What a cluster f*#*! While the drinks are great, again, the ordering process needs improvement. So some food arrived before all was canceled. Sliders pretty good as was the cheese dip. Guess we'll have to try this place again....and hope for a better experience.

Seems like a great place to be I absolutely love it the atmosphere and the people I saw a father dancin to Beyonce with his beautiful two young daughters it was great vibes I have to come back, earlier we came close to ending time ugh love it here I don't wanna go home


So I stayed till they closed and I'll tell u i had  5 drinks the margarita was so bomb great do if try whatever u like then the mark you'll love it

I went to the Duce this weekend for the first time and can not believe I have not gone before! This place is so much fun. They have a boxing ring, hula hoops, exercise equipment, shuffle board, corn hole, a fun and lively dance floor and ping pong. They serve beer like Old Milwaukee....so, in other words, the BF's dream bar. But he was not there, I went with Erin B. for her bachelorette party. The drinks were very expensive, but they were fresh, tasty, and packed an alcoholic punch. My philosophy is that if I am going to pay upwards of 10$ for a drink, it better be all made in house with fresh fruit and this was, so I can't complain. A few of us went up and did a few exercises on the wall where you hold up your body and lift your knees to your chest, I did 3 and was very proud of myself....then a couple girls came over and really showed us up...they were aerial pole dances and were hanging upside down by one arm and whatnot....very fun to watch. I think the best part of this bar is that it can be whatever you want it to be....it can be quiet and laid back in some areas, full of games and entertainment in some areas and a dance club in others. I will definitely be back to this bar again.


PS funny story....I had already had a good amount of alcohol upon arrival. We were all standing by the trailer waiting to order beers. I saw that there was a satellite dish on the wall and thought 'wow..that's an odd thing to use as kitch...' I continued staring at the ceiling like an idiot when a plane flew overhead and I realized we were still outside...obviously it was a good night.

I visit Phoenix fairly often.  We decided to check out this place at the recommendation of a friend on a Friday night at around 6pm. First thing we noticed was the whole walking directly into a storefront thing. Okay cool, but no one around to guide newbies. It looked like an event was being set up next to the store section. Great music drew us into a fairly open and empty room with amps and great 80's music. We did not see anywhere to order apps or drinks, so we walked to the outside, where it seemed the majority of the patrons were. One member of our party went to the circular bar in the center to get 3 drinks. It took over 20 minutes for him to return. Another member of our party went to the food ordering stand thing. Again, over 20 minutes for bacon mac muffins and cheese dip.  Our first 3 drinks came to over $40 without food added on. I went to get another round for our group, spent another 20+ minutes being ignored by the bartender, until finally he turned to me and asked if I was with the wedding party. I had no idea there was a wedding party. No signage, nobody giving out that information. I replied no, and was told that there was another bar inside of the building that would give me better service - all after sitting for 20+ minutes, watching him drop his juice squeezer on the floor and pick it up without washing it, and being pretty disappointed by how other people's orders were being taken before mine when I had been standing there much longer. My party had gotten their appetizers while I was gone waiting for this guy. I had a cold muffin and a few scoops of cold cheese dip, then, with one muffin left in the basket, an employee picked up the basket - sticking his thumb in the muffin - and asked if we were finished as he did not even wait for a response and turned away with it. You can bet I won't be going here again. Too bad the music was good.

This place has been on DDD a couple of times and friends have recommended it several times. I have now tried them twice and must say, I am not impressed. Both times I visited they were not busy and waited over 45 min each time for lunch. REALLY, not a place for lunch, if you have to go back to work. Food was decent but nothing to write home about. Service is cold and tries too hard to be cool and laid-back, just comes off as unconcerned and indifferent. Maybe next time I will arrive with Guy Fieri, then I can get service and food.

I really wanted to like this place!! It has such a unique and fun vibe! The decor is so eclectic, it just screams "Let's have fun!!" This would definitely be a fun place to hang with friends or have a party, it's a great place to be a kid again! 
However... there were some disappointments. We sat outside to enjoy the weather, but were completely inundated with flies. We couldn't keep them off us or the food and we had to move inside. Additionally, the outside courtyard really smelled badly of sewer or trash, I honestly couldn't decipher. Not appetizing at all. 
My husband had the pot pie which was super yummy! Great flavor and unique with the sweet corn! 
The Mac and cheese muffins would have been good, but they were cold... 
I ordered their thanksgiving special and the description clearly said, "turkey, stuffing and gravy with a side of cranberry" perfect! Except the cranberries were All inside the stuffing inside the sand which. Which is fine, if you like cranberries. The sand which probably would be super yummy for those who enjoy that. I understand this is my personal preference, my frustration was their signage was completely wrong. I would have ordered something else. 
Finally the desserts weren't bad, but just ok! Just milkshakes, nothing to write home about! Kind of a bummer for the price.

One of the cutest places I've ever seen. Stumbled on to it after a Diamondbacks game. Tuesday night is swing dancing. 

Friendly staff. Great cocktails. Great concept. Wish they had a place like this back home. 

Thanks for making depressed Giants fans welcomed

I absolutely love The Duce!  I used to drive up Central and see the sign, not knowing if it was a restaurant, bar, gym, or store.  The fact is that it is all of the above.  Upon entering The Duce has such an unexpected element as you walk in.  When you walk through the old warehouse you stumble upon one surprise after another.  Looking for the most satisfying Mac and cheese?  You'll find it here!  Boxing and yoga on a Sunday morning?  Yup, it's here.  If my description of The Duce has you intrigued or even confused, pay them a visit!  You will not be disappointed.  Make sure to check out their hours of operation.  Monday's they are closed, but they make up for it with being open late every other day!

This place was very lame. Crowd was dry  and the staff were aggressive for no reason. Just trying to have fun and chill, wouldn't recommend to a anyone. I was with 4 others. And they agree. Wasn't welcoming at all.

I had heard such great reviews from others about this place and was excited to try it.  So excited that I invited other friends to meet up there before heading over to a concert nearby.  I checked to make sure it was wheelchair accessible for a friend who was joining us for dinner and the website said, "yes" only to find out when we got there that there was NO handicapped parking available nor was there enough room for her to unload herself in her chair.  Not cool, we left immediately.

Fantastic area to eat and play in. The environment is amazing and the food is equally amazing. I would say the environment reminds me of the fallout games in a nostalgic and fun way. The best thing to order there is the macaroni and cheese muffins. They are my main reason for visiting this place, but the friendly staff and environment make for the perfect atmosphere with their amazing drinks and of course the Marconi and cheese muffins. YUM

I love this place!  My favorite thing to eat here are the mac and cheese muffins!  

Such a cute area for a happy hour or dinner with the family.  Outdoor patio seating, yet it is all covered with trees and coverage.

There is a cute shop inside and a boxing ring, along with an area to play ping pong, foosball, and cornhole.

Fun place for kids and adults!


Also, I have been here for a wedding.  Super cute!!!

Will not return. Rude employees from the start. I would have left but we already did valet and were meeting friends. The ordering system is not ideal nor the food pick up. Non alcoholic drinks are pricey and there are no refills. Served in small Mason jars. The whole set up was confusing and its hot and humid inside. 
Food was okay but overpriced. 
Tried the Mac & cheese deals and they were awesome - that's where the extra star on my review came from.

Had the sliders tonight- bread was too hard.  DIfficult to eat. With a softer bread, would have been tasty.   Friend had Mac/Cheese muffins.  Pretty tasteless.  Great concept, but not very good.  Will stick with salads if we have to go again with friends or something

  Understaffed tonight- wait for food was 30-40 minutes, Wait at bar was over ten minutes.... and it was hot inside and it's only MARCH.

  Wouldn't go back unless i had a reason to- special event planned there or something.

Super Hipster, and awesome healthy yummy eats. great fresh drinks, and a total casual place to be.... only downside, no A/C... so it's super hot, when it's super hot outside, because it's basically outside and inside a warehouse. loved the place though, had a great time!
This place is so so unique! All drinks are served in large mason jars and made with FRESH fruit. There's tons of options and the food is good too!

Ok..... where do I begin.... the Duce is by FAR my favorite date night place of all time!!! The atmosphere is incredible, the options of activities is endless, the drinks are AH-MAAAAAAZZZZIIINNNNGGGGG, and the DJ's always know how to get everyone on the floor. My boyfriend and I come here Fridays after 9 (which is only 21 and over) to have a couple drinks and to play fooseball, ping pong, bean bag toss, get our grove on (did I mention there was tons to do?) and we always leave talking about how much fun we had for the next week straight! My boyfriend also discovered here he is a professional hula hooper and won a free drink for his newly discovered talent. The owners are so so nice and interacted with Matt and I the whole night- we even had a ping pong challenge which if I would have won... would have scored myself a free drink.... #soreloser... anyways if you are looking for a fun date night- a fun girls night out- a place to discover your next hidden talent- a place to have the most fantastic drink of your life- a place to have a blast- or a place that will put the kid back in the grown up you who has worked all week and needs to let loose.... go visit the Duce

This place does a really good job at offering Phoenix something it doesn't have.  It brings dancing, hoola hooping, boxing, ping pong-ing?, corn holing, and drinking all into one spot.

  There are probably a couple of places like that, but not many.  With the music they play, and the different scene they offer, this place is one of its own.  I am happy to come here and smiling when I leave.  

The prices are a bit much, you can drop plenty of money if you are buying at a whim.  The drinks and cocktails are ok, I didn't really click with any but the experience I had was unique.

My favorite place of all time. The Duce serves great hand crafted vintage cocktails and has so many fun things to do - cornhole, shuffle board, dance floor, etc! This place is always chill and never too crowded with fun friendly customers and staff! Nestled right downtown with a few nice skyline views! The Duce is the way to go if you are into something a little different and less snooty than Scottsdale bars.

The Duce is probably the coolest bar/restaurant/smoothie shop/boxing ring/clothing store/trailer you'll ever go to!

In the mood for mind-bowing short rib sliders? Check.

Need a new pair of Chuck's? Check.

Thirsty for an ice-cold PBR? Check.

Feel like punching someone in the face? Check-ish...

My only gripe would be drink prices. If you're down to slam some PBR or old school Budweiser, the you're drinking for $3 a pop. Fancy a Mojito - that'll run you about $12 for a 6oz-er. Focus on the cheap drinks and the amazing food, and you will love this place forever!

Must update my review- the owner of this place is a d-bag! They were so concerned with their lame karaoke night that they wouldn't let us sing any songs that involved "bad words". Also 90% of the people there weren't even drinking- which isn't a big deal except for the fact that my friends and I's $50 bar tab a piece (for like 4 mediocre drinks) didn't warrant more leniency for karaoke. It's not like we were trying to sing Wu-Tang. But seriously every 10 minutes the owner or manager was running over like a total prude yelling at the dj. Lame lame lame. Will never come here again. This place is like a church retreat- but even worse. Also- their clothes and boutique totally suck. And they're bathrooms are disgusting.

This is a awesome little funky spot!

It seems to house a bar/restaurant, a boxing club and some other space that was having some kind of yoga thing the morning we went.

The food and service were both outstanding. I ordered a skillet scramble with mushrooms, bacon and gruyere. My gf ordered the cinnamon pecan french toast with bacon.

This place is great, try it if you haven't!
I love the inside decor and atmosphere.  The food was to salty for my liking, but they did have free valet.

I came to the Duce again this past weekend.  Based on my last visit, I didn't really want to eat here again, but a friend was having his going away here and I was starving so I ordered dinner.  I got the chicken pot pie in a jar and the sweet potato crisps.

The pot pie was good, although pretty small.  I liked the flakiness of the crust, but at the end of the meal the glass jar it came in broke!  The bottom corner of it came clean off.  I think the glass might have been weakened from being baked.  Not sure if the jar it came in was made to withstand high heat like that....

The sweet potato crisps were a pretty big let down.  I thought they would be more like savory fries, but they are actually like potato chips.  And burnt chips at that!  Also, they were covered in brown sugar.  I would've preferred for them to be savory.  I expected them to be savory bc the lady who took my order asked if I wanted a french onion dip with them?  Sweet chips with a french onion dip sounds like an awful combination.  I'm glad I turned down the dip.

Oh and eating all that hot food in a warehouse with no A/C was no bueno.  I was sweating and trying to fan myself, but it didn't help!  They need more fans or maybe some kind of indoor mister system...

So yeah, I should have listened to the advice from my previous review and just stuck to drinks and the games here!  Everything else is only okay.

I'd been here once before but this time it was even BETTER!  Drinks are great...I had the raspberry gimlet. Food is amazing. Mac and cheese muffins were to die for and the slider sampler was very flavorful.  Along with the games and good music (although it was a bit loud for conversation) I would recommend this place for any group gathering.

Our friend recommended this restaurant to us and told us not to be fooled by the outside. We pulled up and thought what the heck is this place? It does NOT look like your typical eatery. We walked into a courtyard with tables and a "Duchess" 1968 streamline camper that serves as the kitchen. Then we walked into the warehouse area and we were greeted by a boxing ring, hula hoops, bean bag toss and a couple of ping pong tables. Oh and they have an old soda fountain area. So unique and eclectic! You won't want to miss the diamond in the rough in downtown Phoenix, AZ. 
Not only was the vibe super cool and fun but the food totally rocked my taste buds! Diners, Drive ins and Dives even had a show at this place. 
 2 thumbs up from me and my hubby!

this may be my favorite bar in all the Tempe/Phoenix/Scottsdale area.

1. live band karaoke. they have a limited list and it's higher register / challenging stuff but not so much that we novice karaokeers can't hang. regular karaoke is fun too and much bigger selection but get there EARLY because the list can be shut down as early as 9/9:30.

2. have your cupid shuffle, wobble, electric slide, boot scoot boggies and thrillers down. you will use them. trust me. and everyone here knows them.

3. hula hoops are WAY harder than you remember them being at age 9. so practice and try to be the last man/woman standing.

4. the huge jar drinks are fantastic. sugary for the most part, but fantastic. I love the 1.5 liter white russian personally.

5. come ready to dance like nobody is watching.

Didn't get what the Duce was doing AT ALL - almost seems like they found cheap warehouse space and decided they HAD to use ALL the space.  Then they used ideas 11-20 as well as their top 10 just to not hurt someone's feelings. Boxing ring? OK! Gift shop? Sure! Lawn games? Yup. Put a trailer inside? Fine. And a fancy bar? Yes. But with just 1 small TV? How quaint! After we get all that, can Pinterest throw up all over everything?

We had to talk to 4 people to understand where the food was and how to order it, then another person to order drinks. The food was the solitary high point - brisket sliders and mac n cheese muffins - quite good. Drinks were a bummer - the bartender put alot of show into the mixology - muddling stuff, scooping, shaking, pouring - took his time. My drink still came out watered down, impossible to stir because of the awkward, squat mason jar packed with ice, and there was barely anyone there to boot.

Just start with one thing done well, Duce - I've heard if there are fights, it's alot of fun, but seeing how poorly organized it was for just the 20ish people that were there, don't know if I'll trust them to manage a crowd well

Yeah, I'll be the one. The idea is fun I suppose. But even a good dive should have at least something going for it. So not the people, not the service, definitely not the music-they have a lot of seating? Yeah because there was absolutley no one there on a Friday night. Stay weird Duce people. No thanks.

I am so mad that I spent $40 here for horrible food and a stomach ache. I had the breakfast sliders. Eggs were burnt and the sausage and biscuit has no flavor. My husband had the trio of sliders and said they were not good. You really don't have a server. You go up to the bar and order. No one checked on us to see if were enjoying our food. The "cheap" beers were $4. This is $4 for a PBR, Hamms or Old Style. I had a Moscow Mule which was flavorless and $10. I should have complained, but I just wanted to get the h*ll out of there. Will never return.

This place did not disappoint, from the eclectic vibe to the mac and cheese muffins, amazing! I had the sliders, one brisket and one chicken, both were really good and was the right amount of food.  Music was also eclectic mix, very upbeat, for lunch crowd.
This place is so cool! Great environment! The mashed potatoes in a cup is my favorite! They also have to die for sliders. And great cocktails!
Had such a blast here! Karaoke on Fridays and Saturdays with a dj and dance music. Food and drinks til 1am and such a friendly staff.

I really wanted to like this place. I drove 3 hours to give it a try, and see if it would work for a wedding rehearsal party but found it overpriced, and the kitchen clearly unable to keep up with the flow of customers.  First the environment: BUSY. So much going on. Retro and unique.  Fun.  I can imagine the "stepping back in time" feel is part of the charm.  Games here, tables there but unfortunately everything appeared to be reserved so seating was hard to find.  We were there in late June, on a Saturday night, and it was hot inside.   Uncomfortably hot.  
The service: we arrived around 7pm. There were only two couples ahead of us at the food truck.  We ordered off the menu, but had to wait 15 minutes for the lemonade.   Did I mention it's hot?   We didn't see water anywhere and no offer of a glass of water.  To be clear, you order your food and pick it up. No one brings it to you.  So, we were told it would take about 35 minutes for our name to be called to pick our food.  About 35 minutes later we were called but that was to tell us that the kitchen ran out of one of our items so we needed to order something else.  20 minutes later still nothing.  So once again went to the food truck to see what the problem was.  The kitchen apologized to us and gave us 1/2 our order and told us the other half would be ready in 5-10 minutes.   I waited again and then walked back after 10+ minutes.   The server at the food truck window apologized again and got the rest of our food together.  Most of our food  was lukewarm at best.  The ribs were ok, the chicken sausage Rueben was awful, the chili cornbread jar was hot and okay, the roasted bacon bruschetta had no bacon on it that we could detect.   For the price paid the food was very basic- nothing spectacular.  Yes we could have walked it all back to the food truck to have it reheated, etc...but then it would have taken even longer.  When we left, no one asked if everything was ok or said goodbye. This place appears to be understaffed.  
I wanted to like this place.  Heard so much about it, but ended up being disappointed.  Wish I had the experience that all the other people on this post had.  Maybe we just visited on a bad day.
This place is awesome!! Atmosphere, food, extras, Love it!!

Came on a Saturday hundred 15 degrees outside 4 in the afternoon environment is so pleasant definitely a fun place to have groups or families with adult kids. However the service and fortunately was below standard we were there for a good 30 minutes without even being offered something to drink once you realize you had to wait in the line to order our food the cashier was with the same customer for a good 15 minutes mind you it's 115 degrees outside! Young lady knew it was our first time here she saw sitting at the table and did not give us Direction on how to proceed with ordering a drink and food we left without even drinking water unfortunately we will not be returning but good luck to the next

Oh man, I hate this star rating thing! Food and service are two completely different features of a restaurant. So I'll do the average and give the Duce a 3. It doesn't sit well with me but it is what it is. Starting with their food- delicious, savory, never disappoints. Tried majority of their menu.... most sliders, Mac & cheese bites, etc... all delicioso! Now moving on to service. At the bar, expect to wait at least 10-15 minutes before being acknowledged. After that, expect another 10 minutes for your actual drink to arrive. I've been here at least 10 times and this has been the case each and every time. Doesn't matter if the bar is slow or hectic, expect a wait. If you're pressed for time or want a quick drink, this is NOT the place for you. Couple of reasons. 1.) There is only 1 person tending bar. 2.) All cocktails are made to order, as in fresh squeezed juices, freshly chopped garnishes, etc... 
So what you end up with is almost always a delicious and perfectly fresh drink. BUT I feel that their prices are a bit absurd. For example, here now and I ordered a spicy Bloody Mary. $13.03. That's just silly. Phoenix is full of craft cocktail joints & mixologists. The reason we don't come here as much as we'd like is for this reason. We can throw a few down and don't want to pay $13 per drink while doing so. Ya feel me?

The duce has been on my list of must-try's for months now! I was so glad I finally checked it out, but also glad I waited until the weather cooled off a bit! 

This is a throwback, retro, hip...kind of spot. It can be kind of confusing if you're not with someone who has been at least once before. I walked into the part of the building where you can buy clothes/accessories. There are tables and some kind of smoothie spot to your left and a boxing ring in the back. See what I mean by confusing? Aside from not knowing where to go, it is in a very conspicuous spot so it could be easy to pass and somewhat of a challenge for parking.

We poked our heads around the corner and it looked to be just a hang out and someone was celebrating a birthday. Finally I asked the girl behind the cash register where we could order food.  She explained a bit about the place and showed us around. I appreciated that and further confirmed my confusion statement assuming others had felt the same way before. ;) 

The patio is GREAT! Mismatched retro chairs, wooden picnic tables, hanging records and who could forget the silver trailer they serve food from?!  It took a minute to find the menu because she pointed around to random things and said, "menu is written all over the place" and that was it. Well, she was right...it's written on old tattered doors and wooden fence. Finally we went and asked for a real one..much better.

We got the meatball sliders and strawberry pecan salad. Both were DELICIOUS! Drinks were served in a glass coke bottle and what other than a mason jar. Cute. 

Now being somewhat familiar with the way things work I look forward to returning. Combination of good food, good weather and great atmosphere I can't wait to take someone who's never been. This is definitely an experience.(:

This was my third visit to The Duce and just about as enjoyable as the previous two. I love the vibe here - great cocktails, good music, and comfort food. Next time I'm going for the beer-can chicken and forcing myself to wait the 25 minutes. It looks amazing! We had the sliders, roasted corn, and special of the day - Sonoran Hot Dog. All were delicious. Their cocktails are amazing though and I cannot get that fresh margarita (no mixer) out of my head. Going back for another sometime soon for sure. The only down side to this visit was the music from the wedding in the back half of the building. I love how they divided the place off for the wedding, and the sheer panels looked beautiful blowing in the breeze. But the music... Two sides of The Duce playing competing tunes was confusing. If there's a wedding and they have great music and a DJ - let it flow outward. Otherwise... it's just too much.
What a joke. Went there for "happy hour" on Friday and paid $16.00 for a 16oz drink that was 90% ice.  No AC and no waitresses. No!! I will NOT be returning.

Fun, Unique, Urban ambiance & a little bit of Average Joe's gym with amazing food. Pancakes to die for! Thank god for all the work out equipment, ping pong, corn hole ... Kept us busy while we waited for an hour for our food (and it wasn't even packed...) would definitely come back... But only if I had a couple hours to spear. Food = 5, service =1

We went there on a Friday night for karaoke. The dj flat out told us that he doesn't care and he just wanted to play music all night. We talked to the manager, and his response was that the dj was just being a jerk and walked away. Then, the dj did a karaoke song himself! It was way too loud to even talk. The small drinks were $11. Not a good experience, and definitely not a place to go for karaoke.

This is a long one but I think you will get some good info....I hope. 

I had a blast at the Duce on Saturday night. However I don't think the Duce had anything to do with it. I was there to see super happy fun time burlesque show. It was amazing! The only reason the Duce received 3 stars instead of 2 is because they allowed this show to go on. 

Lets start from the beginning. 

Parking - Free valet - Awe-some! I had read past reviews that said parking was an issue. I am not sure if the free valet is for show nights only or if it's just a fix based on past reviews. Either way it's good work!

Entering the Duce- It is pretty cool to walk into the outside. You really can not tell you are still outside unless you look up. The decor is old school and I love it. 

You order your food in the first leg of the Duce race. It's a little streamline trailer that cooks the food. When we arrived we stood in quite a line. Everyone coming in or leaving were bumping into you in line because the douchy scottsdale people decided they would stand and fist bump each other right in the middle of the isle way. I really felt like I was in Scottsdale for a minute. I mean they had tons of seating in that area that wasn't in the direct path of EVERYONE. I guess they wouldn't have been noticed as much though. Uhhh this is why I stick to Phoenix. They shouldn't be allowed in our hood! ;)

Food - We ordered our food and it suuuuuucked. We got the brisket sliders and the sweet potato chips. They put brown sugar on the sweet potato chips! They need salt to balance them....not more sugar. The sliders had a sauce that was not pleasant at all...even my partner in crime did not like them and he eats anything. 

* read below about the horrible employee who takes your food order. 

Saving Grace- Pudding Cake with banana, walnuts and whipped cream on top. Oh my .... it was one of the best deserts I have ever had. It wasn't too sweet but just the right yum a yum yum. That same partner in crime is not a fan of sweets but he helped me with it. I was bummed because I wanted to try the baked apple pancake but they said they didn't have it. So I got the pudding cake and I am happy I did. 

Next you enter the bar area. It's your typical bar area with an old B of a bartender. Thank goodness I got the nice guy. I was able to order my drinks really quick even though the place was pretty crowded. I decided to try something different and went with a Moscow Mule. It was really good! They do not skimp on the alcohol which is fantastic for all involved. 

They are all made in super cute mason jars and garnished to eye catching perfection. They also use a lot of fresh fruit etc. Awesome! One of the best I have experienced. 

Then you move into the boxing ring/ store area. They have vintage military items and old girly trinkets. It's very cool. They didn't have any of the lights on to buy anything which I thought was crazy. I would have spent a ton but oh well. 

Then the show went on in the boxing ring. The show was awesome!

Later on in the night I wanted a strawberry lemonade so I went to where we ordered our food because that is where you get the fresh lemonade. 

The same two people were there and one had 5 people she was helping at her little mixed drink bar and the other was just standing by the lemonade. So I asked her can I get a drink from you? She said in a nasty tone "not a mixed drink". I said how about a strawberry lemonade? She said NOPE you need to get it from her. I was thinking how weird that was because she was standing by the lemonade and just needed to grab 2 strawberries. But I guess I was interrupting her doing nothing. 

So I slid back over to the line and the nice lady put 2 strawberries in my cup and that stupid younger girl with the blackish/reddish bob brought over a glass of lemonade! WTF?!? The only reason she did that is because the bartender supervisor/manager guy had come over to check on things. I was so pissed. Lazy! Avoid Her!!!

Oh, and I am dying to know why the owner was interrupting the leader of the group at the end of the show. He looked mad so it was either he was mad it ran a bit over or it was too much. I think he was mad it ran late. I mean who wants to make a ton of money and only have to stay open until 12:00am?

So to sum it all up - Service terrible
Food- Terrible
Environment - Good 
Parking - Good

Happy New Year indeed! Or should I say in DUCE! Doctor and absolutely delicious meal at 'The Breadfruit' nearby, I was anxious to see the inside of this place. You see I initially found out about it thanks for perusing meetup.com... In usual rebel form after finding out that there was no cover charge, food options, and would look like a big open space full of wonder I was intrigued to visit the venue without going through the motions being approved to hang out with a group of strangers first. Sure enough right at half past eleven my beau and I traipse in, half asleep to discover some amazing 90 days party music, lots if games, a shop and even a massive gym fully equipped with a boxing ring smack dab in the middle of the place! I quickly got my second wind, found a lovely place to post up and start dancing and enjoy the black and blue mojito twice. Before I knew it we were counting down to midnight and then made our way over to enjoy a game of foosball, cornhole and some ping pong! Needless to say it was a great fun yet relaxed way to bring in the New Year. I'm looking forward to seeing what future events may happen here.

The Duce hosted the @instagramaz World Wide Instameet. It was my first time here, it was such an aesthetically beautiful place. Very unique. Great service and inside and outside seating. Some shopping too. Loved everything about this bar/lounge. They serve food too,  but didn't order anything. Definitely a must place to go if you go downtown. @theduce #theduce #yelp

This is yet another urban indoor/outdoor market place that is becoming very popular in the Valley.  Think of the food court at the mall.  Independent counters to order services/food from.  Then think of a circus.  Then think of the arcade  Then think of a bar.  Ok, got all those things in mind?  cool, you've got the picture.

Things I like:
1.  My sliders were great.  The Mac and Cheese muffings were just OK for me.
2. The craziness of it all.  its like walking through the mall food court.  You might see any kind of activiy on display (i.e. Mall fashion show, Mall concert, Mall boxing ring.)
3. Those drinks:  they are winners!
4. do they have concerts here?  Geez Louise!  I'd love to attend one there.

Things I'd like to see changed:
1. Nothing.

I loved this place.  so unique and so cool.

I had been wanting to visit The Duce for a real long time. Family visited and we meant to stop in for a drink, wound up staying the whole night!  Great vibe to the whole place, the staff is efficient, friendly and knowledgeable. Great concept of local produce used in their delicious beverages and entrees.  
Being in the fitness industry myself I can appreciate the work outs they put on as well. 
I take every visitor I have to this place!  Try the mojito!

I have mixed feelings about my experience at the duce. I took my mother, sister and girlfriend there on a Tuesday night and had a fun time overall. The positives are that the food is good, the building was large, and they had a unique list of beers: old style, schlitzz, and other Chicago-only beers.

Unfortunately, the waitress that took our order was very rude, the bartenders were blatantly talking about how to get more tips out of their customers,  and the macaroni and cheese muffins were not as good as Guy Fieri made them out to be. 

I would not recommend this place because of the service, the limited parking, and the uncomfortable seating. I could not see myself coming back unless they improved their menu, and worked on their customer service.

Everyone was awesome, except the bus boy. Over and over I and my friends hate how the bus boy prematurely clears unfinished expensive beverages from table when we're playing games even though our belonging are still on table and other people are chatting near the table. You literally have to guard your drinks with your life. Food was 'eh.'

A sure most try, The Duce is a very hipster family fun place were you can also enjoy a throw back beer and listen to awesome funky music and is perfect if you have younger ones in the group that hold you back from a regular bar/club I have seen children on a Friday night with family. Not a very big selection on drinks and I would not recommend the food, mostly a fun place to hang out after dinner.

Honestly an amazing place! I had seen it on diners drive ins and dives and i had a road trip to arizona so it was perfect! Yes it has a lot going on but it's so different from anything I've seen. It's something you can go enjoy with your family (day time) and something u can enjoy with friends/significant other at night. Hula hoop, boxing, ping-pong. And AMAZING food! That mac n cheese muffins r really good and the chicken pot pie! Yum! And the egg sausage and bacon sliders to die for!! It takes a while to receive food but I mean there's a lot going on so it will go by fast. Oh and think of a nickname because they will call u to pick up food by that name (;  and the drinks are really good too! Everything so fresh! Overall an amazing experience.
